Review_Date: Batemans wrote a review Yesterday
Review_Text: Thought we were try Marrakesh. Chose the Dar Atlas Resort as good price and all inclusive (which we don‚Äôt normally do) just wanted to relax and enjoy the sun.  The Hotel is ok Good points plenty of sun beds no reserving with towels happening. Big pool however very cold at moment but after a couple of minutes in it you adjust and it not so bad. Food is pleasant and plentiful at meal times food is not labelled to say what it is so you have to guess what it is. Lol.    One main bar. Drinks if you want cocktails forget it also the beer is served in sprit glasses so 2 swigs and it gone. However the beer is not weak it‚Äôs a reasonable 1/4 pint üòÇ.    The staff all seemed friendly. The entertainment is lacking professional acts. Basically you get the pool day team dragging people up to dance with them. No singing just music playing. Shame as live music would make the evenings more enjoyable for us.    Room was a bit tired and old but bed comfortable and nice sheets etc. No kettle. Also we had no furniture on our outside terrace. There seemed to be a struggle with towels at one point as ours got taken by cleaner and not replaced twice. Even thou we hung up as still want to us. I heard other people had same issues. (Maybe struggling with demand of people) . It was all good after the until last day. Went to breakfast came back & all towels goneüòÇ    We caught the bus into Marrakesh which is 20 md return each booked in advance. Well worth a visit. Very chaotic but enjoyable. We also did a 4x4 into the Atlas Mountains booked In hotel very little explanation of the day. It turn out ok. Views great but some of the stops and lunch could of been better.    All in all we enjoyed our stay but if to return we would probably try another Hotel. At best I would say its a 3-4 Star hotel but pleasant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just back from a week at this hotel!    After reading some reviews was a bit worried about going but honestly there was nothing to be worried about. The pool was freezing but once you got in it took a few mins and was fine!    The food was lovely a lot wasn‚Äôt labelled which wasn‚Äôt too great for my partner as he has allergies however everything I had was amazing g and fresh couldn‚Äôt have complained.    Every staff member was absolutely fantastic attentive and strove to answer any questions we had.    We booked all our excursions through the hotel and the staff there are second to none really took the time to explain and go through it with us so we got the best experience.    Mitchum at the bar could not have been better he really made our holiday with the fantastic service we received so a big thank you!    Mr tash also- fantastic    Don‚Äôt let the reviews put you off

Review_Date: GrandTour62120596125 wrote a review Mar 14
Review_Text: We have stayed 14 days at the beautiful Valeria Atlas nestled in the Atlas mountains Marakesh : On arrival we were welcomed by Zouhair the guest manager who looked after us on a daily basis with lots of care  happiness and compassion. The entertainment team  Mida and his friends would greet us  speak about culture and places we could visit  they always ask us go join in with  yoga french bowls and numerous games . All staff were more than happy to help us with anything we would want. Genuine help and communication every time we would meet.Our room was clean and chamber maids met all our needs to make sure we had a clean and comfortable room to rest.The hotel grounds and outdoors is spectacular maintained to high standards. We enjoyed beautiful walks through the tranquil gardens surrounded by orange trees palm trees and quiet spaces to rest. The gardeners work so hard to maintain green spaces where birds sing creating a wonderful atmosphere.We have travelled extensively with holidays in Europe and have never found such hospitality and the highest standard of cuisine. Every day the dining room staff waiters and chefs ensured we enjoyed our meals. We can only describe the food as excellent with a fantastic selection of food .We were made to feel like family and highly recommend the hotel Valeria for families and couples we cannot wait to come back we will miss you all. We want to say a special thank you to Zouhair for being such a wonderful person .

Review_Date: Becky Middleton wrote a review Mar 12
Review_Text: Nice hotel staff were great! Hotel rooms a little tired but good amenities. Pools big and plenty of loungers. Entertainment staff brilliant at getting everyone involved. Food fairly good but breakfast needed more warm options.

Review_Date: niblets wrote a review Mar 12
Review_Text: We picked this hotel for the price and value. From some of the reviews we read after booking we were a little concerned as to what we were going to get but we needn't have worried  There are around 16 rooms in each Riad (block) with an inner courtyard very pretty as you walk up to your specific Riad. The pathway from the main reception takes you amongst the orange trees and roses and with the birds singing is lovely at all times of the day and then put up very pretty at night.  Our room was comfortable we found the beds a bit hard but we did sleep. We had a quilt each as it was still the winter the pillows were ok although we had 1 each and 1 spare so we asked for an additional pillow which was provided immediately. The air conditioning worked well and was not too noisy. Free safe plenty of hanging space and storage space for clothes also a big mirror in the room and bathroom. Bathroom functional with good hot shower good toilet and large sink space with working reasonable hairdryer. The balcony was a good size with lots of flowers growing around it with 2 chairs and the afternoon sun. Room cleaned daily by pleasant cleaning staff who couldn't do enough for you. Some of the fixtures could do with a bit of upgrading the one plug was hanging out the wall a bit there were plenty of other plugs though and a working fridge. The furniture was a bit rustic but was useable.  The grounds...these are beautiful and a real plus for the hotel lots of gardens to walk through also a lovely wild pool where there are ducks guinea fowl etc and also a beautiful fountain..  Two lovely clean and well maintained swimming pools although the one I went in up at the quiet end was very cold but I soon got used to it.  We found the food tasty you have to be adventurous and also remember you are in Morrocco. We just tried everything and enjoyed it all. Make sure you don't miss the outside food for both breakfast and lunch. If you go out on the sun terrace from the restaurant and go to the left you can get omelettes fried eggs Morrocon crepes and a type of donut for breakfast. Lunch they do pizzas outside which were lovely with some salad.  The drinks are ok we tried a couple of the AI cocktails and didn't find them the best so stuck to the beer wine and Gin and tonic as these were good. You also get 1/2 bottles (as many as you want) of wine at evening dinner which we thought was a nice touch along with tablecloths etc...  The staff were generally good and pleasant we didn't partake with the animation activities and didn't at any time feel under pressure to do any of these but they work very hard and if you are someone who likes to do things on your holiday you won't be disappointed.  Finally one of the most pleasant staff members was Mr Tash....you'll see why when you meet him. He is the photographer but just generally a really nice guy. He remembered our names throughout the holiday and always spoke to us whenever he saw us. Of course we had our photos taken but didn't feel under pressure to do this. The pics aren't too expensive and are of good quality.  Would we go back definitely if we were ever to return Marrakesh as it was really good value and a very relaxing place to be. Thank you ‚ù§Ô∏è
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: My experience at Dar Atlas Resort
Review_Text: Have just had a great few days at this resort. The rooms are very clean the staff cannot do enough for you and the holiday reps are the same everyone is very friendly but maybe a bit over zealous as the reps try a bit too hard to get people involved when it is quite obvious they do not want to. This is a resort and there are a couple of shops outside but don‚Äôt expect a high street or any bars. The food is quite good the downers for the food was that hardly anything was labelled and when you have allergies to certain foods this is a must. Secondly again about the dinging hall the 2 coffee machines were always out of milk. I would have liked to see a couple of coffee machines dotted about around reception and other areas for self service as is only available when either the bar or canteens are open. It has been a nice peaceful break and would recommend to anyone who wants a quiet break.

Review_Date: john w wrote a review Mar 2
Review_Text: After arriving early evening was told go get food before check in well what was left was warm or cold chicken and veg and other food which we had no clue what it was all the eating times we never see a sign saying what the food was and was never hot.  going to the bar to get a beer was handed a glass which you would drink a short in and was also told only 1 at the time but after drinking it i did not want to drink any more as was like fizzy water just like the shorts they served to get a premium drink was told would have to pay which worked out at around ¬£7 or more and thats even if you are all inclusive.  The swimming pool was so cold no one got in it and entertament was a joke to nothing to do but silly games which lasted 20 to 30 minutes that if you like playing poker dartsand dancing and the music was mostly french or morrocian played loud but english music was turned down low. the rooms well nothing like the pictures shown ended uo with single beds pushed together and quilts that just about covered the bed broken bedside tables dirty table and chairs on tiny balcony Having been on many all inclusive holidays over 20 years i have to say i will never visit that place again. service was slow ques every day for food and drink.i could go on but its depressing me having wasted money on going there was looking after 1 day to move to the ibrostar 15 minutes down the road

Review_Date: kameliya wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Everyone were really lovely me and my friend came here. It seemed like a family friendly hotel. We saw they ah e activities for the kids. Entertainment for adults. The food is good and it was fresh food. Easy access to the centre. You have everything you need there.  We used the hairdressers facility the girl worked really well. Review_Date: HI wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: I would describe our experience at the Atlas as extremely disappointing. The food was always cold tasteless and nothing is labelled. The bread was stale everyday. The coffee machine was either empty or broken more days than not and when it was working the coffee was horrible. The restaurant where the buffet takes place is very similar to a school dinner hall. Very outdated and full of screaming children. The all inclusive drinks include very watered down spirits and cheap wine. The actual grounds of the hotel have potential to be lovely it just needs some attention and TLC. The entertainment team were very enthusiastic but also need to read the room and realise when someone doesn‚Äôt want to get up to join in with the 1000 activities a day. Great for kids but if you‚Äôre an adult wanting to relax and not get pestered it‚Äôs not ideal. If you want a relaxing traditional Moroccan break this is not the hotel for it- it‚Äôs very far out and there is nothing surrounding the hotel. We actually ended up spending money on a gorgeous little Riad in the Medina just to get a break from the run down hotel. On the plus side the rooms were clean and fresh towels were provided each day. All in all I would say the hotel is tacky and the food needs to improve massively. I am very confused at the 5 star ratings that have been left- it leaves a false impression of the reality.

Review_Date: Veronika P wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Definitely recommend super welcoming and lovely place to stay!!
Review_Text: We went here for 5 nights Feb 5 - Feb 10 for my mums birthday and the resort is AMAZING they‚Äôre super helpful with anything you need we needed extra towels and blankets in our room and they were sent up to our room in about 10 minutes. They have a shop on site which has all your basic supplies like shampoo and body wash as well as some snacks which is very helpful. The rooms are very comfortable there‚Äôs aircon which you can heat or cool the room depending which time of the year you‚Äôre visiting it‚Äôs a little bit older style but the beds are big and it provides a good night sleep so it was perfect for us. Everyone we met was super helpful and friendly I unfortunately didn‚Äôt get everyone‚Äôs name but they made us feel so welcome and it was very nice that whenever we walked past people they‚Äôd say hello and some of them would even start to have a chat with us. The food was stunning everyday we had a choice of something different at least 2 types of different meats and multiple veggie options and many different starters and desserts there was always some sort of pasta so it caters for everyone the only downside for food was breakfast as there was the same options every morning which got repetitive after the 3rd day but everything still tasted delicious at lunchtime you can also get a fresh oven baked pizza made in front of you! Inside of the resort they have an trip organisation shop we went on a few of the trips and they‚Äôre well worth it they‚Äôre quite cheap and you get to meet new people from the resort. As it was my mums birthday they made a cake for her for a small extra fee but it was so so special and about 15 people from the kitchen and waiters walked out to sing happy birthday in English french and Moroccan! And we also were gifted special cocktails for her birthday so everything they did for us was amazing and I‚Äôm very grateful for everyone that we met and I can‚Äôt wait to return again soon!

Review_Date: Ben P wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Great place and convenient out-of-town location
Review_Text: Lovely place to base yourselves for day trips to the medina. 15 mins by taxi 100-150D or 25 by shuttle bus at 120D return.    Firstly the Animation team are very good. The weather was inclement and they did well to keep spirits high.    Mr Tash was a family favourite though he kept beating me at Rummy!    The food was great by kitchen staff. The service team was a little less on the ball though possibly understaffed for the halfterm break post covid.    Front of house reception were good but we did have a big issue with our neighbour and they struggled to show much of a positive effect until we went to the animation manager who got right into the problem and resolved it.    Adjoining rooms are separated by a hollow door and there is very little sound proofing.    Spotless rooms and around the resort.    We didn‚Äôt let the neighbour issue impact on the holiday. Overall thoroughly recommend this venue.

I cannot fault my stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: elliot w wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: All inclusive? Thimble sized glasses. You need to pay after 11. Foodies stay away 3 star in disguise
Review_Text: Firstly reading some of the 5 star reviews really has me questioning if we stayed in the same place! I think the entertainment staff are keeping the hotels head above water. They are brilliant really friendly and engaging. That‚Äôs the only positive I can say.    The hotel is run down old damaged and dilapidated. It‚Äôs in desperate need of refurbishing and/ or regrading.    I found 1-2 friendly bar staff all the others felt like they were doing you a favour when they served your drink in the smallest tumbler they could find regardless of what was ordered.    The food in the restaurant is bland boring and lazy. The food tasted really unseasoned. Bearing in mind this is supposed to be a 4 star resort often tables have no cutlery glasses or napkins.    The room:  It was very hot with no remote to turn it down. We asked multiple times at reception and was plainly ignored.  The furniture was tired and dirty 1 bath towel for 2 people dirty sheets on arrival and again mid stay (old blood!)    The balcony is nicely designed but old dirty plastic furniture (4 stars?!?)    Paying for water after 11pm I thought it was all inclusive? ‚Ç¨10 deposit for a pool towel I thought this was a 4 star resort?    As I said at the start I think people are bonding with the entertainment staff and ignoring a host of issues with this resort. The 5 star reviews from said people will lead to a lot of disappointment for other guests. Hence my 1 star review

Review_Date: Watson wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Considering the area this probably is a 3 star hotel at a push but generally the hotel found many ways to disappoint. The room was wiped clean although dusty and I had a stained pillow to sleep on.  I‚Äôll be honest I was taken here for my 40th birthday so I was willing to let most things go as it was free to me however it became a bit irritating.    The hotel started well we arrived just as lunch ended but they noticed we were hungry and the staff kindly put together a plate of food for us and waited until we ate to clear away very nice and appreciated. Sadly this is where going beyond ended. The food was always luke warm at best or cold and not very nice to be honest. One evening there wasn‚Äôt any crockery nor cutlery and after twenty minutes of waiting and searching for some we found nothing left to eat other than the salads and bread and this was only 40 minutes into the 2 hour window for all inclusive dinner.  The first breakfast I had 2 fried eggs which were not cooked properly so from then on I had omelette which was nice. However 3 days into the trip there were no eggs at all nor omelette as an option.  To be honest I could write 50 things about this hotel and why not to go there but the main ones that most people would probably care about is that the food isn‚Äôt good the service isn‚Äôt good anything other than wine or beer is diluted or unavailable. Many of the staff are rude and the rooms were crap. The shower floods the bathroom the lights barely light the room. You will be lucky to get more than 1 towel you will be paying for your drinks after 11pm you will be writing the same review as me a week later.  Marrakech generally is an experience like no other but the hotel itself could could be so much better.  Hope this helps.

Review_Date: Andrew D wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Entertainment team very friendly and informative  Was here for valentines and the decorations activities were very good and a lot of effort put in by the activity team and staff  In all plenty to do ‚Ä¶ friendly atmosphere and great experience

Review_Date: Kelly wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: in no way a 4 star hotel
Review_Text: This hotel is barely a 3 star let alone 4. Official pictures are very generous but the reality is very different. Rooms are basic which isn‚Äôt an issue it‚Äôs just somewhere to rest your head but ours was not even clean. The bed sheets were stained the floor dirty the shower unclean the bedside table drawers had to be forced to open and were filthy inside. What 4 star hotel has dirty old plastic lawn chairs for balcony seating?    When we arrived the heating/air con unit was on full blast and over heating the room but there was no remote control to turn down the temperature. We asked 3 times for a control to turn it down and it never materialised. In the end we had to borrow one from another guest.    The food is dire it‚Äôs not just bland but mostly inedible. I will say though the bread and pastries were good. The restaurant also smells badly of grease which lingers on your clothes and hair. One night there was no cutlery or glasses to be had and staff did not seem to care.    Many of the staff were very friendly but some were just plain rude. One of our group was spoken to so rudely she made a complaint.    Wifi is very unreliable and barely works in the rooms. We also only had 1 towel between us for the first 2 days.    If you are all inclusive any drinks you want after 11pm  you have to pay for including water.    The hotel is generally run down and badly in need of refurbishment and regrading 4 stars are exceptionally misleading and not reflective of the quality or the hotel food and service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ifhaz Z wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Very nice resort to enjoy some privacy. Family friendly and staff are very hospitable. Entertainers and Performers are great and accommodate you to your needs. There‚Äôs also a night club on the resort if you fancy a change in vibe.

Review_Date: Julia S wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: We have recently visited this hotel. The hotel is absolutely stunning lots of fun things to do! The entertainment team are brilliant really friendly and speak really good English especially Rico and Mario!! The restaurant offers a wide choice of food! I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: jonah176 wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: i dont know where some of you lot stayed. but i know is wasn't the same hotel i did. Valeria Dar Atlas Resort.just got home.1 couple had 2 kids no kettle to make baby bottle.move room 4 times (no heating) moved to another hotel.if stopping for 3/4 days you could manage. food the same every other day.set up for the french. i know on 2 occasions some guests where asked to move from tables so the french could sit there.service was terrible.coffee served only in the a.m in the dining room. birds flying in standing all over the bread & pooing.we stayed there for 12 days. got to the hotel about 10.30 pm restaurant closed but was offered a salad for evening meal.rang easyjet to change hotels was told i would have to pay another ¬£1100.TAKE CARE & DONT BELIEVE ANY OF THEM.

Review_Date: angela a wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: I have had a fabulous holiday was treated 5 star by each and every member of staff  The entertainment every evening has been fun and no one is left out and as I‚Äôve been on my own as my friend had to leave as family emergency  The staff have been so lovely and made me feel special and kept me company  The staff in the eating areas are fantastic nothing is too much and they r ember your needs each day offering all drinks and different food.  The games they play during the day are so fun you can never get board and if you do want some quiet time they respect this too  I have totally enjoyed my time here and would recommend this hotel to singles couples and families  The entertainment guys are the best I‚Äôve ever met and I‚Äôve travelled far and wide the Moroccans are so respectful and friendly nothing is too much and they smile and clap all day long  If you don‚Äôt believe me book and see for yourself

Review_Date: camboiskid wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Didn't expect to take ill while at Valeria but the response was tremendous. I was provided with oxygen and nursing care free by the site nurse Imane while  yahaya ran backwards and forwards seeking drinks and food. Fortunately it was the last day of our holiday and we got home safely Incredible value lovely food decent accommodation and initially cold but the very sunny weather. $th visit to Morocco and loved all four.

Review_Date: Anju B wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Excellent stay and visit  Highly recommended resort. Buildings are beautiful and reception is large and clean. Restaurant offer a very good variety of food and massive dining hall and buzzing. Entertainers were fab. The pool is big and clean and loved the water classes such as zumba and water aerobics. I went with 7 people and would go again. The staff for excursions were so helpful and friendly and taxis always available outside. Next door hotel allow you to use their waterpark too.  Room service could be a bit slow and the wifi isnt too bad. Only once socket in room. Toilet and shower rooms are separate The spa within is also great. Hotel is far out and takes roughly 25-30 mins to menara mall. Hotel minibus available for market and mall trips for a little payment extra.  Happy overall

Review_Date: DJD wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Stayed in late January and our stay coincided with unseasonably cold weather so the pools restaurant and bar areas were freezing. The hotel isn't geared to cold weather although heating was provided in the rooms. Guests can use the heated pool in the sister resort next door though and there is a heated indoor pool.    Grounds and pools were superb and provided a lovely setting for the holiday. I would imagine that in spring the flowers would be fantastic.  The rooms are a bit tired but had everything that we needed and they were cleaned every day.  We found most of the staff very helpful and friendly. We arrived at 10.15 pm after the restaurant had closed and there was a plate of food ready for us - very welcome after travelling and I have never experienced that service in any other AI resort!  The odd problem we had with the room was dealt with immediately.    Some waiters in the restaurant could be a bit unhelpful at times however the animation team went out of their way to engage with guests all the time whether you were taking part in the activities or not. A lovely bunch of people who are a credit to the hotel.    We found the food very good with plenty of choice however it is generally Moroccan so be warned if you want chips burgers etc there is absolutely nothing for you and you will be disappointed (and hungry)! It wasn't labelled but that wasn't a problem - try it and if you don't like it then leave it!  The food could be improved by keeping it hotter during mealtimes though and they sometimes ran out of spoons and bowls but everything was freshly cooked and the restaurant was spotless.    The location is a bit isolated and a taxi ride to Marrakech would be about ¬£12 each way but the shuttle bus runs regularly and is only about ¬£4 return and very easy to use. Plenty of superb excursions available via the hotel or other providers.    An ATM is available in the sister hotel next doorbut it is essential to get cash at the airport when you arrive. WiFi was very good in the hotel but if you use your UK SIM out there it is very expensive so we bought a Moroccan SIM in the airport arrivals hall. Maroc Telecom - 200 Dhyram for 20 Gb but they also accept 20 Euros or ¬£20.    The biggest downside was lack of a minimart nearby. There are some shops on-site but they don't sell anything particularly useful so if you want soft drinks snacks etc you can't buy them. Also no other restaurants nearby and the in-house Moroccan and European restaurants were shut as the hotel was pretty empty. Marrakech though is amazing for restaurants of every type.  All in all we loved Morocco and Marrakech and look forward to returning soon. Apart from a few minor downsides the hotel exceeded our expectations and we will stay there again next time we go the Marrakech.

Review_Date: GJmmiaL wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: I‚Äôd like to thank all the staff at this hotel it‚Äôs has made my first trip here very special so welcoming.  Clean room fantastic food and best of all a amazing group of entertainers we will definitely be back and hope to see you all soon smiley hieham said Sania sam rico and so many more thank you

Review_Date: Christopher B wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: I really enjoyed my break here. I accept some of the criticism in other reviews but personally I was happy. I found the food fine although I enjoy Morrocan flavours. True English cuisine may be missing but no problem for me. The room met requirements comfy and well cleaned. The bar was fine bar staff more than helpful albeit limited selection.. Staff here are great I enjoyed boules  darts etc etc and entertainment. Would I return-- yes later this year
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Curtis F wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Was a good comfortable hotel and stayed for one week in January 2023. The grounds were lovely room was basic and bed was very comfy. WiFi worked fine overall with some outages late at night but seemed to remedy itself and worked better early in the morning. Staff were friendly enough and the entertainment crew Mario and Ayoub put a smile on our faces! Food gets quite repetitive here and would have liked more options than pain au chocolats or tagines. Bar staff need to work on their customer service skills as they took forever to serve me my beers; which were in a tiny glass smaller than a mobile phone- on one occasion the barman asked me to bring my glasses back? And some drinks aren't all-inclusive which is misleading as you should not have to pay for anything extra in an AI hotel. Shower worked fine but hairdryer was very basic so bring your own unless you want a slow experience drying your hair. Was relieved there was other English speakers on holiday there as read before this hotel caters better to French speakers but had no issue finding friends for the week or having a conversation in English. Didn't use the swimming pool as was freezing outside and nor did anybody else for that reason. I would happily return to Morocco and would recommend this hotel to other people but I am unsure if I would return to this hotel. There is no kettle in the rooms and the coffee machine in the restaurant is present at breakfast and taken away afterwards to be replaced with a choice of three soft drinks- Pepsi (was actually Coke) 7Up or Orangeade. I wish the hotel would read my review and act upon these improvements as I'm a Scotsman I find the beer portions ridiculous and think the response to a customer at the bar should always be "no problem" or "yes sure". Not a bad place for winter sun to beat the January blues!

Review_Date: janet wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Great hotel lots of trips to do or just stay around the pool good food and drinks. Nice restaurants friendly helpful staff. Entertainment team were excellent - Oumaima and Mario in the entertainment team were fantastic. Highly recommended üëçüëç
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: ListyI wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: Excellent Animation team always give 100% they work day & night to keep guests happy & entertained all staff are extremely helpful & friendly  Restaurant had some amazing food which was very varied  We attended a couple of excursions which were great days out‚Ä¶.port visit & Atlas Mountains there is also a shuttle bus for a small price which takes you into Marrakech  Overall we would highly recommend this hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lyn wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Service from the waiters in the restaurant and bar towards people of colour was appalling! In the restaurant during meals not once did a waiter approach our table to serve us with wine or water one waiter (Hamza) in particular went as far to tell in a very high handed manner that we should refer to him as ‚Äòsir‚Äô when we called him to ask for wine. An experience at this hotel not to be repeated sadly.  The Guest services manager went out of his way to address the problem with his staff and the change in attitude was a 100% turnaround which simply highlighted how badly we had been served all week even more.  Bar drinks for the all inclusive ‚Ä¶.terrible!  The entertainers Mario and Ayoub in particular were warm friendly respectful and a lot of fun. Great energy.  Location a bit out of the way but good shuttle service for excursions and into town.

Review_Date: carly j wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: Entertainers and most staff were incredible
Review_Text: Had great holidaythe entertainers were amazing  Mario (staff member ) was such an amazing help and so much fun!  Really did make it special for us.  Can‚Äôt fault the entertainers at all ..  best time in moroccco
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: carey wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Stayed here over Christmas had a great time but fell ill just prior to my intended leave date the staff were quite wonderful and treated me so well particularly my cleaner in room 408 and the waiters at the restaurant the management were also great as I had to stay an extra 4 days!    The hotel itself is mainly set up for French visitors however they have installed a very friendly chap Yaya who was very accommodating there is one heated pool during the winter which was very busy with mainly families there was a quite pool area but with no heating which was the hotels only fault.    The food was varied each day and for the price of the holiday was good value.    A special thank you Thomas (spelt incorrectly) the waiter outside in the court area who couldn‚Äôt have been any nicer and friendly thanks for looking after me!

Review_Date: Sara A wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: My husband and I had such a wonderful time in Marrakesh and at this hotel. On arrival the staff were very welcoming and professional. The hotel guest manager was really helpful from before our arrival as he organised our taxi transfers and ensured we had a lovely room for our anniversary. Our room was spacious clean and bright! We had a lovely balcony with beautiful views of the grounds. The grounds itself were well maintained and the spacious gardens were beautiful. The hotel is exceptionally clean!! It was very peaceful and quiet and we had a very relaxing stay. The animations team were amazing and kept us entertained through out our stay. The Moroccan night was outstanding I loved the belly dancing! Shout out to "super Mario" who was so friendly funny and kind. "Sam" was great too as were all the animations team with their amazing dancing. Food was plentiful and fresh. We loved the breakfast in particular and the fresh flat bread. The shuttle bus to the town was well organised and we loved going to the medina and through all the markets! We felt really safe and the people of Marrakesh were very friendly and lovely! We will definitely be coming back to Marrakesh again next year and booking the same wonderful hotel!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Una M wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Excellent hotel so clean gorgeous. Staff were the jewel in the crown as they were so friendly helpful and made us feel so welcome. Food was gorgeous and plentiful we stayed all inclusive the drinks weren‚Äôt brilliant but it didn‚Äôt mar our stay. Complimentary shuttle bus took us into the centre of town which was brilliant! I would highly recommend

Review_Date: Oska Mirfin wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: A very good service and welcoming spirit at the hotel. The entertainers have to the best I've ever come across before as well as the food being exceptionally well made and tasteful. The on site pools and activities are really superb for their performance. The hotel rooms are well made each day by the maids and the greenery is kept up to a high standard. There is also plenty of wildlife in the resort.

Review_Date: Sara Clark wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Excellent holiday hotel superb food excellent entertainment super really relaxed really clean staff really helpful highly recommend will return probably one of the best holidays we‚Äôve had in a long time. Spa is very good and pools good location stress free

Review_Date: Simo S wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Spending few days here was great idea from my wife  I liked it everything was great all staff was nice entertainment did great job makes my staying so nice and funny thank you all especially Mr Kader was incredible person will makes your holiday a comdy show :) thank you Kader thank you all ..

Review_Date: Everlife G wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: I had a wonderful stay at Valeria dar atlas sun January 2023. The hotel was lovely the bar staff was great and the entertainment staff was amazing! I highly recommend staying at Valeria dar atlas!

Review_Text: First time to try inclusive hotel As a couple I would recommend it I stayed there for 4 days the food are delicious and the drinks are optional.  Special thanks to the entertainment for the good effort

Review_Date: Judith C wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: 1st visit to Morocco, will not be my last
Review_Text: Before booking my 1st holiday in 4 years I of course read the reviews most being very favourable. So here we are and I have to say this is my 1st all inclusive holiday and it hasn't disappointed me at all.  As a veggy the food is lovely I wish they'd label the food but it's easy enough to ask and they're only too happy to help.  I recently read a review that was very dismissive of the entertainment staff I have to say they're talking nonsense as the staff always put on a good show so thank you to Sam Mido Kader Smiley Ayoub Fatima Oumaima Sania Rico & Amin.  The bar staff go out of their way to provide a friendly service and never cease to make you smile so thank you to Said Ahmed & Hisham.  Also the weather was amazing!

Review_Date: trvl84155 wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: A great winter break in the Moroccan sun! We got exactly what we paid for the rooms extremely clean and quite spacious the walks to breakfast in the morning with the birds in full song and orange trees lining the path very charming! The food could be better but it‚Äôs all inclusive and if you‚Äôve been AI before then you know how it is. The absolute best thing here is the staff Hicham Ahmed Said at the bar - brilliant! Sam is the entertainments manager and does the best job at leading his team huge thanks to Kadir Mido Rico Ayoube Smilie all who keep the pace going even when it‚Äôs quiet and more of a challenge thanks for making our week! You‚Äôll also find Zhouhar around near reception or in the restaurant genuinely asking how you are and how your day has been. Make sure you book the shuttle bus to the Madina it‚Äôs chaos but the most refreshing kind when you get the hang of it. Marrakesh you‚Äôve been wonderful.

Review_Date: Dominique G wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: All inclusive is not worth it the food is underwelming and the drinks are watered down on our second to last night we decided to pay for premium drinks that aren't part of the all inclusive and we actually caught them watering them down I get the impression they think we are stupid.  We went on a few excursions and the sucked the fun out of everything by milking as much money as they can out of us even though we had paid good money for them most of the staff are a bunch of chavs and all they are after is your hard earned money literally everything we did they expect to be tipped or paid for the pleasure everyday we felt we had been mugged off or robbed.  Service was bad apart from a select few staff and that is not very many.  The entertainment team are a bunch of sleeze balls that all they want to do is try it on with the hotel guests and get them back to there rooms if you are a single lady look out.  The hotel was in the middle of nowhere so there wasn't anything to do couldn't walk to a shop to get snacks ect the surrounding areas were slums.  The only good part of the holiday was the lovely sunshine but my partner and I will never return and would never recommend morocco to anyone of my friends!!! Big thumbs down üëé
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: edgyreggie wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Very disappointed.  Rooms tired and dated. Multiple issues with things broken or not working.  Food very bland and tasteless.  Lack of variety and few labels to even work out what half of it was.  Drinks watered down with limited options on all inclusive.  Staff friendly but clearly resort is understaffed.  Will never return in this lifetime.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: leah h wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Rooms are lovely very spacious. Staff are very friendly. Entertainment staff are all very lovely and very interactive with guests.  The dance shows were fantastic from start to finish I couldn‚Äôt take my eyes away. Food is lovely always something different to try labels could be use to say what the dishes are!

Review_Date: steven o wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Hotel clean and very friendly good choice of food staff go that extra mile to make your holiday that bit extra special..entertainment staff 5 stars for there continued efforts with daily activities well recommended..

Review_Date: vic079 wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: Went 30/12 for the New Year which I have to say was an excellent night.. Wasn't sure what to expect having read so many bad reviews. I am well travelled and stayed in 1 star to 5 star accommodation. I will try and put over my opinion based on my own experience.  There was absolutely no distinction over the French and English tourists. The attention and service was excellent. Tables set out when you went in to dine and offered wine through out your meal. We were in Morocco so no English fried breakfast but lots of nice food to choose from at every service. For those who complain about the food then stick to Benidorm.  Rooms were a bit outdated but clean. The house keeper provided clean towels loo rolls etc. every day.  Never had a problem with drinks at the bar and yes if you take your own glass they will let you use it.  For the money we paid and the service we got it was a value for money holiday.  The lady who works in the excursions office is so helpful and the trips are also great value for money.  A big shout out for the waiter called Heyub (don't know how to spell it but this is how its pronounced) he was so attentive and nothing was too much trouble.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kirstin G wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: The hotel itself is an impressive building with lovely grounds areas are clean and guests are greeted with a refreshing virgin mojito. There is an entertainment team keen to get people involved and arrange activities based on interested numbers which isn't my cup of tea so I was glad to not be forced into taking part in Zumba. The food is of great quality - there is so much choice for every meal even including more expensive foods like lamb tagine or paella with extra large prawns and mussels.  The only thing to be conscious of is that this is a Muslim country and physical contact is frowned upon even in the confines of the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nikkia27 wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: We stayed here for a Twixmas break in December - highly recommend it. Beautiful hotel and grounds lovely Hamman/spa volleyball court tennis courts indoor pool & more.    Great entertainment team and a good location.    I read a few complaints about the food before I went but actually there it was great. Note - there are no food labels on anything apart from the jams at breakfast so it's all a bit of a guessing game. I LOVED the fact that there was no English breakfasts - you're in another country so enjoy the local food! The moroccan pancakes (cooked outside) are especially super tasty for breakfast and we had lots of fresh fruits and tasty treats for dessert.    Dinner was a bit of a bun fight but there was always something I could eat - plenty of aubergines veggies a delicious chicken pie one evening and freshly carved meats.    Outside of the food we used the resort shuttle to head in to the main souk and we also did one of their tours of the markets which was good if a little rushed at the end.    We thoroughly enjoyed our break.

Review_Date: Anu wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: Avoid this is 0 star hotel not 4 star at any angle
Review_Text: I have book this hotel to relax but since I came we are only stressing room very outdated toilet and bathroom very dirty tile fridge don‚Äôt work food very bland my husband accidentally left his jacket In buffet we were the last person to leave the restaurant the next day when we came to ask reception lady who was very rudely told us maybe some tourists took it away instead of trying to help to find it Aqua club is close indoor pool close if you are late for dinner you won‚Äôt get nothing since restaurant is close at 7.30-9.30. TERRIBLE

Review_Text: Perfect vacationentertainment with perfect shows all night and thanks for the entertainment staff because really friendly KimoRekoSamSaniaSmilyMidoChikoFatimaFayroz good food/drinks in the hotel and the enviroment is really nice.Show/disco every nightvery good service in the barnice coctails and very nice staffvery nice food in the snack bar and the restaurant as well.

Review_Date: Monika D wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: It was a fairly good hotel - we went for Christmas and the New Year's and the experience for these festivities was nice. The food looked really nice and there was a fair variety of it. Review_Date: nicblue13 wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Title: Absolutely awful hotel, avoid at all costs
Review_Text: The hotel favours French & African people. If you are British do not come to this hotel. Our room had to be changed as it had wires hanging out of the ceiling & walls the shower didn‚Äôt work correctly. The room was dirty the balcony had no furniture etc etc where do I stop. They did change the room but not much better. The beds are so hard it‚Äôs like sleeping on plywood. The food in the restaurant is just about passable if you can actually get any. Although the restaurant states that it is open for 2 hours don‚Äôt be fooled. After the food has gone in the first 30 minutes you will then fight to get any as for all inclusive drinks you have to basically beg for a small bottle of wine at dinner and the rest of the drinks in the bars are so watered down you may as well drink water. The staff at the hotel are rude and arrogant. The entertainment is abysmal. The pools are not heated and all very basic. I couldn‚Äôt wait to leave. Do not book this hotel no matter if you think you are getting a good deal.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: nathan b wrote a review Dec 2022

Review_Date: Jess B wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Title: Great family hotel for Christmas sunshine and full bellies!
Review_Text: After reading some negative reviews before writing this one I wondered if the authors were a) staying somewhere else or b) knobjockeys. This is a hotel in Africa with international guests where most people are not white and the food is not baked beans and hotpot - how wonderful! We've met people from Somalia Iraq Germany France and Yorkshire!  The food was excellent. My two children found something they liked and even tried new foods (but for fussy eaters you can have pasta if you want). The salad bar was great the Petit fours type desserts were great the veg meat and fish were all delicious. For reviewers complaing that they ran out of chips - stick to Butlins or Benedorm - this is not the place for you. You must ask a waiter to bring you wine (but they bring it quickly - rose was our favourite). And yes occasionally they run out of plates and you have to wait 20 seconds and go on a treasure hunt to find salt but that's all part of an all inclusive where let's face it we all become greedy animals that eat 10 courses!. Breakfast was amazing - omelette cooked to order outside boiled eggs tomatoes spicy sausages potatoes cheeses fruits yoghurt cereals and pastries - oh my god  I ate so many pain au chocolate and learnt to toast them using the toaster conveyor belt... coffee machine excellent fresh juice hot chocolate.... If you don't put on 14lbs then I don't understand how!!!  Entertainment team- if you want to avoid then you can as there's lots of beautiful gardens and sun loungers around this vast place. There's a lake with ducks and orange trees and bougainvillea everywhere. If you want to join in playing darts or learn to Belly dance then they will welcome you whole heartedly.thet are particularly good with kids. Special mention for Tash man the photographer who is genuinely lovely and interested in everyone and so friendly with all the kids. They are full of energy and probably don't get paid enough!  We were here over Christmas. There was special events and they decorated with European Christmas stuff everywhere. Santa arrived by camel with gifts for the kids a living Nativity with donkey lamb and wise men a cabaret show (think Spain 1988 - great fun). Gala dinner with seafood and turkey!  Rooms are a little tired but make the best of it - for the reviewers with their glass half full I suspect that they never have anything nice to say about anything. We came with easyJet and paid just under ¬£2000 for 4 of us and think that it's exceptional value - remember how much we've saved not buying Christmas food!  We went on two trips - Atlas mountains and central Marrakech with museum and gardens. They were great but be prepared to spend some cash on souvenirs as the driver inevitably pulls up and a knows just the shop to go to etc. But we should spend some money here - wages are not the best and the people are tolerant friendly and the souvenirs don't cost much.  We would come here for winter sun again. Pack a couple of hoodies for early morning and evening but shorts and t-shirts 12 til 5.  Thanks to all staff at Dar Atlas xxx

Review_Date: Sims wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Title: LOWEST standard for a 4* hotel EVER!!
Review_Text: Dear Reader this hotel has got the LOWEST standard for a 4* hotel EVER!! Do NOT be fooled by the photos. We (4 Adults) booked through BA and were assured that their representatives check the hotel standard so don‚Äôt cancel based on the reviews. This couldn‚Äôt be further from the truth! All I can say is that there is NO standard either BA reps have had exceptional service which is not the norm or they haven‚Äôt actually visited the correct hotel. In summary this was how our 8 day stay panned out:  - This was NOT an English speaking hotel. 98% of the staff do not understand and those that claim they do nod. Even when using google translate they seem not to read French or Arabic  - Only 1 keycard for the room given. If you ask for another the original keycard is deactivated. Be prepared to play ‚Äúfollow the leader‚Äù if you share the room with family/friends  - Bed linen was not changed on a regular basis  - If we were not entertained by the Moroccan TV we could hear our neighbours‚Äô shower toilet being flushed singing and MORE!  - Body wash was refilled on rations even after asking multiple staff. On the third day when I escalated to the Hotel Rep Manager a staff member was sent (no housekeeping in the evening) and handed me a refill to replace it myself. No other toiletries are supplied!! Toilet paper is also given on rations  - Housekeeping insisted that 2 towels were sufficient for 4 adults! Had to complain at Reception and wait over an hour for more towels. Repeated almost every day!  - Room telephone was not working on arrival and after repeated requests I had to ask a technician inspecting the room key to fix it  - Crockery and cutlery left in the room was repeatedly not removed for days by housekeeping  - Ants crawling in the room due to lack of proper cleaning  - No iron ironing board or kettle. You can forget the mini-bar and any room service!  - The gym consists of 1 threadmill and 1 bike. Cost to use is 100dhr per day  - You will not get a bottle of water before 10am. This is because the mini-bar can only give water!! If you are going for an excursion remember to pick up water the night before.  - No large glasses are allowed to be given out for drinking water. These are for cocktails. Need to make multiple trips as small glasses are only used  - After asking and using google translate we were still given food containing egg!! Thankfully a serious allergy didn‚Äôt occur  - No food labelling in restaurant forget even thinking about allergens!! There is a board as your enter the restaurant in the smallest font and you will need to figure out what is what!! Chefs will smile and state they ate pork accidentally so if you eat something you don‚Äôt normally ‚Äúit‚Äôs okay‚Äù!  - Do not expect the kitchen staff to accommodate your requests. Something as simple as ‚Äòchips‚Äô took 30mins or so to negotiate. When we went back to collect them another conversation had to be restarted if they could be made?!  - No food after 9:30pm. If you catch the late shuttle back you will need to wait until breakfast. Mini-bar opens at 10am and closes at 11pm.  - There are birds cats and flies in the restaurant. Staff are standing around busy talking and not ensuring some sort of hygiene is maintained  - A single tong is used for all desserts not suitable for those who are vegetarian/vegan/other allergens. There is no concept of separate food catering for veg/non-veg i.e the same pizza cutter is used for all pizzas etc..  - Old food/bread is recycled the next day  - Temperature of food is very hit and miss. 8 times out of 10 it‚Äôs luke-warm  - Generally you are eating A LOT of the same vegetables. These are boiled courgettes/carrots saut√©ed aubergines/green peppers/grilled tomatoes.  - Our mother was told by Restaurant Management she was ‚Äúbeing watched‚Äù to pick up some salad on second trip to the restaurant. It‚Äôs supposed to be an ‚Äòall inclusive‚Äô so why approach the guest and question a small plate of food! Makes no sense?  - There were more staff eating in the restaurant than there were guests when we arrived  - Three varieties of sodas all of which are ‚Äòextremely‚Äô watered down!!  - Shuttle service last service is at 9:30pm. The timings are quite random. In our first experience we waited over 30mins to board  Finally on a light positive note the SPA is nice! We paid for 3 services and got 2 as the jacuzzi wouldn‚Äôt heat up even after being there for 90mins! You can‚Äôt have it all :)

I totally accept responsibility for my actions and I don‚Äôt mind paying for what I had done! But that was taking the biscuit! Plus lots of flies  and cats and dogs running around the food area

Review_Date: Maryam A wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Title: enjoyed stay but needs some improvement
Review_Text: stayed at dar atlas in November for 5 nights . We enjoyed our stay at the resort. The entertainment team was superb and kept us entertained. They would always check on us and make sure that we are involved in activities. The reception staff was great too and helped with any queries . There were few things that I thought could have been better - food was a little repetitive and finger food like chips wasn‚Äôt part of the menu. The snacks bar didn‚Äôt have much! The rooms are little dated and needs revamp. Apart from this the services were great . The shuttle service provided by the resort was great and always on time. The resort was beautiful and was only half hr away from the centre. Thank you to all the staff at dar atlas.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Russtasia wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: This is a great family hotel. We stayed for 10 days (a 6-months old baby parents and grandparents). Went all-inclusive in November 2022.  - Animators work tirelessly to create a fun and joyful environment. Lots of daily activities from darts to football to dance classes and diverse shows/ performances.  - Food was good. Some comments say that there are no signs making it hard to pick what you want to eat. They have attempted to fix it by putting signs (occasionally) although if you ask you almost always get a response. Breakfast foods are always the same (all you need really) however lunch and dinner foods varied. Some of us don‚Äôt eat meat and for sure didn‚Äôt go starving.  - Rooms are a little outdated however really comfortable and spacious. Cleaning was done daily. The hotel complex is really nicely set out.  - Wifi was good for us in the rooms and on the premises. Good enough for Zoom/ Skype calls watching videos social media etc.  - Perfect hotel for a ‚Äòlazy‚Äô holiday if you want to chill eat dance and sleep next to the pool.

Review_Date: Icy S wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: Bar staffs were amazing and the entertainment was amazing. Very lovely staffs and always ready to help you. We had shows every night which was amazing the staffs made sure everyone was enjoying themselves and comfortable. Will visit again

Review_Date: richard p wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Great relaxing time had at the Dar Atlas Resort
Review_Text: Just has a wonderful week at the Dar Atlas Resort. Room was perfect nice terrace overlooking the tennis courts very clean room thanks to the maid service. Hotel facilities were great... two gorgeous pools one lively and once quiet. The entertainment team were very helpful and fun. Thanks to the team who showed us how to cook using Moroccan tagine the stretching and dance classes and the daily theme tune dance around the pool. We loved the tennis facilities petanque courts. Food was good... especially the salads and also via the hotplate meals team. Omelettes and pizza's were delish. Thanks. We stayed all inclusive and the bar staff were helpful and friendly. Acholic and non acholic cocktails coffee regular and Moroccan tea on tap all day and night. If you live sweet patisseries they had loads of tasty cakes and puddings.. Easy to book trips and shuttles to and from the City. Fabulous day temperatures for November. Special thanks to Zouhir the guest manager who helped me out on a special project... you are a star. Just the perfect location for a winter getaway. Very clean hotel.

Review_Date: Aisha R wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: First of all the staff that greeted us were all extremely friendly no complaints there at all. There was one staff member in particular who was always coming around and asking all the families how we were doing which was a really nice touch. The one thing this hotel need to improve on is food as for the 5 days we were there they didnt have any child friendly food no chips/fires whatsoever. Therefore my child had to eat pasta for 5 days straight! We did ask the staff member to see if they could include chips in the menu and he said he tried his best but they didn't include it which was fine but still disappointing as my child was asking for them and he is autistic. Granted I should've done my research before going but I had heard from several people that the food was suitable for fussy eaters. I completely disagree as even I and my parents were restricted with what to eat. Most days we would survive on fruit bread and butter. The snack bar wasn't great either they only had soggy pancakes which a runny chocolate sauce and reheated pastries from the morning which were lacklustre. Instead of including savouries in the snack bar it was all sweet stuff. Another thing that they could improve on was that they kept running out of plates bowls and cutlery. We were constantly having to ask some of the staff to bring more bowls etc out. The staff were helpful and did so but if there was enough out they wouldn't have to go through the hassle.  Rooms were clean and tidy no complaints.  Overall it is a nice hotel but a few areas could do with improving.

Review_Date: vicksg wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Wonderful solo stay, perfect choice for a relaxing break
Review_Text: I booked my first ever solo holiday and chose Dar Atlas from its excellent reviews and the strength of its entertainment team. If I was going to be alone all the time at least I'd have lots of activities to join in with.  What a great decision I made! The ents team are simply brilliant and there is always something to do despite it being off season and fairly quiet in the hotel. I would like to specifically mention Rico Kimo Youseff and Amin but they are all great.  All the staff were lovely. I had a bar man at each bar who spoilt me rotten (Ahmed and Salah) as did my evening waiter Mahmoud.  As mentioned the rooms are a little tired but they are scrupulously clean and comfortable. I did turn my mini fridge off as it made a little popping sound in the night. If you have rooms near the pool you will hear the noise of the entertainment but this always finishes by 11pm at the latest.  There is a main pool with a children's pool and then hidden away is the wonderful Zen pool which is extremely quiet and empty (at least in November). It was great to have the choice.  The drinks aren't great. A short list of cocktails none of which tend to taste much of alcohol. No classics like Pina colada are included but are available to purchase. 1 beer on tap and 1 choice of wine in each colour (none of which were particularly lovely). I read a review saying they will serve you in a tiny paper cup by the pool so I made sure to take my own (small - so I wasn't taking the p***) plastic cup which turned out to be a genius move.  The pools are unheated so pretty cold but I've known worse and I did manage a swim/float every day.  Transfer time from the airport is very quick. I booked with easyJet holidays and from start to finish everything was perfect.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL AND I hope the Manager / Owner reads this and rewards his/her wonderful staff for their hard work dedication and sense of fun.

Review_Date: Khus wrote a review Nov 2022

Review_Date: Andrea B wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: I was worried when I read other reviews. There was about half French and half British staying. The staff were all really welcoming and friendly. Excursions list given to us in English and we booked a couple from the hotel. We booked the hotel minibus several days with no problems but there were also taxi's waiting just outside the hotel if needed. The only slightly annoying things was that the music that accompanied the entertainment in the evenings was really loud. Basically this is really good value for money!

Review_Date: Shamilah A wrote a review Nov 2022

Review_Date: Anjali062 wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: If you want to stay somewhere in Marrakech I hands down would recommend Valeria premium dar atlas resort hotel. When we arrived at the hotel we were welcomed with warm greetings from every staff member to give you a little back story we had a tough time arriving in Marrakech we lost a day of our holiday and we lost our luggage and needed help to contact the airport since my cousin had arrived before us she had let the hotel know what had happened and they straight away were on it to help us solve our problems. (Zahir) one of the managers at the hotel had helped us get a taxi to the pharmacy to get medication that we needed to get for some of the adults in the group and also let us his personal phone to contact the airport since it would have charged us a stupid amount. Honestly so grateful to have staff members like them because I know most hotels would not consider it to be their problem. Every evening they would host events such as karaoke and dancing and much more entertainment for everyone no matter how old you were you still enjoyed it all they had activities during the day such as water aerobics volleyball darts belly dancing and also would show people different parts of their culture so you learn so much. All the staff members: were so nice to us and would talk to you every time they see you even would sit down with you and have lunch/ dinner with you when they had their breaks. I mean honestly what kind of hotel staff would do that it was literally the nicest thing ever. literally the most down-to-earth people ever everyone was so nice and anyone to tell me otherwise is lying the food and drinks were amazing. They also have a water park next door and to get to clubs and to the markets weren't that far away overall it was an 11/10 experience best believe I will be back again and will for sure be staying at that hotel again. shout out to Zahir and Ayoub there are a few more people but I'm rubbish with names if you guys see this you guys are AMAZING thank you so much for the best holiday I've had so far so much love for you guys!

Review_Date: karen wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: We were delighted with our very clean and comfortable beds . The cleaning standards around the resort were very high and also in the bedrooms . Review_Date: Tour04921688435 wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: A solid, all-inclusive escape for those Winter blues!
Review_Text: In terms of a great cheap all-inclusive getaway to ease those Winter blues...I can recommend this resort.    The staff were welcoming and helpful.    I firmly believe in Life that if you treat others well and with respect then they will reciprocate that...and this was true at this resort.    It doesn't take much to be civil and respectful to another human.    We liked the helpful reception staff the always-busy bar staff and the smiling entertainment team; who were always around to answer questions or assist.    The rooms were clean well presented and big enough to not feel cramped.    The complex itself was well maintained with flowers and water features aplenty.    The inclusive food was perfectly edible with some nice special dishes.    One thing I did not like was the abundance of flies and wasps over all the food.    I'd like to think some bug-zapper lighting around the food or sealing it within accessible containers would help that more.    The entertainment staff were "SUPER!" and did their best to offer interesting evenings for customers.  üòÅüëç    In summation as an all-inclusive escape for a very reasonable price...Valeria Dar Atlas resort is a solid choice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jennie A wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Lovely staff! All the food! Some of it good some ok. Lots of entertainment. Alcohol is watered down but as an all inclusive where not everyone knows their limits this is probably safe. Lovely large pool but very cold! All round it's good for the price! The room was big the complex is well designed so everything is close and beautifully presented and they provided us with everything we needed!  Can't speak any highly of the wonderful staff here
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ellie F wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Lovely hotel - food a massive let down
Review_Text: Lovely hotel - could do with being finished to a higher standard but the grounds are beautiful  Different pool options both are large pools one with entertainment and one quiet. Entertainment team are there throughout the day and there are plenty of activities to keep you busy - team are lovely but very enthusiastic and do encourage you to join in. Evening entertainment fab for children and they have different themed evenings. Halloween night entertainment was brilliant. Members of the team youseef smiley and Rico very friendly and always asked how we were enjoying our holiday. This is a very entertainment focused hotel so perhaps if looking for a quiet relaxing holiday maybe go elsewhere.  Food was not the best mostly the same food every day and little to no vegetarian options. None of the food is labelled also. One of my friends was ill during our visit and dreaded the food on the last few days.  Room was nice and spacious with 2 balconies although there was lots of ants. We had issues with one of the light bulbs and air con not working but when we reported these they were rectified quickly.  Cups for drinks are very smalls and there‚Äôs lots of bees so I would recommend maybe bringing your own cup with lid.  Really enjoyed the trip into Marrakech and the camel riding however the booking experience through the excursion shop was not the easiest. We had been booked onto the wrong bus through no fault of our own a female member of the travel team was very rude and made us get off the minibus only to then let more people on and tell us we could get back on and try and stand. This was very embarrassing and the low point of our holiday and that particular member of staff did not deal with the issue in an appropriate manner telling us it ‚Äòwasn‚Äôt her problem‚Äô. The gentlemen at the desk who had originally made the mistake was very apologetic and did eventually get the issue sorted for us.  Rooms were cleaned every day to a high standard although bed sheets were never changed but we didn‚Äôt find this to be a problem.  There‚Äôs a shop on site that sells ice creams souvenirs clothes and a limited selection of snacks.  All in all we did really enjoy our holiday and will definitely plan a return trip to Marrakech but we will not be returning to this hotel this is almost all down to the food which let the hotel down.

Review_Date: Mary G wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Had a lovely time at this hotel after reading some of the mixed reviews we didn‚Äôt know what to expect but certainly exceeded our expectations. The entertainment staff were lovely and very welcoming. There is always activities and for all ages they are very energetic and join in when and wherever they can. Nothing is too much and they all work so hard. They definitely made our holiday and we will be coming back.    The only down side we had were the Wasps whilst eating outside.

Review_Date: S B wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Great value for money and friendly staff
Review_Text: Great value for money friendly staff and the entertainment staff were great. Good location just a taxi ride away from the main square.    Food was okay but lots of variety.    I would come back and the weather was beautiful this time of year. Thanks for smiley . Sam. Amine.Riko . Mamado choreographe Sania

Review_Date: Melanie B wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Great value for money and friendly staff
Review_Text: Great trip the entertainment staff was brilliant. The staff were so friendly and pleasant and I would definitely come back here. The Halloween entertainment was great and the food they did on the night was fabulous. Would come again as it's great value for money. Thank for smiley üòä and Sam.riko . Mamado .sania kids club asmae end fayrouz

Review_Date: kathryn r wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Valeria Dar Atlas Resort (Unfortunately I do not recommend)
Review_Text: Beautiful grounds to the Hotel and lovely reception area. The room needed attention as none of the corners or behind doors had been cleaned with cobwebs and bits on the floor that had clearly been there some time. Bathroom generally needed upgrading though everything (except the hairdryer) worked. This was reported several times though there was a language barrier basically take your own hair dryer! Once towels had been used housekeeping would remove them however they were not replaced until late afternoon. This was a huge problem if you were planning to go out early and had no towels to shower. Reception were contacted several times though each time we were told they would arrive later! Pool areas kept clean and tidy though the main pool was quite noisy all day there was another pool which was for adults only which was lovely and relaxing. Went to the spa had a massage which was relaxing. The spa also needs upgrading. Huge selection of food which was well presented though myself and a number of other guests had upset stomachs while we were there which continued after arriving back home( though apparently Marrakech is known for this) !!  The team who organised the tours were very helpful and we enjoyed a number of tours. Don't be put off by how intense the Souks can be go on a group tour to start with be cautious be bold and enjoy. Please don't engage with any of the traders in the main square with monkey's and snake's it's beyond cruel and completely unethical in this day and age!  In all it's ok? not quite acceptable! I understand the world is coming out of a pandemic and money is tight however... some money needs throwing at this hotel and I'm sure it could be turned around. Housekeeping needs much more attention!  Just remember if you can't boil it peel it or if it isn't in a sealed bottle.. definitely DONOT eat or drink it!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lisa R wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: A good resort for an pool side, lazy holiday
Review_Text: Context: 30 year old couple from England. Pretty relaxed and make the most of things whatever the case.  Check in and room:  We spent 4 nights at this resort. When we arrived check in was advertised as 2pm however we couldn‚Äôt check in until 3:30pm with the excuse being that the rooms wasn‚Äôt ready because they were ‚Äòfully booked‚Äô. It seemed we were forgotten about as everyone else had checked in and we were still waiting. After pestering reception 3 times they reluctantly switched us to another room which was ready. We were given our key but no further information on how to find the room. Once we‚Äôd located our room we were met by an invasion of ants over the floor and up the walls. Apart from that the room was clean. We let reception know about the ants but the problem wasn‚Äôt rectified until the next day. No towels in the room when we first arrived and we had to wait for these - I assume they were washing them from previous guests. There is no bottle water in the room but this is available from all the bars in the resort.  Pool:  Pool towels are available to hire for 100dhs each for the duration of your stay however make sure you get there at 10am to get a towel as by the afternoon there won‚Äôt be any left and you‚Äôll be told to come back in the morning. The pool water was very clean but cold. Lots of sun loungers available but lacking in parasols.  Food:  All inclusive food is very average with very similar options each day. There is an outside serving area which we didn‚Äôt discover until day two. There are no food labels. The restaurant was often over crowded and lacking in cutlery and bottled water. Once tables had been used they didn‚Äôt seem to be replenished or cleaned for the next person. Drink cups are tiny in the restaurant and bar. Many drink options included in the all inclusive deal. Bar snacks consisted of pancakes daily - you didn‚Äôt have a choice of snacks.  Entertainment:  The best asset for this hotel. The animation team work tirelessly to ensure guests have a great experience throughout their stay. We went around and on Halloween so there were a lot of special events and shows happening. There‚Äôs something going on at all times from aqua aerobics to yoga to card games. There‚Äôs lots of entertainment for kids and all the staff are brilliant with them. There is a show each night for guests which is a lot of fun. A shout out to Rico and Sam for their energy and fun throughout our stay. There are also football tables and a pool table but this costs extra to use (coins).  AOB:  WiFi not great and not really reachable in the rooms. Very remote location with a few shops as you enter the resort. Very limited snacks in the shop in the form of crisps etc. There was a currency exchange desk at the hotel where you can change GBP into dhs.  We stayed in the premium resort as we assumed all the families and kids would go to the family resort across the road - this wasn‚Äôt the case. There were a lot of kids around at all times.    Aside from these issues we had a great time and stay. These points are particularly harsh but I would have found these points helpful when booking and could be a deal breaker for some.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: NikB wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Just back from a week here and can say was one of best holidays we‚Äôve had. Special mention to the animation team (especially Kimo & Sam) the main and pool bar staff (again the lads in pool bar who desperately tried to teach me some Arabic) and Zouhair (ask him to do his card tricks). The hotel itself was basic but clean but the staff made this hotel/holiday.  Yes it can get busy at lunch and dinner but the staff will always help and find you clean plates cutlery etc so never an issue. Could not fault any of the staff and they made this holiday a great one.    If I had to say any negatives and the only reason it didn‚Äôt get the full 5 stars it would be the food wasn‚Äôt great but could generally find something pool wasn‚Äôt heated and they served the pool drinks in an espresso size paper cup (yes they ran out of vodka and beer whilst there but not for long) but never had an issue with sun beds - no 5am wake up call needed. Still plenty at 9-10am and later.    Really good holiday and would highly recommend but was gutted to miss the Halloween show sounds like it was fab

Review_Date: Gemma C wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: We arrived at this hotel for a week‚Äôs stay with my 2 children. We chose this hotel as it seemed to have good entertainment and a kids club. We are so impressed with the entertainment staff. They put In so much effort all the time. They organised the most amazing day for the kids for Halloween with lots of games etc. Then in the evening it was a spectacular event for everyone. We as adults loved the Halloween show. A huge shout out to Smiley and Sam for their amazing dancing!! And the choreographer Sania who did the a great job. The manager Mamadou is doing a great job.  My kids had the best time at the kids club thanks to Asmae and Fayrouz for always including them and making it. The only bad point I would say is that the pools are not heated!

Review_Date: Gabrielle K wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: We had a great time  This week on holiday in Valeria far atlas resort. The Halloween show was great. Lots of laughs & lots of effort put into entertaining the guests. The Halloween show was good a lot of thought went into it to make sure the children had a good time and you could tell the staff and entertainment team put all their effort in to help the children have a good time.

Review_Date: RAFKent wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Some top tips if you book here !
