Review_Text: Weather was great  Resort beautifully maintained  Rooms cleaned well each day  Didn‚Äôt have issue with security  Room safe a joke you can pick it up and remove from the room  Reception staff unwelcoming  Booked two adjacent rooms but rooms weren‚Äôt adjacent  Ask for room in low 100s if you want to be close to pool restaurant etc  Bar staff more friendly if you speak a little French  The food wasn‚Äôt good but they try  Can recommend doughnuts for breakfast  Salad for lunch  Pasta for supper  Water park in hotel next door is free to use but nothing else in that hotel is free  The mango a la carte restaurant in hotel next door was good  we had to book and choose menu ahead but worth it for extra payment  Zen pool much more peaceful  Alcohol drinks are charged at zen pool but not very alcoholic  Drinks with spirits are watered down from other bars  Bring large glass as they serve smallest glass ever  Eat on terrace outside restaurant as inside its like a canteen  Flies everywhere  Travel excursions booked from hotel bit misleading i.e. we booked desert and camel riding and was told it‚Äôs 45 mins trip to reach desert it was 1.5 hrs each way  Worth the trip as the experience was good  Also booked private tour of medina of Marrakesh  It‚Äôs quite a dangerous situation with mopeds driving at you through tiny cobbled alley  The arrival from Marrakesh airport to the resort is the craziest journey just to warn you  We showed our passports 5 times leaving the airport  It‚Äôs literally in the middle of the desert so nothing around to wander to  Animation team work very hard through the day and night to keep you entertained if you are into it

Review_Date: Aroosha T wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: To begin with its an amazing resort with beautiful modern RIAD theme I loved the way rooms layout was .Its a very clean resort I must say people are always there to quickly clean it up and not dusty @all .The resort offers a diverse selection of pools that is amazing you can pick and choose where ever you would want a pool with entertainment staff or pool with quite space .Staff is all very cooperative with a special mention to a guy who wears glasses Zouhair and looks like a manager he will always greet you whenever he sees you sort out your issues and give you his best..food is lots of variety to choose I am not a fussy person there is a bit issue with cutlery or table change issue but to be honest its not very big you ask and you will get in next few mins so overall I know people found it frustrating but its not too bad I would say .  Kids mini club staff Asma and Faeroza are just amazing my kids loved them so much my daughter was in tears after the last hug ..they made the kids so welcomed that they dont even want to go back to their rooms ...Overall I would say I loved my time Loved the theme the resort is built very frequent access to main market and drivers are very punctual food was great ...and especially staff was always welcoming ...

Review_Date: Alpa wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Catering - We arrived at the resort after the dining hall had closed and asked if we could get some food. We had mentioned at reception that we are all vegetarian. The staff provided us with a platter each which had tuna and chicken on it. Having called the waiter over to ask them to remove the meat they told us it wasn't meat/it was halal.... They provided us with another plate - which still came with meat on it. We gave up.  At all mealtimes it‚Äôs a challenge to find any cutlery or cups to drink in. During breakfast times the yogurt pastries and honey were always accompanied by wasps which the staff did not try and eliminate. The cups are chipped. The good fruit would be sparse and if you didn't get to the dining hall for opening time - you would miss out.  We also found one of us sitting on a broken seat at breakfast one morning!  The meals themselves were an OK quality however you would not want to eat after seeing what you do at breakfast. If you walk into the dining hall 30mins after opening most of the food is gone anyway.    We had ordered a cake for a 5th Birthday which we had to repeatedly ask for on the night - the staff told us it‚Äôs on its way. The cake was presented an hour late and was also one that was created for a 70th anniversary. However we were still charged for the cake and the hotel manager refused to provide a refund.  However they did try and rectify this by providing us with 'free drinks' but the attitude of the staff did not make us comfortable. It was evident that they are short staffed.    The rooms are of an OK standard in our room we were two towels short so had asked to extra towels. We again found ourselves asking for towels about 4 times per day and had them provided on the third day as we refused to leave the reception desk until they were provided.  The toilet roll holder in our room was broken with no effort to fix and we found ourselves walking into the toilet with giant ants all over the floor one evening.    We had provided a deposit for pool towels. But when presenting our receipt at the pool kiosk we were told they are out of towels. The next day we went again at 9.30 am and were again told the same. After speaking with reception they advised they couldn't do anything about this. So we asked for a refund on our deposit - which we did get.    The guest‚Äôs native language is categorized by the colour of the band you wear. We did find that those that spoke Arabic or French would get a favorable service.    Overall we mostly stayed out of the hotel and only used it as a base to sleep! Will not be going back to this resort. It‚Äôs not of a 4-star standard and is pushing it at a 3 star. The hotel lacks communication between staff lacks basic hygiene and is extremely dis-organised.    Would not recommend...

Review_Date: lesley R wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Let me start with the positives ..the place is spotless..the entertainment staff are excellent ...but that's as good as it gets the chaos in the resturaunt is like nothing ever experienced before ..peak times it's no plates ..waiters are under so much pressure just to 're lay the table ..there is very little service at all ..wine is the only option....if you are lucky enough to catch the eye to get some ...no glasses to accompany the wine though .the alcohol is watered down and the bar staff barely smile whilst putting a dribble of drink into coffee cups!! It's very poor and extremely disappointing .I could go on but it's too much and it's boring .....just be aware that's all
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: SusanBFraserburgh wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Great resort for the price you pay, however they need to purchase more cutlery and glasses!!
Review_Text: I travelled to the Valeria Dar Atlas Resort in September with 3 other friends. When we arrived at the resort it was in the early hours of the morning and the hotel had a cold supper waiting for us which I thought was very nice. The room which was situated in accommodation blocks was a double room leading off to another room with two single beds. There was a shower and a seperate toilet which worked out well with 4 of us sharing. There was 2 balconies which was great and the room was clean and well equiped. The pool area was spacious with a lovely sized pool and you can pay a deposit to have a clean towel everyday and at the end of your stay you get your money back. The food was good with a plentiful selection each day. The entertainment team were really friendly and they took time each day to go round to speak to everyone which was nice. The entertainment was good also but perhaps a change of entertainment away from the entertainment team some evenings would be welcomed. The hotel staff we met were very friendly and for the money we paid for our holiday this resort was really good value for money. Being with my 3 friends we had a great time and lots of laughs. The only thing that I would say on the negative is that the size of the drinks was not the best. Watching the bar staff pour drinks sometimes it certainly wasn't a british sized nip that was being recieved. Also they use really little paper cups for drinks at the pool they need to get bigger cups. The size of the wine measures was great though. In the evenings there was quite a queue at the bar so they could have made preparation for more bar staff. The other negative is that every evening there apppeared to be a shortage of cutlery and glasses which was very inconvenient. The dining room was often very hot and we were told that the air conditioning was broken at the time of our visit. The hotel really do not to get better with drink sizes and purchase more cutlery and glasses but apart from that it was a nice resort and good value for money.

Review_Date: Sara wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We can‚Äôt believe the bad review! This holiday was perfect for our 4 girl holiday. Nothing was ever too much trouble for the animation/house keeping teams.    On arrival we checked in easy and got some lunch. Our rooms were ready and a member of staff carried our bags to our room - when i say room it was basically a little apartment 1 double bed and 2 single beds two balcony‚Äôs and a separate toilet and shower which worked well for 4 girls.    We enjoyed walking around the complex and loved the pond with the ducks the head of consumer experience took us on a tour around. In the evenings we enjoyed cocktails (ignore the comments about price - there is always a all inclusive option to everything if you want to pay extra you can but we didn‚Äôt see the point) - you can get vodka/gin/whisky/ wine and beer inclusive - there inclusive non alcoholic cocktails and alcoholic cocktails.    The dinners were always great - large amount of choice - our group had a wide range of dietary requirements / vegan/ veggie and a fussy eater and we always could get some food - however stuff isn‚Äôt always labeled but there‚Äôs always a member of staff behind the counters to ask. the deserts were a work of art I can‚Äôt believe that they were so many of them!    Breakfasts had a fresh omelette/egg maker and pancake/donut maker (outside on the patio) the flatbreads with the marmalade with fresh oranges were a good choice. always available is fresh morrocon tea.    the pools - there is 2 main pools at this hotel one with activities like yoga/water aerobics and one called the zen pool for quieter experience. You can only get soft drinks/water/tea and cofffee at the zen pool no alcohol as they want to make this a calm environment.    we enjoyed the activity like a cooking demonstration/ morrocon tea tasting.    You can use the facilities at the hotel next door (literally 2 mins walk) it has a fantastic water park to visit at least one of the days and another pool next door to use if you choose    Lunch was a wide range of things - they always had pizza/burger and chips for people who are after that kind of thing.    evening activities were great/ there was quizzes and even a nightclub to visit.    top tip    - bring our own cup (we got one of them large cups with a lid with a straw) staff will fill them for you so you can have a proper cup of beer or a cocktail or vodka coke / instead of the small paper cups they give you ( there‚Äôs no glass around the pool so everyone has small paper cups which can be a pain)    - maybe pick up some alcohol in the airport / we got a Bacardi. You can get non alcohol mojito‚Äòs and add your own bacardi in the evenings. i do think they water down there own spirts - the only night we felt abit tipsey was using own one alcohol instead of the hotels. However i think this is normal for this price all inclusive.    - The Azar restaurant is lovely in marrakesh if you what a fancy meal out of the hotel one night - the hotel can book you taxis or you can get the hotel shuttle bus    - they do offer beach towels for ¬£10 deposit however they weren‚Äôt always ready early morning as the laundry doesn‚Äôt arrive back until later on in the day - probs best to get a cheap beach towel if you can fit it in your bags    - there‚Äôs some small shops in the hotel which you can get sun cream from but they are expensive    for the price of this hotel we had a fanatic holiday - and honestly I think we would all go back if we were looking to go to marrakesh again.

Review_Date: Caroline S wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We are currently staying and would advise people to bring their own cutlery Every day we have to try and find a table that has been cleared as the staff are slow. Once you have found a table you then start the hunt to find cutlery there is never any forks.... and the plates/bowls are chipped. Staff do not seem to be organised or able to relay a table once cleared. The flies are swarming all over the pastries in the mornings and no one seems to take any notice there is no prevention measures.  For the 2nd day running they have run out of the local vodka (yesterday it was by lunch time). Have to question how the hotel can't get the ordering correct and the staff don't seem to care. So for an all inclusive you aren't getting what you have paid for.....  Air conditioning unit in bedroom is extremely noisy sounds like it is going to fall off the wall and have to turn it off when we actually go to sleep......

Review_Date: nanasmurf68 wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Avoid this hotel, there are far better out there!
Review_Text: On entering the resort and being escorted to our room our first impression was ‚Äòthis hotel is in need of TLC‚Äô. The water features along the walkway were dry and left open a trip or stumble would lead to a severe injury but it just looked unsightly. When we entered our room it was dark small and certainly not what we‚Äôd expected. The bathroom was dark and to be honest not what we‚Äôre used to. The whole bathroom needs updating and a thorough clean. The bathroom would flood every time we showered. My husband is recovering from a torn Achilles and it was extremely unsafe for him.  No tea making facilities in the room. We always bring our own tea bags and coffee but could not make drink.  Repetitive food daily butter for bread in the mornings was scarce. No alcoholic drinks other than wine allowed in the dining room unless you brought it in yourself which you are not initially told. Chipped crockery extremely dangerous and lack of tea spoons.  No fly covers or electric fly zappers over food. Food was crawling with flies and wasps. No showers by the main pool. The best thing was the staff who were lovely and the weather which was beautiful. This is our fourth visit to Marrakesh and was nearly our last because of this experience. BUT we will return to previous hotels that we‚Äôve visited.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gabby L wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: A good stay for the price you pay
Review_Text: Let me start off by saying that after reading the reviews we came on holiday with an open mind & to be honest we weren‚Äôt expecting much.    To be honest we were impressed by the majority of things on this holiday. I‚Äôd read a number of reviews saying that the staff were rude and unapproachable we found this to be completely untrue. We checked in were given our wristbands and shown to our room. Yes there were different wristbands for the English and the French but I don‚Äôt think that altered the way we were treated. Everyone would talk to you and everyone was incredibly friendly.    We never really got involved with any of the entertainment as that‚Äôs not really our thing however all of the animation staff were incredible & ensured everyone was always smiling. In the evening they made an effort to ensure as many people as possible were getting involved.    There are two pools the main pool & the zen pool which is adults only. We split our time between the two however the zen pool ended up being our favourite due to how calm it was. The only thing I will say is there was no alcohol served at the zen pool unless you paid for it. When we‚Äôve paid for an all inclusive we didn‚Äôt really want to have to pay for any drinks and so drank soft drinks on the days we spent there.    On the subject of alcohol the drinks were incredibly watered down and you were given small paper cups that must‚Äôve only had about 2 sips in each. Myself and my partner were drinking all day yet we felt as if we hadn‚Äôt drunk anything at all.    The all inclusive drinks also end at 11pm every night which I found odd however we never stayed as long as this so it didn‚Äôt affect us really.    The rooms were clean and spacious. Nothing crazy to shout about but nothing awful either.    The food was fine and it was pretty standard for an all inclusive holiday. There was always a good variety and we never went hungry. The only thing was the wasps flying around the food especially in the mornings. However towards the end of our stay the staff ended up shutting the restaurant doors and this definitely helped the issue.    We also enjoyed a Hamman at the spa during our stay which was definitely worth it.    The hotel is quite far out of the city however the hotel offers a shuttle service which I believe takes you straight to the medina. There is also an excursions office however we found it cheaper to book online either through TripAdvisor or Viator. We went on a sunset camel ride which we both thoroughly enjoyed.    Overall we both enjoyed our holiday and we were super lucky with the weather too. It was never going to be a 5-star holiday for us but I think 4-star is completely reasonable. Plus for the price we paid we could never really argue with the experience we had.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tabeth m wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: The entertainment made this holiday thanks to Smiley and sam and everyone else i can not name. we had loads of activities to do especially fitness and night. the guys have been amazing and this 5* is for them NOT THE HOTEL. Since arriving there has been one after another no towels in the room no towels for the pool at 10am you get told there are finished. no iron to iron our clothes i was told to go the next hotel with a child who is 5 in this heat walking there. Cash machine you have to go next hotel. it‚Äôs been awful since day thanks to the manager zouhair who has been fantastic trying to sort things out for us but i won‚Äôt be coming back here!!

Review_Date: Hardeep C wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: The hotel and facilities were really good and the food was really good too! But the best thing about this hotel was definitely the entertainment and the super friendly staff that got everyone involved in activities during the day and evening. A massive shoutout to RICO and SMAILEY who were amazing during our stay and always made so much effort with us. They definitely made our stay even better!!

Review_Date: hkaur2 wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Was unsure as the reviews are mixed but I was happy. Food choice is excellent but they really need to do something about the wasps and flies around the food. This is not hygienic. Flies carry disease.simple enough to solve; cover the food and set fly traps. Staff are very good and welcoming. Biggest gripe is with housekeeping. Took us so many asks to get the soap dispenser refilled. Then there‚Äôs the towel situation. In this resort they enter your room on three separate occasions: once to remove all the towels then to make the bed then to replace the towels. The only problem is the towels are taken in the morning and not replaced until after 3. So if you want a shower between collection and 3 you can‚Äôt. This became a real issue for us. They clearly need more towels!! The entertainment is ok but we‚Äôre not keen on that type of thing. Massage was very expensive and not very good. Would not recommend. Also you have to pay for the shuttle bus (not mentioned ) 2 dhirams there and 2 back. The bus times are quite rigid.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John B wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Hotel was clean but very basic. The rooms we had were twins with a third bed/day bed TV and nothing else. The area outside the patio door only had a single chair after 'borrowing it' from a friend's room.  First evening (this is an all-inclusive deal) the bar ran out of beer!? And again on the second night - at least they got some cans in later in the week. Also ran out of ice a couple of times. The pool bar was supposed to be open until 4pm (ideal for those of us who played golf) but it was hard work trying to get any food out of them - no menu take what is dished up.  5th morning in they decided to mop the foyer area and basically stopped all access which makes it difficult to get to the loos near reception AND difficult to get prepared for a trip out. When I say mopped I mean flooding with buckets of water and then mopping it up and the water came from the fountain in the enclosed courtyard!! And whilst this was going on doors were barred with 'slippery floor' type signs.  Some of the staff tried some of the staff didn't care. One of our group had dirty sheets on one of the twin beds they came and stripped them - then left the unmade bed for 5 days.  For British readers let's just imagine that Basil Fawlty was in charge - that sums it all up!

Review_Date: Surinder C wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Hotel was great! Food was really nice! Staff were really friendly and interactive. The entertainment was amazing and many activities throughout the whole day which kept us busy and they were great fun.

Review_Date: Harminder C wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Hotel was amazing! The Staff were so friendly and really interactive. They kept the day very busy with a range of activities and very welcoming for all! The shows were very entertaining! There‚Äôs also a lot sports you take part in! Would recommend

Review_Date: Dan R wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: You get what you pay for
Review_Text: Upon arrival you have to pay the tourist tax which luckily we had cash to pay for after reading a few reviews before travelling. Upon check-in you're given 1 key card and a sheet of paper with the times for food etc. We had been put in the furthest block away 1907 I noticed certain guests (French) being shown to the room however being English we had to walk ourselves.    Once we got to the room it was reasonably sized with a mini-fridge ideal for water no towels in the room and we had to wait nearly 5 hours for them the safe didn't work either in our room.    The rooms serve a purpose but we didn't have any chairs or a table outside on the balcony area & the room is littered with ants the mattresses are rather hard so unless you're used to this it takes a while to get used to this. Aircon works for about 10 minutes and then doesn't really serve a purpose.    On the first 2 nights we found a few bar staff rude but not everyone some would be really helpful and go out of the way. After the first 2 nights a young manager came in to speak to the guests and we noticed a real difference he seems to care about all guests and would spend a good 5/10 minutes chatting to you to ensure you're having a good time!    Food is basic breakfast everything is swarming in flies/wasps I am not a fussy eater but found myself eating the basic foods. Drinks are poor served in small cups and often the beer would run out spirits seem watered down from when the bars open to close me and my girlfriend would pretty much drink during all of the hours but yet still felt like we had not had a drink.    After the new manager came in you really could see the difference and I hope he manages to improve the hotel as you could see the signs it was getting better.    But for what we paid for a week it's nice to be away in the good weather.

Review_Date: Tommy9776 wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: I‚Äôll try to keep this to the point.    On arrival we had no towels the safe wasn‚Äôt working and the AC was terrible. I reported this to reception we got towels. Nothing else was fixed. I reported again and again nothing was done. I never slept under my covers once. It was horrible.    The room was basic but no big deal I‚Äôve no idea why some reviews are saying really clean I was say a very basic standard of cleanliness ants as part of the furniture. The food was ok no complaints really.    The drink was as bad as it comes. The wine from the restaurant was the only thing worth drinking even tho you weren‚Äôt allowed to take open bottles out of the restaurant to drink in the bar. (Everyone seemed to do this)    The bar closed at 11 forcing you to leave.    The staff I had no real complaints but if you‚Äôre French or you tip well you get what u want. It was actually embarrassing at times.    The outside bar the cups are terrible and again if u tip you don‚Äôt need to ask for a drink they give you it. Even tho others standing waiting. This seriously needs to be looked at. I tip for good service not before.    The entertainment team were excellent tho my group never really got involved but it was good to watch.    This isn‚Äôt a 4 star and I‚Äôm not being harsh. It‚Äôs more like a 3 star (even that‚Äôs a push)    A wee point I did spk to the new manager and he arrived while we were there. We seen some slight improvements. Hopefully with time he‚Äôll improve the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Connor B wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Great week with my girlfriend. The entertaining team were fantastic including Smailey and rest. Various activities in the day which kept us on our feet.    Will definitely be returning to Valeria Das Atlas.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Holly wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: This hotel has the best entertainment team we‚Äôve ever come across. The whole animation team are incredible and cannot do enough for you. We especially love Smailey Youseff Salah and Rico. We would come back here just for them. Thank you for making our stay so amazing!! Highly recommend the team at Valeria Das Atlas.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emilia L wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We had a lovely time at Dar Atlas. The rooms are really clean the housekeeping comes round every day and gives the rooms a thorough clean. The pool & communal areas are also very clean and well looked after.    The entertainment staff were a lot of fun alway making sure everyone was involved and was having a lot of fun. They are all very hard working as they work every all day long!! We particularly enjoyed the water aerobics with Smiley.    Sam Amine Riko Mamado Fayrouz Sania and the rest of the team at Valeria Dar Atlas made the experience a fabulous one! üòÉ
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: achraf a wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: The best experience in an all inclusive hotel so far the best animation and entertainment team Sam the Fireman Smailey Amine and all the other members made our holidays unforgettable must come again and meet the same team again and I really recommand it !!!!

Review_Date: Gina M wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: A lengthy but fair review! Please read!
Review_Text: To set the tone I am not a frequent all inclusive holiday attendee so this would be particularly helpful for those like me. Manage your expectations .. if you aren‚Äôt used to an all inclusive experience you will have a shock! However firstly addressing the comments on rude staff. We didn‚Äôt encounter a single member of staff who was rude or unhelpful! They are all fantastic with welcoming smiles and fabulous manners I cannot fault them.    Food - as a vegetarian we struggled enormously! It is heavily meat & fish based (expected in this country) however in this day and age I would expect more accommodation to suit! We did however mention this to reception and found that there was more variety thereafter but if you‚Äôre looking for food that actually tastes nice this isn‚Äôt the place. A salad bar is available but it‚Äôs more or less the same every night and the likes of lettuce and cucumber grows tiresome. The reviews of wasps surrounding the pastries at breakfast are true I don‚Äôt understand why nets wouldn‚Äôt be covering these so we steered away from them. The puddings are fabulous the bread also! There is pizza freshly made outside which is nice and honestly was our survival food at lunch! If you don‚Äôt eat carbs regularly you will feel terribly bloated after each meal. Food times are: breakfast 7:30-10:30 Lunch 12:30-2:30 Dinner 7:30-9:30! This is a long wait until dinner so people are queued in the lobby bar until the doors open. Queue the masses.  To reinforce the issue is the food NOT the staff!    Pools - we frequented the Zen pool everyday as we were searching for a relaxing holiday. It is more quiet than the main pool however the only difference is the music not how much people talk! Again not a hotel issue these are the guests (mainly the French) I do see what other reviews mean when they refer to the French experiencing a different holiday yet I don‚Äôt believe this is due to staff preference. This seems to be because the staff all speak French being Moroccan of course! So I wouldn‚Äôt let that sway you.    The rooms are well situated we were in the 1200 block which was far enough away to not be disturbed by any evening entertainment when retiring to sleep. The rooms are dated no denying it but ours was clean and everything worked! Can‚Äôt speak to other rooms but ours was fine and if you wanted to change rooms I had heard from another guest that they are happy to accommodate. Don‚Äôt expect a swanky penthouse suite or anything but they are certainly suitable for the intended purpose! The hairdryer is small and old I would bring your own as I did if you blow dry your hair properly with a round brush for example as you‚Äôll be stood there for ages trying to dry your hair! Towels are collected in the morning from your room restocked at 4:30. You do need a ¬£10 deposit per person for pool towels they only accept cash! There is an ATM machine in the neighbouring hotel if you did not arrive with cash.    Drinks & snacks - if you are all inclusive you will have full access to all drinks however at the Zen pool all you can get is water & soft drinks. Cocktails here are chargeable which is mis-advertised! The snack bar is by the main pool and the food is essentially left over lunch so don‚Äôt count on this for any afternoon nibbles! We took a pizza from the oven at lunch and stored it in our room fridge as our afternoon snack! The reviews mentioning small cups are true we brought our own solo cups and found no trouble but we did only drink bottled water all day.    Evening entertainment - I can‚Äôt speak to this as we weren't interested in this portion of the holiday however my understanding from other guests is the staff are great and if you are looking for a lovely evening they have different themed nights for you to enjoy!    The transfer is 30 mins from Menara Airport where we had a personal driver take us when we only booked a shuttle so don‚Äôt waste extra money on a private taxi! You get it anyway!    Also if you have a heart you‚Äôll be saddened by the cats and dogs that live here but are essentially strays. The cats do venture through the dinner hall in the evenings which I am more than happy with as a dedicated animal lover however not everyone shares my opinion. The dogs mind their own business but this displays as fear of people I fed two of the dogs and they were ravenous so I don‚Äôt think they are cared for and they hid behind the bushes any time someone walked by. For me this was particularly difficult to stomach but again not everyone shares this opinion and this would be found in most hotels. So that one is just for the animal lovers!    Overall for what we paid for a week including flights it was what you would expect. Everything is clean and the staff are very polite and helpful so if all you want is a fly and flop holiday and you aren‚Äôt a vegetarian this would be suitable! Had we of had better weather this would have been a better holiday but that obviously is just down to luck!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Keenan F wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We stay at the Valeria dar atlas resort 5th of October to the 13th of October it was our first holiday for the year and was super excited to get away however when we arrived we have been met with small inconveniences that have built up over time causing us to not enjoy our holiday as we should have.    Upon arriving at 10:30am ish and our documents stating there is no check in time due to covid they told us we would have to wait until 12:30 before we could check in. We were given a sheet about food times and drink time and sent on our way. We had to ask other guests as to where the toilets are to get changed we were sat around the pool with our bags with no offer of storing them somewhere. We later have seen other guests storing bags at reception.    Once we got into our room we had 2 single beds pushed together after booking a double room. We was shown how the air con works but it just kept leaking all over the floor. Both of these things were reported to reception however the bed wasn‚Äôt rectified until 10th of October when they made the 2 singles up into a double. And despite multiple complaints about the air con it hasn‚Äôt been fixed and now leaks when switched off. We had to use towels to stop the water going all over the floor and the water even leaked on to some clothes leaving dirty marks.    It states that snacks are served at 2:30pm until 3:30pm but there hasn‚Äôt been any. The late breakfast and coffee break are just left over pastry‚Äôs from breakfast which are covered in flies and wasps during the morning as they aren‚Äôt covered for breakfast service!    The food has a good selection but can sometimes be very repetitive and it seems like lunch left overs are severed again at dinner. They keep running out of cutlery and glasses and just don‚Äôt seem to be able to keep up with the demand. Some of the staff are fantastic but others are getting back handed tips and are setting up ice buckets and nice tables for those who have paid them. If you ask for one then you are told they have ‚Äòrun out‚Äô.    In the restaurant both inside and out you‚Äôre greeted to flies on the food and cats and dogs roaming around constantly which isn‚Äôt good from a health and safety standpoint.    The beer goes off at the snack bar at 5pm everyday however if you‚Äôre French they keep serving you. The hotel uses different coloured wrist bands for the French and British. They serve the drinks in small paper cups and only allow you to take two at a time. By the time you‚Äôve sat back down the cups are giving way and are about to break. You have two mouth fulls and your drink is gone.    The hotel has 2 pools. The adult only one won‚Äôt serve you alcohol and makes you pay extra despite us been all inclusive. We were never told that this was excluded from the all inclusive.    The bar states it‚Äôs open until 12am but all inclusive drinks end at 11pm and you have to purchase drinks from them after 11pm however the bar has been closing bang on 11pm with not been able to purchase more drinks. The staff start putting all the table and chairs away around you making you feel like you have to leave and go to bed.    Some staff are great however others will just ignore you. When with my partner no staff from the entertainment team would speak to us however when my partners is on her own they always come and speak to her.    A water park is advertised at the hotel however is at the sister hotel a 10 min walk. This was never advertised when booking only told this when we asked at the reception.    There‚Äôs towel hire however they don‚Äôt have enough for all guests. We went to hire some at 11am and was told to come back at 4:30pm as they didn‚Äôt have any for 3 days they didn‚Äôt have any so had to use ones from the room.    Certain guest have been given better treatment over others. It seems to be the French who have been made to feel more welcome. A coach came into the hotel with more guest and the hotel brought more staff in and set up a red carpet and really made their welcome special hot towels tea music drinks ect where as others have been left to find there own way and like us left sat with luggage around the pool.    The biggest problem we had is on the last day when it came down to settle the bill. I proposed to my partner while on the holiday and asked the hotels photographer to take photos of the event of which he agreed. He wanted to charge ‚Ç¨100 for said photos. After going through the photos we chose only two as the quality of the photos were very poor. He added the charge of ‚Ç¨100 to the room and expected us to pay that for the 2 photos printed and a digital copy of the rest. We received the printed photos but not the digital. We agreed that we would pay for the prints and did so but the photographer demanded the prints back and the hotel had to give us a refund. This has really upset me and my partner as those were photos to treasure of our engagement and we will never get those back. As you can imagine this has absolutely ruined the last day of our holiday and really has made the whole experience a negative one.    As you can see they are all small things that if only one of them was happening then it would be fine but as you can see it‚Äôs been multiple different incidents one after the other that‚Äôs not only been effecting us but many other guest as we have been speaking to others. It‚Äôs made the holiday less enjoyable it‚Äôs made me feel like I‚Äôve been at an inconvenience because I‚Äôve constantly had to ask for things that should have automatically been included. As a result I will not be returning to the hotel again. The hotel is rated 4 stars but in my opinion it needs to be reassessed as it‚Äôs not a 4 star hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Claire wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Had a great holiday at this beautiful resort. Although in the middle of the dessert it was lush and green. The hotel was inviting and the ceilings in reception were beautiful. The rooms were simple but adequate and comfortable. The buildings were set out so you didn't feel overlooked. There was a great mix of action and tranquility you decide which you'd prefer. The resort was quite large but felt intimate and safe. Staff were great. Entertainment was interesting but entertaining!!! If you're coming to Morocco expecting English food inc full breakfast and chips you'll be disappointed. If you're happy to try then there's lots to choose from. There was always something you'd like. All in all had a great time and would definitely go back

Review_Date: Richi F wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Nice Resort But Could Be Better
Review_Text: This resort is mixed of things. The good is the following:- friendly staff rooms are cleaned well. Just remember to leave used towels outside your door.    When I first arrived I was allocated a room farthest away from the main building. There were no batteries in the Aircon controller. So I had to return to the main building for some. Then I find that the Aircon doesn't even work. An electrician came to look at it that evening but to no avail. I went back to the front desk in the morning. They assured me both the Aircon & the shower head (which had a leak) would be fixed that day. They were not and so they agreed to change my room.    Food wise...so far food is pretty much the same each day. Lots of parties on offer but nothing covered so flies/wasps happily get their sugar rush. Very little if any of the food is labelled. They repeatedly run out of wine. But the staff try their best for the guests which is a good thing. Also note hotel is a good 20 minutes from the city centre. They do run a shuttle bus but you have to pay for it.

Review_Date: Keith P wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: The layout of the accomadation blocks are very well thought out and authentic. The room even if a little basic was generous in size the double bed is 2 singles pushed together. With a small balcony we were at the front on the first floor. The rooms were very clean and tidy. The foos is served for breakfast lunch and dinner. all in the the large dining hall and buffet style. More choice than you can shake a stick at and as expected focus on local produce and dishes but they did do chips. You also have a choice of sitting outside overlooking the pool or in one of the delightful court yard areas. You do have to ask for wine at dinner and lunch inn which they serve half bottles of Red Rose or white wine. We got to know one of the waiters who was very helpful and well mannered Samir who setup a table each lunch time with wine in ice ready to go. Honestly it really is the small touches.    There was entertainment every evening and during the day the Animations team who's job it is to get youmoff your lovely sun lounger and particpate in some sort of activity dance classes yoga water arobics and many more. They failed with us and soon realised that we were planning on observing the activity rather than taking part. There was another pool in the grounds the Zen pool if you like it really quiet.

Review_Date: Jenny R wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We really enjoyed our stay at Valeria Dar Atlas the entertainment staff at Valeria Da Atlas were amazing and offered a variety of activities all day every day. The food was really nice and the all inclusive was really good - much better than other all inclusive hotels around Europe. Would definitely recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Matthew S wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We came here pre covid about 3 years ago as a family of 4 . Decide to come back with friends as a party of 4 adults. The hotel is clean and tidy but is a bit run down now with broken tiles and and slabs in places . The rooms are dated and looking a bit tired. (The shower can be very slippery getting into it BE CAREFUL) . Most the staff very friendly No table service it's find your own table . Normally a bottle of water is waiting on the table but you are not asked or served any drinks . They do come and take away your plates very quickly. Food was alright we didn't starve  fussy eaters might struggle a bit . As for the bar we found this to be the biggest let down to the holiday . Tiny little paper cups (good job we took our own) every day at some point they ran out of beer of an evening they had got hold of more beer that then ran out also . Vodka ran out most nights also and to be honest I think they was watering it down. At no point of the 5 nights did any of us even feel tipsy. Tried to be as honest/fair as possible won't be returning to this hotel again . We have been to Morocco 8 times now and loved the places we have stayed . Its a lovely country don't let this review put you off going to Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ashnuml wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: My stay at this resort was really good. The animation team was brilliant they work tirelessly everyday to entertain us and keeping us busy. I loved their shows and programs dancing pool fitness at club. All animation team members are great laugh Sam Smailey Zak and Sania  DJ abdel and all others.  Bar and restaurant staff were also great. Said Ibrahim Mehdi.  Thank you all for making our stay enjoyable.  I will definitely come back and highly recommend to others.

Review_Date: Becky H wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Had the best holiday at Valeria Dar Atlas.  Would highly recommend. The staff are all amazing friendly and welcoming. Great activities daily to get involved in. Especially loved the dance classes & aqua aerobics. All inclusive drinks & food were delicious. Great selection of food at every meal time. Pools are clean and grounds well looked after.  Fabulous holiday & will definitely be back!  Special thanks to Smailey & Sam. Yea
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kristal Philpot wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: This is our second time at this hotel and we have loved it once again. The entertainment is brilliant there is something for everyone. Special shoutout to Sam Smailey Amin and Mamadou Sania who made our holiday great once again. Can‚Äôt wait to come back already.

Review_Date: Lydia M wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: It‚Äôs a Lovely hotel and the staff are very helpful and welcoming; the entertainment team are fab! Especially Smily Sam and amin mamadousania üòÅ the entertainment is amazing so are the shows. Second time we‚Äôve come here and we will defiantly come back!

Review_Date: Ryan & Laura wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Great Holiday and value for money!
Review_Text: We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the hotel as some of the reviews we read before hand weren‚Äôt the best.  With the price being ridiculously cheap we weren‚Äôt expecting 5* but this hotel is lovely and you get what you pay for.    We arrived at around 11:30 and checked in but we‚Äôre advised our room wasn‚Äôt quite ready so to grab a drink and some lunch (12:30) and come back after which to us wasn‚Äôt a problem in the slightest bit. We were shown to our room and our cases carried for us. The room was lovely and alot better than we expected (again due to reviews) the whole hotel is clean and we wouldn‚Äôt say it‚Äôs dated just more authentic.  Mini fridge in the room with bottled water (can ask for this at any bar) and aircon which isn‚Äôt particularly great but come night time you can open the patio door and a lovely breeze comes through and no bugs.    If you are planning on coming to Morocco and expecting a full English breakfast and ‚ÄúEnglish‚Äù food then you need to consider going elsewhere.  Breakfast is predominantly breads pastries cheeses cereal yoghurt eggs and pancakes. There is a lot of wasps around the sweet pastries but the staff do try there best to keep as many out as possible.  At Lunch and Dinner there is a choice of meat fish potatoes rice pasta couscous breads pizza & burgers (sometimes) breads and lots of salad dishes. Desserts are lovely with a range of cake and biscuits.  Drinks aren‚Äôt too bad but served in small cups if you tip the bar men they will always find you a bigger glass. Cocktails are nice but can be different depending on who serves them and soft drinks are branded Pepsi and 7up.  You can purchase branded alcoholic drinks (absolute vodka Bombay Sapphire Jonnie Walker etc)    We haven‚Äôt found the staff to be rude but have found them to be more French focused simply because they speak fluent French (and the French always tip) and alot of the staffs English is quite broken but not one has been unpleasant to us.    The animation team are great and aren‚Äôt pushy trying to get you to participate all of the time.  The little Moroccan lady who does Henna tattoos by the pool bar is also great and does some beautiful designs for very cheap (around ¬£10 for full hand)    the hotel shop isn‚Äôt great if you want snacks as there isn‚Äôt really much choice but the prices are really good there is no where close to get anything so bring snacks with you.  The closest cash machine is down the road in another hotel.    We highly recommend going to the Souk but follow the advice and dress modestly. if you‚Äôre an anxious person just please be aware of how busy the markets are and it is like a maze.  We also recommend the desert trip in the evening camel ride Bedouin tent and Moroccan meal. Wear long trousers and sensible footwear (trainers) as you don‚Äôt want to get saddle sore from the camels or lose a shoe.  Overall a fantastic holiday fantastic people and a beautiful country. We would definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jessica W wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We stayed for 4 nights as a mini October break away. Sam and the team were all very welcoming and extremely polite superb entertainment around the pool area. Very enjoyable stay we will be back next year! :-)

Review_Date: Paul O wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Fantastic staff throughout at the resort. Wonderful sporting facilities including dance classes tennis ping pong basket ball. The evening entertainment is classic. The resort is very beautiful clean and well maintained.

Review_Date: Ben M wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: First things first I think most of the 1/2-star reviews are very misleading if you are going away you check up on the reviews... people moaning about where the hotel is or its not what they expected I just think that's on them. I myself checked 100's of reviews and was slightly surprised just to how wrong people were this whole " the French are treated better " just isn't true the difference is the French TIP and also they aren't afraid to ask for things unlike most brits.    The main part of this review i want to focus on the Value for Money expect this hotel isn't the best there are a few faults on some days it's a 4* hotel with 3* features on other days it's a 3* hotel with 4* features i can only go off the time we had me and my partner spent 9 days there i would go as far as saying 8 of them we had little to moan about CONSIDERING the price you pay I'm not saying the rooms are perfect but we all know this hotel is very affordable. The Zen pool was our go to pool first few days the sunbeds were never full but towards the end of the holiday around 1pm you'd struggle to get two beds together often people in reviews complained this bar wasn't all inclusive which at first i was like that's annoying but the whole point of the Zen pool is its quiet and relaxing and if they did do drinks would mean most people would then come to this pool from this we took our chilly's bottles meaning we always had cold water anyway an easy fix ps they do actually give you water if you ask as that bar. The SPA was very well priced and well worth a visit. One thing i did like is Most people didn't leave towels they'd just wait till they are actually getting on the sun beds to save them but again this is only off our days there this could be different depending on how busy.    The food again on the topic of value for money the food is 7/10.  Breakfast - Coffee & juices are lovely loads of pastries pancakes and cereal the only negative about that is as its sweet pastries Alot of wasps are around which can get annoying.  Lunch- I think over the best meal always had a safe option be it breaded chicken Hamburger Pasta some sort of chicken and 1/3 days chips. drinks are help ya self-small cups but its all-inclusive what do you expect.  Tea- Overall pretty good never went hunger always has a style of white meat/ dark meat and fish no labels which on here seems to be a big issue but most things do actually have a label or its very obvious what they are I think we all inclusive no matter where they have to carter for everyone some nights the foods going to be just okay and that's something you have to think about me and my partner personally one night rather than moaning we just went to the restaurant which IMO 320 DH for 2 mixed grills was a steal.  Drinks- Personally I have been to 5* Hotels and 3* hotels the drinks aren't something of an issue you can ask for bottles of wine with lunch and tea 2/3/4 bottles if needed drinks are small yes but never once was told no too asking for two and always seemed to get ice which a fair few people on here had issues with we did pay for some and i would say if you can why not 80DH for a large cocktail I think as a treat was value for money.    Trips- The women in the excursion's office is a superstar she is great with customers answers all questions and helped make our hotel that little bit better. you can book trips out of the hotel and most likely it is a little cheaper we just liked paying that little extra for a more organized trip.    Extra Positives which I've not seen mentioned on here- Shop in the hotel for Crips/ ice cream/ pop not at rip of prices lifeguards will help move sunbeds football on tv screens with big sofas.    Negatives / Improvements- I think the main negative as we saw on our last day when the hotel is busy the staff are stressed which leads customers getting annoyed and we sadly saw this on our last night. the main food hall we struggled the get seats no forks at one point there was no glasses for drinks luckily for us this was our last night but I do feel for people whose first / second day that was as if it stayed that was it wouldn't have been a nice holiday. We aren't sure how many times our bedding has been changed.    Overall- VLAUE FOR MONEY we had a lovely holiday and more positives then negatives as people who don't like all-inclusive holidays this wasn't as bad as we first thought i think the main point to take has to be think about what you have paid for this holiday before you start to complain about the drinks / Staff not waiting on you hand and foot.

Review_Date: karys wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Poor hotel not what I expected
Review_Text: Arrived at 9pm to check in and wasn‚Äôt shown to our room we was the furthest block away. Once we finally found it after asking 2 more staff while walking around we finally found it once we lugged the suitcases up the stairs we then find out the key card didn‚Äôt work. We had to walk back to reception 2 times and still wouldn‚Äôt work so they finally called for a maintenance man. He came and there was no electric in our room so he tried to open the electric box with a screwdriver instead of a key then had to wait for another maintenance man to come with the actual key to fix it.    This also happened to us on another 2 occasions.    The drinks are ridiculously small by the time you get a drink and sit on your sun lounger you have to get back up again to get another one.    The waiters are so miserable slamming your drinks down infront of you. Paid for all inclusive and half of the time when I went to get a drink at the pool bar they either didn‚Äôt have any beer or vodka so I just ended up drinking bottles of water during the day time.    The food is the same most days I ate the same breakfast for 10 days lunch is the best. The omelettes aren‚Äôt cooked and the eggs are so under cooked I don‚Äôt know how they can even serve them.    Animation team are really good and try hard but they do the same thing every week which meant we sat through 2 quiz nights with exactly the same questions in it.    They seem to treat the French like royalty wine in ice buckets on a table that is reserved for them with bread rolls on the table. English just get water. Think I managed to get wine twice only when I got up and asked them.    French just barge infront of you and take the last of anything you have queued up for.    All in all it wasn‚Äôt the best hotel and I wouldn‚Äôt go back here. I looked up and there are better hotels around this one so I‚Äôd recommend spending that little bit extra and not being disappointed like we was.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sunjay M wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: The stay was poor (less than satisfactory). It started well with a room upgrade to a family room (thank you). However the rooms are tired and the walls are thin.    The air-con drowns out noise from guest but it also circulates dust (nasty cold throughout).    We emailed the hotel in advance re our dietary requirements. However the hotel does not cater well for vegetarians/vegans. Also the chefs have no idea what foods contains eggs (different opinions). Non of the foods are labelled. This in itself is a health risk if anyone has allergies and especially if the waiting staff have no idea if foods contain certain foods such as eggs. The lack of food choice caused my wife to have bad stomach problems.    There appears to be a major restriction of bathroom and swim towels. When we arrived we asked for towels even though the rooms were cleaned but were told we would need to wait until after 16:00. Fresh towels were only provided in the late afternoon.    We went to the Spa to check out the exercise equipment but were turned away as the room was being used. Furthermore we were told there are only two basic cardio equipments and to use them we would need to pay extra.    The quite pool was inviting but the all inclusive does not extend to this pool which is again very strange.    Reception staff seem to have different functions rather than one person being able to handle the most basic queries so the time taken at reception is not ideal. We decided to leave earlier than planned due to be wholly unsatisfied with this hotel.    As a positive our cleaner was very good and caring to our needs. The quite pool is pleasant. The day trips to Marrakesh are easy to arrange and decent in costs.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kirsty M wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: From someone who genuinely doesn‚Äôt want anyone else to be disappointed‚Ä¶  We arrived at the Valeria atlas resort a supposed 4* all inclusive hotel at 10:30 am to be told we cannot check in untill 2 which was pushed back till around 3.  We then finally got told our room was ready to which we were not shown to just told ‚Äúit‚Äôs down there 6 blocks on the left‚Äù . Upon eventually finding our room we discovered the dirty bedsheet no pillow cases filthy shower mouldy ceilings which were falling down in places ants taking over the place air con (not shown how to use) leaking everywhere tatty broken furniture. Nothing at all like the photos when we booked which may I add was not cheap. We thought we could look past all of this untill realising there was no towels what so ever we couldn‚Äôt even shower . The next red flag I went to speak to reception to see if we could get at least a towel to be told we have to pay ¬£10 each for them! And I was to have to find a housekeeper myself and ask her for them. I was shocked but did as I was told to be ignored by 5 different house keepers ! 6 hours after arriving we finally got our towels.  Next we thought we could try and forget about the sh*t start and go and get ourself a drink to be told that we had to pay for anything alcoholic! We had paid for all inclusive ! False advertising! Staff were unbelievably unhelpful and rude one even man shouting at me when I asked a simple question . Pools all had debris in the bottom and not clean along with broken sun loungers. Now for food‚Ä¶ where do I start. Drinks served in tiny espresso paper cups which you‚Äôd finish after 1 sip and be back at the bar. Breakfast there is swarms of wasps and I mean hundreds all over the not fresh pastries . Stale bread dirty bowels and cutlery. Ants in the ‚Äúclean‚Äù glasses. No napkins. Just utterly disappointing. Timings were never stuck to. Lunch starts at 12:30 but they don‚Äôt actually open till about 12:45 sounds silly however I have a condition meaning I need to eat at certain times and have to take medicine a certain time before hand. Options were fish fish or fish. Not an issue unless of course like us you don‚Äôt like seafood . Finally dinner. Dirty tablecloths just turned over when the next person was to sit there. Never have I wrote a review however this was completely shocking experience and I genuinely wouldn‚Äôt want anyone wasting their hard earned money or time on this place. There is no way that this is a 4* hotel . It‚Äôs a 2* /3 if everything went amazing for you and you were really pushing it.  I‚Äôm utterly disappointed and upset with this whole experience. Really would not recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sophie B wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: We stayed for 6 nights and the best time in Dar Atlas! We had a very warm welcome at the reception and have been escorted to our room. They brought our luggage up checked the AC and explain how the safe worked. Big thank you for that!    Special thanks goes to Sam Smilay and the rest of the Animation team. They know how to animate the people from early in the morning with aqua-gym all the way to the dancing in the evening. Loved the different evening themes and the connecting shows with it. I can only recommend to go to the theater show from them! They are doing everything on the French and English :)    Hicham and the bar team were great and quick with making your drinks and you never had to wait long. They always made sure tables outside are cleared quickly and should you not be able to find a seat they will go and find more tables and chairs for you at all times!  Already planing our next trip to come back

Review_Date: Terri D wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Writing this review from a sunbed around the pool.    What's good: entertainment team and the programme. They are not too pushy and tbh they are the only reason I am giving this review 2 stars. The bar staff are also good they do well to accommodate what you want.    Each room has a safe which is free to use and you also can access the WiFi all over the hotel and fro your room.    What's not good: 1. the accommodation is not what you see on the photos. It's a small dated room with a separate toilet and bathroom. We asked about this on arrival and the rooms advertised are apparently the family suites. There is no iron in the room my partner also moved the top blanket arrangement on his bed one afternoon to find blood stains on his sheets. However we didn't come all this way to stay in the room so it does what it says on the tin. Our air con works there's a mini fridge which works although the onsite shop is too expensive to keep filling it up.    2. The bar shuts promptly at 11pm and you cannot get a cup of tea or soft drink thereafter unless you wish to go to the discotheque and pay.    Also the drinks are served in small espresso paper cups by the pool and tiny glasses in the evening which is frustrating as two sips and you're up again to get another drink.    3. The food...I have read lots of reviews on here which mention a good variety of food. Indeed there are lots of large trays of mixed meat and veg  but there are no plainer alternatives for the fussy eaters. Unless pasta and bread rolls floats your boat!! We have seen French fries once in 5 days and there was a mad queue for them and the restaurant could not keep up with the demand.    What food does take your fancy is often like warm at most.    The hotel is miles from anywhere so you can't just nip out to eat either. Majority of the guests at this time are English and many that we have made friends with have skipped meals because the food is not to their taste. My partner is quite an adventurous eater and even he has said to dodge dinner as he couldn't face the poor selection.    We thought the snack bar would serve the regular hot snacks of pizza burgers nuggets chips etc....this is not the case it literally serves Danish pastries left over from breakfast and fresh crepes at about 3pm.    The best meal here by far is breakfast - but don't expect to see a fry up in the hot trays!! The egg counter is the best option which can be found outside in the morning.    4. Service in the restaurant usually in 4 star hotels we would expect some form of seating you at the table and some customary bringing you a drink etc. Not here literally it's a scrabble to find a clean set up table. If you want wine or a bottle of water you need to catch a staff members eye.  Even then they may not come over!!    I guess I am just wondering why this hotel is rated so highly - unless the rating is for the TUI sister hotel which does appear more plush from a brief visit for the cash point. We won't be coming back to this hotel and would not recommend it. The entertainment team and people we have met on this holiday have made the difference in giving this review a 1 or 0!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Shona M wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Great stay at the Valeria great wee shops with beautiful outfits which can be handmade to measure. Nice trip to the souks and the animation team were fantastic! Good entertainment all week. I will be back.

Review_Date: Bianca T wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Me and my friends came from London for a week in Morocco and we had so much fun. The hotel is lovely! The entertainment team was amazing! They are doing so many shows and they are so friendly. We made new friends and we enjoyed our time here. They made us feel welcome they made us laugh every single day. Thank you Valeria Dar Atlas! Thank you to the entire team for the good time that we had here.

Review_Date: Lisa D wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: The entertainment team are out of this world they've made our holiday the best the work they put in is unreal special mention to smiley Sam amine riko mamado and Santa. We will definitely be back.

Review_Date: Stephen M wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: We are having an amazing time here at this hotel.  The animation team are amazing. We have had good shows and poolside fun. Aqua aerobics with Smiley was the best üëå.  Sam smiley and all the team work so hard to make our stay here welcoming. Sam and amine riko manager mamado  choreographe sania kids club fayrouz and sabrina

Review_Date: Kay M wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Still here but have experienced some rude bar staff. We bought our own plastic cups for round the pool. The pool bar are saying we should not have them and to use their small paper cups.  We want to save the planet as much as everyone else and feel that the small paper cups are not suitable as they are small no more than a 125ml.  Please sort your bar staff out and make them smile. The only friendly one since being here is Soliman.

Review_Date: loozy wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Am currently here. Hotel is fine food good. Animation team are great work very hard and very friendly. But my god what miserable bar staff. They question every drink you have how many in your party etc. We take our own poolside cups as we don't want to use plastic and you would think we were committing a terrible crime not saving the planet!! Shame as everything else is good. We are couples in our 50 and 60 not lager louts lol
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nadia wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Loved the location the hotel the food the entertainment the wonderful friends we met and the trips we did whilst there. Never knew how much fun hotel reps could be aqua aerobics was simply the best.  Discovering Marrakech with the help of the hotel excursions staff made out trip so organised that we had good down time medina and souk visits as well as the balloon ride of a lifetime‚Ä¶.Morocco is amazing

Review_Date: Raj S wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Loved this resort the staff make it what it is. Our host Smailey Sam Amine Sania Mamado and all the others make the service and atmosphere great fire show entertainment and the fact they constantly come and check you are ok is great service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Aarondeep D wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Upon our arrival all we have experienced is 1st class service. The staff have been exceptionally pleasant especially smailey. He has provided us with great assistance and we are pleased to have come to a resort with people like smailey and the others who are apart of the animations team
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Shabnam A wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Valeria Dar Atlas Hotel is our first trip to Morocco and we are having a fabulous time the food is wonderful the staff are so helpful the entertainment is out of this world we especially enjoyed the Fire Show last nite it was awesome the music was so atmospheric in time to the dancing the flames was spectacular and the crowd went wild there was nothing we didn‚Äôt like we were transfixed the entertainment group do a marvellous job day in day out the evening entertainment is world class and this fire show was fantastic the entertainment crew Smiley Sam Amine Mamado and Sania are the best‚Ä¶thankyou for a memorable nite x

Review_Date: Christine M wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Absolutely wonderful hotel staff are amazing food great and the shows are incredible every night you are made to feel so welcome really I enjoy for fire show yesterday very nice specially animation team smiley  Sam  amine  mamado  Riko and choreographe Sania for kids club Sabrina et fayrouz

Review_Date: mollypops12 wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Staying with friend at this most wonderful resort the staff are absolutely amazing in every way they can not do enough to help us the entertainment in the hotel is absolutely fantastic the Fire show was brilliant the atmosphere was electric the choreography with the fire was fantastic the music was put together so well with the energy of the dancing and the flames. Well done cant wait ti see what you have on offer tonite for entertainment. Smiley Sam Amine Mamado and the wonderful Choreographer Sania are the BEST‚ù§Ô∏è

Review_Date: jonnyfalk wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: The hotel is amazing and the staff are wonderful and friendly. The entertainment is fantastic the fire show was brilliant. Special thanks to smiley and Sam momma do Sania the coregrafe ü•∞ü•∞. The food is amazing plenty of choices for breakfast lunch and dinner. The whole complex is fantastic and will definitely come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Aliyah K wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: This was my first time in Maarakesh. And it was amazing. I could thank the entertainers enough for making it so good. The entertainment was amazing.  We went out of the hotel few times but nothing beats the entertainment and energy we get in the hotel.  Amin was amazing made me feel so comfortable and made sure I enjoyed every second of the holiday.  As did all the other entertainers with everyone there.  I defiantly recommend this hotel to others. Will defiantly be visiting again for a break just to meet the friends I made in the hotel

Review_Date: Jamaal B wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Arrived at 9.30 pm was told to go straight for dinner leaving our suitcases out in the open at the main entrance. Then asked to keep our passports as we went for food. Our key to our room did not work the whole duration of our holiday which meant having to go back and forth to reception to activate our key which still didnt work. Not the best start. No iron No drinks in fridge (that barley worked). If you are all inclusive drinks finish at 11pm if you are there by 11.01 you will be paying. Gym is not included only 2 pieces of equipment which they then try charge you ¬£5 for. Food is shocking seems like they reused the food and no care was given. Finding hair and stale taste. Very false advertisement the pictures included advertising this hotel is infact another hotel. You can use the pool however no drinks food or access to some parts. On the plus side the entertainment staff especially were very lovely and really made us feel welcomed. The scenic route was really beautiful and hotel lovely. The aqua slides were fun however in the other hotel. Overall we will not be returning. Would definitely return to Marrakech however not this hotel.

Review_Date: Ian B wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Just got back from a week away we arrived about 2.30ish our room was not quite ready but we could use hotels bar and restaurant straight away.  We noticed after about two days and a couple of chats with animation team that  Das Valeria shares with a French outfit called club Corrija  This is a French company for French holiday makers and have some different functions this wasn‚Äôt communicated very well and led to some confusion and irritation as some British people were turned away from certain programs.  Once we had sorted that out we got on with our holiday it was ok we just left the French to themselves  But it is a very French resort english is spoken there but some days we thought we were treated 2nd class  Rooms were always cleaned fresh towels food was ok I have had worse on my travels

Review_Date: Jess J wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Me and friend came to the hotel. Very nice and clean good food very cultural.  Sam and the whole entertainment team and great! They looked after us the whole trip and made us all feel very welcome.. Sam Smiley and Amin the whole team are great!

Review_Date: Paula wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Arrived around 11 am and room was ready so able to check in straight off. Room was basic but cleaned and towels changed every day. Little terrace to sit on but both chairs were broken so had to be changed..took 3 days. 5 coat hangers between two of us..asked for more never arrived.. like the duvet we asked for as cold on some nights..never arrived. Site is well landscaped and pleasant to walk round. Pools one large with entertainment...this needed a good clean. Plenty of beds and always got umbrella but lots broken. Other zen pool was busy so had to get sunbed at times.  Entertainment team yes they work hard but their persistant approach us gnawing at times.  Food yes varied but wish they would sort signs for dishes.  Drinks are hit and miss.. think the hotel needs to invest in large glasses and a better ice machine..nothing worse then warm pepsi.  The down side of the holiday was a stomach upset 4 days before home...could have been too much sun the water (ice) or food but in last 4 days we spoke to at least 10 people who had same 'Moroccan tummy' and fact reception was giving out sachets of remedy could have indicated something.  In all 3/5 and don't think I would return.

Review_Date: Tracy B wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Amazing service welcoming and relaxing atmosphere. highly recommended to people wanting to live their best lives enjoying an amazing atmosphere all day!! Every member of staff you encounter in this hotel will make u feel welcome and put a smile on your face. Will deffo return to this hotel excited for my next Marrakesh experience

Review_Date: Karenp160571 wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: So we have just come back from a week at this hotel and I‚Äôm very confused by some of the previous reviews??.    When we arrived we were told our room wasn‚Äôt ready we said that‚Äôs fine they showed us to the bar area and we were served drinks of our choice. When we arrived at the room the only thing they had yet to do was put pillow cases on ( not a biggy) and we went to have a look around.    Ok the room Decor maybe a little tired in places but you go on holiday to explore and see the country you are visiting - not sit in your room!!! The room was clean and cleaned daily the beds were comfortable and clean.    Food was absolutely fine a huge selection for breakfast lunch and dinner again some say a little bit Samey but when you‚Äôre cooking to volume it‚Äôs hard to impress everyone!!. My hubby was a chef for 26 years and ate his body weight in food whilst he was thereüòÇ    We found the hotel nice relaxing and yes set up more for the French visitor but seeing as French is mostly a second language in Morocco it‚Äôs not a shocker!!! We did receive information in English for all the trips out and enjoyed a few we had our own English speaking guide and the French had theirs.    We had a fabulous time at the hotel been to a lot worse!. The staff be it cleaners entertainment staff bar staff waiters were all very friendly and helpful.    Don‚Äôt be put off by negative reviews- go see Marrakesh for yourselves it‚Äôs an experience and although a busy city we felt very safe. It‚Äôs a crazy busy place full of life yeah there are posh bit and not so posh bits - like any city in the world.    We had a blast and all four of us were impressed and would definitely visit again. My hubby left his go pro in a taxi- the taxi driver returned it to our hotel now would that happen here in the UK??    Super holiday lovely hotel super city - well done Marrakesh you were a laugh !!!

Review_Date: Jasmine wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Hotel needs updating old decor etc. Food ok if you like the same thing everyday. Avoid the entertainment team as the men on the team are very touchy feely and ask girls/women to go back to their rooms üò≠

Review_Date: Donna H wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: The animation team kept us entertained every hour ofthe day and night. Lovely people full of energy and do all they can to make you feel special. Even presented my partner with his birthday cake. Great bar service the entire holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Shay wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Smailey you can clearly see makes everyone feel comfortable. His bilingual ability is fantastic and does not single out anyone. He makes me want to get up and dance every night!  Rico‚Äôs enthusiasm and character made every night special  Jimi was always on hand to help!  Amine was able to somehow have the same amazing energy every single night - very lively

Review_Date: Emily E wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: We had a lovely stay at this resort. The entertainment staff were excellent and there was plenty of activities to get involved with. We had a Moroccan themed night and the food was excellent - would have loved to have had the option of more traditional food during our stay. Overall it was very clean and enjoyable. Also well worth a trip to the spa if you can!

Review_Date: Aimee wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Love the entertainment and the interaction from hotel staff and very friendly. It has Variety of fun activities and games. We got involved in quizzes and dances and smiley was very friendly and interactive.

Review_Date: Elizabeth M wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: We had an amazing time and a wonderful experience staying at Valeria Dar Atlas resort.  The staff were exceptional funny energetic and really kind and we can‚Äôt wait to see them again when we come back next year. They are great dance teachers and helped everyone get involved. Our special regards go to Smailey Amin Mamado for making sure we had the best holiday ever.

Review_Date: Lauren Jasmyn wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Overall we had a fantastic time you can see that the staff work extremely hard to put everything together all the entertainment food drinks and housekeeping etc.    Special mention to IBRIHAM who was working on the bar he was lovely and remembered our drinks each night. Also a special mention for MENDHI one of the pool boys he was so kind and chatted to my boyfriend and I about arsenal and some other things just a generally warm and friendly person! The entertainment staff were incredible shout-out to AMI Aye aye aye!! Can‚Äôt fault any of the team.    The food was good although a little repetitive I will miss the coffee and mint tea! Credit to the chefs for working so hard.    ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.The only down fall was the reception and excursions staff were a little rude and not very willing to help much ( I think it‚Äôs because we are English they made us feel as if we were asking too much of them.    But.. that didn‚Äôt stop us having a fantastic time we will miss this week place for sure! :)    ^^^^ pictures of some furry friends at the hotel!
