Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nikola Z wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: The best holiday ever with the best entertainment team and the best foot.  I will definitely come back again with all family.  Big thanks to SamSmiley AminRicoJimmy and Mamadu.    Keep being perfect in everything you do.

Review_Date: Jay wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: A first time All Inclusive for me but my wife has experienced this kind of holiday before.    The hotel was clean with spacious rooms and the food you could not fault. Alcohol the wine was palatable and the spirits we tended to drink Vodka or the Cocktails which were fine but the paper cups could have been bigger to stop the yoyo effect of going to the bar for beers! (a minor critic though)    If you enjoy activities then the Activities team will entertain you all day! We preferred a quieter time away from the loud music and activities near the big pool and found the more peaceful Zen pool more to my liking. However a small negative but the evening entertainment was very disappointing... Kids entertainment up until 9/9.30 but for the adults not much.    All staff were very friendly and helpful not going to name anyone individually as they were all so helpful.  The rooms were clean and tidy and towels were returned in the afternoons on every occasion if left out for washing.  The hotel gardens are beautiful and well maintained there are outdoor activities i.e tennis and petanque if you can manage to play in the heat.    Trips out  Marakech markets are an experience be prepared to haggle otherwise you will for sure be ripped off......but it is enjoyable and you will see how others live in this world. There is a minibus you can book at the Hotel (the Excursions office is next to Reception and the staff are brilliant).  When you get off the minibus turn left on to the main road and walk for some distance until you come to the coaches and horses then turn left and you will arrive at the square.    We ended the week with a Trip to the waterfalls near the Atlas Mountains and would recommend it but it is steep so wear shoes that grip!    All in All a good holiday and well worth the money

Review_Date: Michelle H wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Title: Do not believe the negative reviews
Review_Text: I was sceptical about coming after reading some of the reviews but I need not have worried. We stayed here with our two girls aged 13 and 12 for 10 nights during the summer holidays and we had a really good time. If they tweaked some parts this hotel could be amazing.    Negatives    The food in the restaurant was not that great for kids or fussy eaters and there was no labelling but if you asked the servers they were more than polite and helpful.    The excursion shop in the hotel had nothing in English to explain the trips it was all in French. We had to use Google translate which was very frustrating. The lady in the shop tried her very best to explain but again she was affluent in French not English. A lot of the entertainment in the evening was in French but the entertainment team did their best to speak in English also. One night there was a casino night but we could not join in at all as it was all in French which was a shame.    Wasps /bees. There were lots around the pool area which put us off drinking in the day. As soon as you put your drink down they were all over it. My husband was stung but it could have been one of the kids. I am allergic to wasps so it really concerned me and I could not relax fully.    Bar workers. I read a few reviews about the people working in the bar asking for girls numbers. Our girls are 13 and 12 but look much older. Yes on occasion they were asked their ages but once they all knew and I made it clear they were younger than what they thought the attention stopped.    Positives    The entertainment team make this hotel. They work 17 hour days to make sure you are having a good holiday. if you say no politely they walk away. My husband and I hardly ever join in activities as we like to relax however we played darts table tennis aerobics and joined in the pool games most days. The evening entertainment they worked really hard on also.    Restaurants. Whilst our kids really struggled my husband and I really enjoyed the food. There was plenty of choice and all of the food was cooked nicely. Being able to have a bottle of wine at lunch and dinner was a bonus. Some all inclusives are really tight on this. They also hand out large bottles of water whenever you want so again another bonus. We did not use the two restaurants that you pay for so cannot comment on these however we did not feel we needed to pay extra as the food in the main restaurant was varied each night.    Pools. We did not use the adult only pool as we always found sunbeds around the main pool. There could do with more sun shades as not enough and it was sweltering! Yes it was a little noisy but the kids enjoyed it and it didn't ruin our holiday.    Aqua park. This is just a short walk down the road from the hotel. We all really had a great time each time we went. It was never that busy that we had to queue for a long time and the slides were great. Having this included in the all inclusive was again another bonus that we were grateful for.    Overall we had a really really good time and would certainly be back if we were to travel to Marrakech again. People who have left bad reviews must be incredibly picky.

Review_Date: Barbi wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Our bags were taken from us upon arrival. Check in was easy enough but we were left waiting in reception for over an hour waiting to go to our room which we were told was ready. In the end we found our luggage and made our way to the room. The room was dirty and very disappointing. No towels or pillowcases on the pillows. We didnt have a clue where anything was in or around the hotel so were left to our own devices.  Complaints to reception were met basically with there is nothing we can do as there were no other rooms available. They had a very unhelpful attitude. We later discovered from a lovely French family they had asked to change rooms and were given a choice of three other rooms.  The hotel is set up for French speaking visitors most of the time we didnt have a clue what was going on.  On the second day whilst we were out of the room the air con failed and dripped water on the floor which I slipped on hurting my back in the process. Again  when this was reported to reception they didnt really want to know. They sent someone in a few hours later who looked should have fixed it but didnt as it dripped again soon after leaving us with no air conditioning in a stifling room for the rest of our holiday.    The food was ok that deserves the 1 star rating.    There are very mixed reviews regarding this hotel.    Unfortunately our experience was a bad one.

Review_Date: Samuel L wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: We had the most amazing week. Very pleased with the facilities hospitality & above all the amazing entertainment team. Smailey and Sam & his team is a breath of fresh air‚Ä¶‚Ä¶Aie aie aie!  We even dance to our country‚Äôs music Li tourner li tourner de l‚Äôile Maurice. Super!

Review_Date: Donna Petrie wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Our first holiday since lockdown. Had a great time and celebrated my birthday here. Cannot fault the staff or the food. Everyone is very attentive and ensures you have a great time. Had a fantastic holiday and will most definitely be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Austen H wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: We had an excellent time all of the staff have been amazing and the animation team was brilliant! The food and drink are great and I couldn't fault any of the members of staff they are all very kind and like to come and speak to everyone each day to make sure everything is perfect and if they can help in anyway.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: lisacracknell2 wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Amazing time had all the staff were brilliant very entertaining  Have been before to a different hotel but this was by far much more fun  The entertainment is amazing. Amin and his entertainment team work tirelessly to make sure your holiday is enjoyable    Will def return
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kelly C wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: If your English don‚Äôt go here unless you can speak fluent French. The moment we stepped into the hotel we were treated like dirt because we were English if your French you are treated like royalty.  It just got worse and we were only there 1.5days until we flew back home absolutely heartbroken.    Upon our arrival at the hotel we were told where to put our luggage and then told to go and sit in this room when entering the room it was cool and it was a welcome treat to sit and cool down there were refreshments given out although they run out and we were not given any. In fact as soon as they realised we were English we were escorted out of there and taken to the desk the gentleman took our passports from us photocopied them and given back to us all he did was put an inclusive band on each of us and told us to go and eat pointing to the dining area.    However with the other people in the cool room they were French speaking and they were all given refreshments they had their passports taken from them and then when the guy escorted us to reception he handed over the passenger‚Äôs passports and was given a handful of what I would call posh all-inclusive bands and then the guy returned to the room with these. I can only imagine that they were all sitting there and being waited on while they were being booked in and given their rooms in a nice cool and relaxing room and we were just shoved into a warm dining area and told to eat!    When we came out of the dining area I asked if our room was ready and we were told another hour! So we sat around and waited we were not given any information there was no relevant information whatsoever there was no map of the complex we were tired hot and exhausted that‚Äôs why we didn‚Äôt explore. If we were told we could go to the bar and relax or sit somewhere there is air condition would have been an immense help but nothing. An hour had passed and I approached the reception again bearing in mind everyone else has been booked in given a room and yet we were still waiting in fact we were the last ones left still waiting. The receptionist that proceeded to tell me another 20-30mins wait. NO I was not having that I had two kids we have had enough by then I was fuming I even mentioned the fact of how we were treated and yet the French have all cooled down in their rooms and no doubt happy. She could not answer that because she knew it was true. Then I asked why the room was not ready and she said they have not long checked out but I said everyone checks out at 12 she just looked and me and said YES that is right so how come our room wasn‚Äôt ready as it is now 4pm. She made a phone call come back and said they just need to sort a blanket will you be ok with that I said yes.    We then had help taken our suitcases to the room but when we got their it was more than just a blanket they hadn‚Äôt even finish we are now waiting outside the room for another 10-15mins.    The room was ok nowhere near like the ones on the website and this hotel is certainly not 4 stars! I would say more 2 to 3 stars that is regards to the areas we saw food room hospitality and the overall experience. Majority of the place looked run down.    When looking around the room I notice there was only one shower towel. I rang reception and they said they will drop more off. With that we had all passed out as we had been up since 01:30am when we woke up we had missed dinner my husband rush down to the dining area just after 9.30pm (When they had finished which I always thought when it 7.30-9.30pm surely you can still go in just before 9.30pm and eat but not here they want to be cleared and finished by then) to see if he could get anything for the kids especially my son as he was really hungry who didn‚Äôt really eat at lunch due to the fact the food didn‚Äôt look appetising he was told NO all finish he asked if there was anywhere we could get food they just said no they wouldn‚Äôt even allow a little something like a bread roll. My husband came back and with that we all tried to sleep again until the morning.    The following morning my husband was making the bed and noticed the pillow he slept on had no pillowcase on it and when he turned the pillow over it was stained which looked like blood we check the other pillows and none of them had cases on but looked ok. We all got up for breakfast still wearing what we had on as no shower towels had turned up. My husband and I went to reception and once again asked about the towels and now about a replacement pillow we were told they will sort it out. We had breakfast well lack of it anyway (the food poor therefore meaning we didn‚Äôt really eat a lot apart from bread rolls and butter). We went back to the room and once again there were no shower towels or replacement pillow I rang reception again and they said they will get this sorted as I told them I have asked for them twice now. None of us haven‚Äôt even had a shower yet by this time we were getting more frustrated.    So we thought we would have a walk round to see where the pools are etc. Well when it was stated 4 Large pools they didn‚Äôt specify 2 small baby size ones one main one and one adult one. Also the pool bar by the main pool looked derelict no signs at all as to what was on offer or what you can have no mention of food or anything. Just a few sorry looking tables around and that was it.    We asked for soft drinks although made to feel uncomfortable when doing so. After that I said to the kids let‚Äôs go and see if we can arrange some excursions if anything it would get us out of the hotel and see more of Marrakech. I entered the little room where we were put first thing as it was also for arranging excursions. I looked on all the boards all the information around and once again nothing in English. I came out and said to my husband this is ridiculous he went in and tried to ask but just got ignored. I thought I won‚Äôt give in so I went back into the room and waited to ask. The couple in front of me (French) had done what they need to do then I was next. He stretches over to pick up some information and then looked beyond me and said to the couple behind can I help you Madame (French). I tried to say I was next but he just ignored me too and carried on talking to the other couple. We then went into the bar area to have a drink and see if there was anything else we could do I got some drinks for the family from a nice friendly barman while we waited for dinner. We again didn‚Äôt have much to eat due to the poor quality food.    We returned to the room and still no towels or pillow! Then just to put the icing on the cake the air con stopped working at 8.45pm. We spoke to reception and they said they will send a technician to have a look. Over an hour passed and my husband rang again and was told they will send a technician then approximately 1hr and 10mins later they knocked on the door. This is approximately 11oclock at night. He fiddled with the buttons and said something to the other guy and he said to my husband would you be happy to swap rooms he said yes because it was way too hot. They took my husband to the reception then said to him they will call in 30mins with a room. He came back to our room and waited in the meantime I pack everything up so we were ready. Again well over an hour this is passed midnight now my husband rang reception and was told they checked 2 rooms but air con not working they will check another 2 rooms and they will let us know that call never came we had all passed out now due to the it being 2am. Then the stupid thing is that the maid turned up with one small towel at 10.20am I said don‚Äôt bother too late we were going home that day.    We have never felt so isolated so alone and to be treated like that was an absolute insult. It was rude and bad enough when we came into the hotel on arrival I even said to the receptionist that they were rude when I was trying to get my room but even then she was looking at me like I was nothing. To be honest the way we have been treated the time we spent at the hotel I wouldn‚Äôt even treat a dog like that. I have travelled a lot in my life and I must say that is the worst place I have ever come across.    Some of the problems to be aware off:    ‚Ä¢ Their food snack mealtimes etc are ridiculous long wait.  ‚Ä¢ They are certainly not a 4* hotel more like a 2*  ‚Ä¢ Their rooms are nowhere near as the photos online  ‚Ä¢ The food was horrible its quantity rather than quality pretty much the same every day and just no signs.  ‚Ä¢ Dirty/Bloody pillow which didn‚Äôt get changed  ‚Ä¢ It feels like they are rude to you if your English  ‚Ä¢ They don‚Äôt want to help you  ‚Ä¢ Calling the reception line takes ages for them to answer  ‚Ä¢ You get a little paper cup by the pool for a drink which only really lasts one sip.  ‚Ä¢ There is no information at all as to what is available for food or drink  ‚Ä¢ The pool bar is so uninviting only 3 tables. The bar staff were miserable and rude towards you very unwelcoming  ‚Ä¢ All excursion information should be available in the languages for all the guessed not just French.  ‚Ä¢ Out of the four food restaurants one you must book and pay for the main one is poor. The poor bar well we never saw anything available and the timing is only for one hour and we couldn‚Äôt find the other one.  ‚Ä¢ As for 4 large pools that is not the case at all 1 main 1 adult and 2 small (baby pools I would say)  ‚Ä¢ Bars once again only one found and the only place that seem to have air con staff didn‚Äôt want to help when asked about others.  ‚Ä¢ Don‚Äôt even know where the spa was  ‚Ä¢ Didn‚Äôt see or wasn‚Äôt given any information regarding the aqua park

Review_Date: Nicole Locker wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Had an amazing start to our holiday. From day one we have been treated amazing from many staff. Many of the entertainment staff had made it amazing for us getting us involved in activities. Big shout out to Smailey Sam and the rest of the team.. sorry I do not remember all the names.    A bit thankyou to the restaurant staff who have also been going above and beyond for us during our short time here.

Review_Date: Evie-tora wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: We came Friday to Thursday as our first holiday in the sun but not only that ‚Ä¶ my first aboard holiday EVER and it has been amazing.    The vibe as soon as you walk in as so welcoming and all staff here are super chill & wanting to help make your holiday the best it can be.    The food is varied which is great for anyone who wants to visit!    The pools are so lovely and you can guarantee a sun bed at any time.    I must say that they are point on with their cleaning me & my partner have seen all areas of the hotel outdoor facilities being cleaning regularly which is reassuring for how busy the hotel is.    Our room was lovely and had our own balcony for our own quite time as a couple :)    We had a very spontaneous photo shoot which captured our first night here.    All staff will smile & chat with you whenever they walk past ‚Ä¶ the entertainment will fit all!    Recommendation ‚Ä¶ MUST GO!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mel M wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: The hotel is lovely! The staff are very very welcoming they make so much effort with the people staying to speak with them and see how they are. The entertainment team are fantastic they always have something on to entertain adults and children! Sam and Smailey are great activities hosts and really get people involved and having so much fun!!  Definitely a must visit for a couples or family holiday! ‚ò∫Ô∏è
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Maddie wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: The activities were extremely fun and enjoyable the staff are also very kind and fun the time I‚Äôve spent here has been very fun. My favourite part was probably the dancing class that was very fun.  Thank you Smailey Mamadou Amine Sania Jimi Riko!!

Review_Date: Stella wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Wow we are only on day 3 but I feel I need to share what a great time we are having already.  The hotel is nice but the animation team and the activity programme are blowing us away.  The entertainment staff work so hard and are engaging and full of life.  They go out of their way to come and say hello and check everything is OK.  Smalley and Amadou plus the rest of the guys are the best.  The stage are is great for the evenings and I even won yesterday's challenge!!  Big shout out to the photography team too.  Can't wait to see what the rest of the week brings

Review_Date: Lyndsey D wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Everything about this hotel is amazing. Beautiful building amazing food friendly staff.  But what really makes this hotel is the entertainment team! They really do make the holiday. Everyone of them is so friendly and they make an effort to talk to the whole family. They work so hard from water aerobics dance classes and evening entertainment! So much enthusiasm!  Thank you Smailey mamadou Jimi Riko Amine and Sania you guys really are the best!!!

Review_Date: Angisplangi wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: From arrival to leaving it has been a great week away. We came on this trip to celebrate Mia's 21st birthday and have laughed so much. Nearly all the staff were helpful(you will always get the odd few) and ready to serve you with a smile even if they've been at it all day. Food was a little repetitive (especially breakfast) but plenty of everything always being refilled. AI spirits were limited but the measures were generous...they did AI cocktails plus cocktails you could purchase using branded spirits. The entertainment team were excellent always on the go encouraging but not pushy if you said no. Rooms were basic but provided everything expected. The main pool was busy as expected and rammed with sunbeds but not enough parasols for the amount of beds so try get yours early (lol). You can buy a ticket for towels for the week which you exchange every day for clean ones and get your money back at end of stay. The zen pool lovely if you wanted to get away from the kids in the main pool but whilst we were a party of 6 adults the day we went we were laughing but not overly noisy and were told to be quiet by the pool life guard who spent most of his time on his backside with his head in his phone and when a French family came in and started throwing a ball about being much noisier than we were he just shrugged his shoulders and said I don't understand in French when we questioned him. I have read many reviews about the staff being biased towards the French but this one incident was the only time we experienced it. The maids/cleaning staff & gardners did a brilliant job and our maid was so lovely. You had access to the water slides in the sister hotel but we were told we couldn't eat there. Would recommend a trip to the Souks (markets) by the hotel shuttle bus. When you get off the shuttle bus behind the small craft Market you need to get to the main road and turn left and keep walking till you see all the horses & carriages. Go up past them and you are at the entrance to the main market area....its an experience for sure. The half day trip to the desert with camel ride entertainment food and pool was OK albeit a bit long but we were told there was beer & wine and when we got there there was only beer and was chargeable bearing inmind we'd paid 50 euros per person  The photographers were good always clicking away but not intrusive. If you want some beautiful pictures to remember your holiday by then speak to them.    If you wanting a good value all inclusive holiday then this is it. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves but a holiday is what you make it...Enjoy

Review_Date: Nicky M wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Really clean rooms hotel was amazing  Food was varied plenty of choice. Breakfast was very much the same very continental‚Ä¶ lunch was amazing as was dinner. Plenty of food to choose from and endless amounts of bottled water which we were super grateful for.    The staff were very helpful and friendly we had no complaints at all.    Daytime pool was busy but we always managed it get a sun bed loved the daytime entertainment. The guys came round chatting away trying to get you included they were happy to chat and accept if you didn‚Äôt want to join in which I thought was great.    Amazing place to stay would highly recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Agnieszka P wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: I recommend this hotel only because they have great service that keeps people entertained ... They are super nice guys ... friendly thanks to them only the holiday is running .. The activities and show led by Smailey is just extra ...but the food that is served in the restaurant is at a very low level ... You can't always eat anything there ...The facility is well-kept although old but the cleaning staff and those who care about the gardens do everything to make it nice clean and pleasant....

Review_Date: Hajaoui wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Great stay. Wonderful room super beakfast warm & inviting hosts. Large area & different sport activities full of life and positive energy provided by a wonderful animation stuff. We'll definitely be back!    Thank you so much for the good services

Review_Date: RHulett wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Genuine review-  The physical hotel is what lets this place down. The grounds are beautiful and well kept pool is great and there were plenty of sunbeds. The rooms are dated in all honesty and the shower area is not fit for purpose as it floods every time. Towels were not replaced straight away but were taken first thing so you could be left until 7pm without fresh towels which wasn‚Äôt ideal.  However beds were comfy and the cleaners were great it was cleaned every day.    The staff make this place. Sofyan was brilliant when we arrived. Bar staff - Hicham Solomon Salah Madjhi to mention a few and the bar manager were just lovely people knew our drinks orders and couldn‚Äôt help us more. Were teaching us Arabic and generally chatty every single time.    The entertainment team are amazing. Jimi Rico Issa Smailey Amine Zac Sam all stood out - they don‚Äôt stop and try to involve anyone in anything. Again chatty friendly always and generally fun to spend time with - really made our holiday.    The bus service to Marrakesh isn‚Äôt bad- one bus was 45 minutes late and there is no way to contact the hotel if like us your phone doesn‚Äôt work in Morocco. The yellow taxis from outside hotel took us there for 150D sk we did that instead.    The food was decent we found. Different most days generally quite tasty. There is A LOT of fish and meat and nothing is labelled so this could be difficult for some. Children I imagine it being difficult for. Drinks are average too.    Overall we were generally quite pleased- it was an affordable all inclusive and is probably better than most I‚Äôve been to in Spain/ Greece for a similar price. Get to know the staff they will make your holiday and try everything you want to - we only wish we‚Äôd joined the activities from day 1!

Review_Date: Carly H wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Title: Great hotel, great facilities, friendly staff, nice rooms. Exceeded my expectations. Don‚Äôt be put off by bad reviews.
Review_Text: After reading some reviews before visiting this hotel I was a bit concerned about our stay. However Our experience at this hotel was very much a positive one. Do not be put off by negative reviews!!    On arrival at the hotel we were given a tour from Soufiane who was very welcoming helpful and friendly. This was the case throughout the holiday whenever we saw him.    The food was lovely even for someone with coeliac disease. The staff were very helpful whenever I asked questions and they informed me of what I could eat. They even got yogurts for me from the kitchen when I asked for them. All staff at the hotel were very friendly especially the entertainment and bar staff.    The drinks were also nice; a variety of cocktails beers wines and local spirits were available. Some branded alcoholic drink you had to pay for but we didn‚Äôt feel the need to do this and chose from the all inclusive options.    The quadruple hotel room was clean and spacious with two balconies. We had a fridge which was nice as we were able to keep our bottled water in there.    The animation team did a great job at keeping everyone entertained. Lots of sports and activities ran throughout the day and the shows in the evenings were great. Despite the entertainment team working long hours they were always in good spirits.  The staff were friendly and polite and always up for a chat. Special mention to smiley and jimmy.    The hotel ran shuttles to the centre of Marrakesh for a small charge which ran at various times of the day which saved us having to order a taxi.    The spa facilities were nice and we got a great deal which involved a Hammam body scrub seaweed wrap massage and access to the spa pool.    The hotel has two pools one busier one with access to the entertainment and a quiet ‚Äòzen‚Äô pool. It was nice to have both options.    We were able to connect to the hotel wifi at most places in the hotel free of charge which was also great!    Throughout the holiday if I ever struggled to carry drinks my suitcase or anything I was always helped by the staff even if I said I didn‚Äôt need it which was great!    The only downside to the holiday was that we had to ask for rooms towel as they were sometimes taken and not replaced but this wasn‚Äôt a big issue.    Overall great hotel great staff would recommend!  Be friendly and polite to the staff and they will be friendly to you!

Review_Date: Andre M wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Very sad to leave bad review but could not allow myself not to. We stayed 4 nights in this resort and it left us disappointed to say the least. The following are the reasons why so you take precautions:  - The WiFi did not work at all in our room I told reception 3 times on different days they asked me to show them on my phone and since it was connecting on the reception area they said it worked. I had to go back to my room and take a screenshot from the WiFi network page reading 'connection failed' only then they accepted it didn't work and the only thing they seem to have done was put my room number on a WhatsApp group and said it would ne fixed. Never happened so no WiFi in my room throughout the entire stay.  - On day two my husband asked for an additional key as we only got give one and they refused. I went and asked for one and they gave me one but the previous one we had was no longer working. So we got told we could only have one at the time which meant we could never do stuff separately and come back to the room at different time. Not Ideal.  -If you have any allergies you will struggle at the buffet as apart from one day during dinner the food had labels of what it was staff had no clue what was in it or could not advise at all. Breakfast was always the same food and limited. Again not ideal.  -Our A/C did NOT work in our room during the ENTIRE stay. We told them several times and even asked if we could change rooms but they either pretend not to understand or just said it would be fixed. We ended up having to rely on wet towels on top of us and sleeping with the back door open to let some air in albeit hot air. This was a health and safety hazard and yes we ended up getting sick from heat exhaustion under a 45 degree weather during the day and having no chance of cooling down this hindered our stay as we could not to everything we had planned.  -The mattresses on the beds are beyond uncomfortable they are lumpy and tough I slept on the floor once as it was much better than this godawful beds.  -Lastly we thought of treating ourselves to a Spa treatment within the premises and they had an 'Oriental Ritual' package which included the following: body scrub and foot scrub hamman preparation body sculping and massage and scalp scrube and massage with a rinse of rose water at the end - All for 350 MAD per p. We requested this service for each and they said that it didn't include the massage do if we wanted one we had to pay 100 MAD more. I was confused as the massage was listed and they kept saying it was not that no massage would be given if we went for the one infront of us on a printed sheet. We ended up agreeing to pay 450 MAD each to get everything. The scrub and massage went well and they sent us to a private pool for the spa to chill which we enjoyed we knew we were still missing the scalp scrub and rinse we got out the pool and asked where to go next to the remainder and they said we didn't pay for that as we decided to go for the massage package. WHAT?? this was never agreed and they just ignored us in the end and said we were done. A total of 4 people in the reception just blanked us and said no more services for us. Absolutely shocking.    All in all please go elsewhere when you travel to this beautiful country. We will return to Morocco but never set foot in this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ben M wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: This was our first holiday in almost four years (and my youngest daughter aged 2 first ever holiday) and was left a little deflated with the experience (except for the entertainment team). Firstly the rooms are very basic the A/C worked but never got really cold just cool enough to not be uncomfortable at night. We had ants every single day coming through the patio doors and asked at reception but nothing got sorted. The rooms were cleaned every day and towels washed and returned each day. Food was pretty good given the mass production - lots on offer each evening and this for an AI hotel was ok. One comment is that there wasnt an awful lot for children apart from pasta. DRINKS - this is the biggest let down. Literally we did not see an ice cube all week. The inclusive cocktails were pretty awful and only local beer which you could only get a small glass at a time of. The service at the pool bar and the normal bar was awful and not an enjoyable experience at all.    SERVICE - well where do I start. As others have advised wrist bands are given out to all guests and are colour dependant on what nationality you are. It is very clear that the French are given better service ICE and it looked like premium spirits as well without additional pay that the English were asked to pay if we wanted them. I genuinely am shocked at the way that English people were attended to VS other nationalities. We spoke to a few guests there who all felt the same as us (and in fact had an even worse level of service than we saw) The main benefit of this hotel is the entertainment team who worked so hard every day. From games in the pool to the evening shows they were fantastic. Top marks to Sam who remembered my daughters names and always went out his way to speak to us. The girls loved the fire show but the rest of the evening entertainment was pretty much the same each night in the main outside bar. They had an indoor theatre that had a variety show/karaoke/kids show - pretty typical for what you would expect from a holiday resort.  Also a special mention to the photographer/moustache man Hamzar who again loved my two girls and spoke to them every day. - top quality guy!    Hotel management should look at service levels lose the wristbands and treat guests a lot better. Ive been to a fair few all inclusive hotels mostly 4* and above. They put this one at 2* at its very best.

Review_Date: Chloe D wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Really enjoyed our stay at Valeria from the start we had a warm welcome from Sofyan who showed us around. The hotel is beautiful always someone gardening/maintaining the grounds very scenic looking gardens around the rooms. The rooms were basic but clean and had air con and a mini fridge. The all inclusive drinks were really nice and the food was good with loads of variety. Barmen were always pleasant to speak to especially Solomaine Haisham and Sallah - who taught us to count to 10 in Arabic! The entertainment team were fantastic the best I‚Äôve ever seen! Always getting us up to do activities and so much to do for both kids and adults here. These guys just didn‚Äôt stop! Even when he was on his day off Sam was DJ‚Äôing the disco! Amin Issa Jimi Zac and Rico stood out in particular thank you so much! Felt in safe hands all the time very talented friendly and energetic team. You guys were great and made it a truly memorable experience!

Review_Date: SKH wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Title: AWFUL EXPERIENCE, NO SAFETY, THIEVES, LIARS
Review_Text: This is an awful Resort to stay in the food variety is the same each day and gave me food poisoning they have no real care for hygiene. The towels are removed every morning (when you are supposed to take a shower) and are never replaced despite requesting several times. The rooms are very basis and the AC has a mind of its own - it works when it wants to. The staff are completely awful and lie to your face. They have a real issue with sun beds and umbrellas; you have to sit in the heat without an umbrella despite requesting these.    The most shocking experience was when two random men walked into our room at approx 8am with a keycard and the Resort staff called us liars that this wouldn't happen; despite accepting to me that their key card system does not work properly. They say one thing and then another - constant lies. My designer sunglasses also got stolen at the Resort when they held my luggage hostage as I refused to pay the bill because they refused to resolve the issue about men walking into my room. I called the Moroccan police and reported this incident and till this day have not heard anything back. The Manager and staff were very rude shouting and aggressive; I did not feel safe at all! If you are just females travelling then this hotel is not for you. Money was also stolen at this hotel and the hotel staff did nothing.    They are all well versed with their stories refuse to help you and make you feel helpless. AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL - AVOID AVOID AVOID!!

Review_Date: Fatimah R wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: My time at the resort has been amazing. Great experience. I spoke to smiley and he was very understanding about my allergy also very good entertainment from him as well as the activities. Smiley has a lot of confidence and has been an amazing host made us feel very welcome and made us laugh all the way will recommend this resort to everyone    Team  Sam lead chef de sport  Amin responsible mamado and sania  Choreographer and kids club subrina  Fayroz and Riko  Smiley co sport
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rajesh P wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Excellent animation team very friendly  work very hard lots of activities to choose from love the beach volleyball and water polo great shows and lots of food and drink to choose from too. Rooms keapt clean . And easy to get served at bars.  Smailey and amin etc sam et mamsdo etc Sania choreographed and riko and jimi kids club fayrouz et sabrina

Review_Date: Mia wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: A good experience. The entertainment is amazing for both children and adults. Workers are really good at their jobs and always doing something. Everything is up to standard.The fire show last night was amazing and it was fun to watch for all .

Review_Date: Fran W wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: My trip here as been amazing! Lots and lots of different types of food for breakfast lunch and dinner. We had the all inclusive package and was worth it! I would recommend that. We went on some amazing trips we went to see a waterfall and traveled into Marrakesh a couple of times. The entertainment and shows have been incredible. EVERY SINCE STAFF MEMBER is SO welcoming kind helpful full of energy and amazing! I definitely will be coming back soon! :D

Review_Date: Max P wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: The experience at this resort was one of the best experiences I‚Äôve had at a resort the staff are involved more than ever there is much to do and much is offered. Also the food is spot on from breakfast lunch and dinner so you‚Äôll never go hungry and to top it off the entertainment set by the staff in the evenings makes the experience worth will. We will be coming back again for sure. Huge thanks to smiley the new animateur  Samamine MandiRikojimi and coregraphe sania and kids club fayrouz and Sabrina thanks

Review_Date: heuwlen wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: We have just come back from an amazing 7 night stay at this hotel from the moment we walked in we were greeted by an amazing team.    The entertainment team really make this hotel the energy and passion they all have for their job is outstanding especially when you consider the heat and the hours they work.    A huge shout out to Smiley who made sure we were welcomed everyday. He gave fabulous yoga classes and aqua aerobics also he was brilliant with the water polo!    Amin had amazing energy and kept everybody entertainment from first thing in the opening to last ring at night.    Can‚Äôt wait to return    Thank you

Review_Date: Cl√°udio Peixoto wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: All the team including all the animation restaurant theatre and dance Club.  Samiley entertainment and his teambest ever    All good here.    Hope everyone could come here at least once in life.    Food os good also.  Team allways smilling to us Asking if we need something.

Review_Date: luispedrocavalheiro wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Title: Really nice experience! I really recommend
Review_Text: It is being a really good experience at the hotel and the animation team it‚Äôs amazing! All of them are really funny and kind with a friendly behaving! The restaurant the theater the disco the bar and all the shows are really really nice! We want this team during our staying here! Congratulations for all of this friendly and amazing experience

Review_Date: Euwan wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: The hotel has been a great experience from start to finish the staff have given us nothing but great energy and looked to teach us along with give us a premium experience. New entertainer/animation Smailey has been a pleasure and killing it on the dance floor with the performances outside and with disco tech earlier in the week he has taken us around and catered to us perfectly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Charlotte B wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Amazing holiday!  Booked a cheap deal for a girls geraway (¬£500 each for 7 nights all inclusive). We were not sure what to expect but have been so surprised by every single aspect of the hotel.  The all inclusive food is great quality and there are plenty of options even for fussy eaters. Lots of options for all inclusive drinks including hot drinks cocktails and soft drinks.  Facilities include main pool with entertainment all day; zen pool which is more relaxed; spa facilities at a great price (around ¬£20 for a 25 minute massage); plus table tennis and football tables.  The animation team make the hotel what it is. During our week we were particularly impressed with the service from Smailey Zak and Mamado. The staff are always cheerful and full of energy. They run all of the entertainment throughout the day and evening and genuinely enjoy what they do. They take the time to ensure every single guest is happy and strive to meet their needs.  Honestly could not have asked for a better holiday and would pay much more to return in the future.

Review_Date: S S wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Title: Not all that it makes out to be
Review_Text: So went as a family of 8 during the end of July for 5 nights and 6 days and our experience was definitely in the middle. Not all the best but not the worst.    Firstly be expected to pay a city tax to the hotel. It works out to ¬£20 per person for 5 nights. This was unknown to us but we paid it.    We were given some drinks on entry which was nice of them as it was so hot.    We then had three rooms booked 2 doubles and 1 to be shared by 4 but when getting there we realised that the sofa on the side counts as a bed which is a shock as you‚Äôve paid for each person equally to get an actual bed.    On top of that we arrived at half 11 and online it does say check in at 12 but we were made to wait till 2.30 pm and only got our rooms at 2 after I had to complain that my dad is unwell and needs to rest.    When going to our rooms we realised the 1 double room was great as the AC was actually working fresh towels were placed and it was ready to go into but the other two rooms which were joined (as in the door between them was unlocked) were not ready. No towels and very poorly working AC.    After complaining about it many times they moved me and my husband to another room and finally locked the door in between (which we felt was left opened because that way the AC for the other room would keep our room cool.)    Now moving into the new room the 2nd night was fine at first but between the 3rd and 4th night the AC was a mess again and on the 4th night the AC began to crackle and release smoke. In the morning little bits from the AC were on the floor which worried me as I am pregnant also.    After complaining once again they did manage to sort it but it didn‚Äôt do much as we were leaving the next day.    Now moving into food. There was a massive variety in the all inclusive but what we didn‚Äôt know or wasn‚Äôt told about was firstly what each food is so it was literally a test and trial error because of the lack of labels.    Aswell they had an outside mini kitchen which did pizzas and omelettes but again we weren‚Äôt told about that and on the last morning when we did find out the queues were long under scorching hot sun so it wasn‚Äôt even worth waiting for.    What we also weren‚Äôt impressed with was on the second evening we went to sit on the tables on the left which were for families of 8 and as we sat down the waiter literally said ‚Äòoi for families for families‚Äô I told him I was with my family and they are coming down but the tone he took and the way he spoke to me was so rude and disgusting. So we had to move to the other side and join the two tables. I don‚Äôt know if it was because of who we were or whether he just saw the 3 of us first but it was unacceptable. And not only this when we later returned to get water bottles he again questioned why we came to the canteen as if accusing us of returning for more food which to be honest is no concern of his as it is all inclusive for a reason and we have paid.    Entertainment was good but luckily we weren‚Äôt forced to join. Partially because we didn‚Äôt get to close but we could see how they are very social with certain groups of young women but I have no personal complaints about that.    In terms of tourism and being shown around luckily my husband had contact with a driver who showed us around and took us to places so the hotel didn‚Äôt really do much in regards to that but there were options at the hotel but considering how much we paid and how much the hotel stated it is better to go private.

Review_Date: Maria wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Title: This hotel is an average hotel
Review_Text: English is minimally spoken here and it may take a couple of tries but you will get there in the end French is a more common language here the reception staff are the same it will take a couple of tries before they understand what you mean or respond to you but they try and they will get there. The reception also don‚Äôt tell you about all the things that are available in the hotel or even give you a nap as the hotel grounds are huge and you are expected to just figure it out. The food is average and does the job but it would be nice to have actual Moroccan food and maybe a larger variety. The animation team are really lovley and energetic and always put their all into the shows however since we are in morroco it would be nice to have shows that are morrocon orientated and have some morrocon culture. The shops outside the hotel are quite expensive and their isn‚Äôt any more shops around and you have to travel at least half n hour to get to some shops. Your probably better off booking trips of Tripadvisor before you get to morroco as you won‚Äôt be able to find anyone. It would probably be nice for them to provided some equipment to play with at the tennis courts as we didn‚Äôt even know they were here till our 5th day here as you have to walk down a garden path to find it. All in all it‚Äôs an okay hotel and it‚Äôs not all that bad

Review_Date: Rachel C wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Staff are amazing especially Loko Sofyan and all of the entertainments team so much energy so friendly and they make the hotel! A few things I wish I knew before coming :    Aircon the aircon in the room is just OK not as strong as most air con units! Air con in the bar and resturant is very very faint only just a little cooler than outside.    Food: all meals are in buffet you can pay to go to the Al la carte. Snack bar does not serve lunch only pancakes at around 4pm.    Drinks - a small selection of cocktails and mocktails some spirits coffee tea white red and Rose wine.    Can pay for premium cocktails for 70dhs around ¬£5 well worth it.    If you have allergies this is not a good hotel for you! Nothing in the buffet is labelled nothing at all!!!    Good hotel for the price.

Review_Date: MF wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: On arrival (11:30am) we were told our room was not ready and we would have to wait until 2pm in 45 degrees heat. Not ideal in the slightest. We were then given wrist bands for all inclusive and soon realised that you were given different colours depending on your nationality. At first we thought that was so the staff knew what language to speak to you in however we soon realised that the English get treated COMPLETELY different to the French.    The French were called to the front of drinks ques at the bar and would get served ahead of the English wearing the light orange wrist bands. The French would receive double the measure of alcohol that the English were given. They also had welcome drinks on arrival (we were offered nothing). The French were also given their drinks in the bottles themselves where as when we asked for that we were told no and that we had to have tiny white plastic cups that you‚Äôd get at a kids party. We have never been away and felt we were being treated differently due to being English. Absolutely shocking.    The rooms were basic and are in need of TLC. I would not rate this as a 4 star hotel by any means. The food was not good either and there were no labels on ANYTHING which was completely helpless when you couldn‚Äôt guess what anything was due to it‚Äôs appearance‚Ä¶‚Ä¶    The entertainment I couldn‚Äôt really comment on as we didn‚Äôt get to see it due to there being a very small amount of tables that went by 6pm.    My last negative comment about this hotel would be how inappropriate the entertainment team are with girls who come here on holiday. It was cringeworthy to see and very much a put off.    We would never look at returning to this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: D W wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: PLEASE READ BEFORE BOOKING HERE!  The Dar Atlas may look appealing in the photos however the place is very dated and run down. I wish that was the only problem with it. If you want to witness how a hotel makes a profit from all inclusive you‚Äôll see it here. Ridiculous queues for every meal with poor quality food the reward for your patience if there‚Äôs anything left at all. We tried various times for all meals with the same results. If you want a drink from one of the two poorly run bars set aside 15-20 minutes to get your very small beverage usually with no ice because the bucket is empty and nobody can be bothered to refill it. And forget about sitting to enjoy the ‚Äòentertainment‚Äô as you‚Äôll need to get fed and seated by 1800 to stand a chance. It may seem like trivial points but over the course of a week it really starts to annoy and you realise just how overcrowded the place is and how bone idle most of the staff are. I say most of the staff some are incredibly active and turn the pool into an aqua aerobics human soup at least 5 times a day with music so loud and distorted it‚Äôs almost unrecognisable. The cleaners never cleaned our room once never changed any sheets or replaced the 2 towels they expected a family of 4 to share (asked for more and was repeatedly chinned off).  In summary; The best time we had on our holiday was the time we spent away from this shambolic hotel.

Review_Date: Gavin S wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Big hotel with a big personalty wonderful entertainment very clean a tidy wonderful pool's and staff are all top rate big shout out for AMIN SAMMAMADO SANYALOKORICCOJIMYMIDOUFAYROUZSABRINand DJ ABDEL from night club  The holiday with my family it's very nice we come back soon

Review_Date: Debra S wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Lots of positives but some negatives that need addressing .  Rooms ok little dated but clean and comfortable    The bar was a let down the drinks are very poor  never any ice and the beer pump always not working so canned beer which was not good tasted cheap  Food was ok  salad bar was excellent .  Pancakes good too .    Tonic and mixes from bottle so always flat .  Positive large bottles is water always available    The bar staff where always friendly and worked hard to please the guests    Entertainment staff make the holiday they work so hard and always very happy and so much fun .    Management need to be grateful for the staff as they make up for the things that are not so good .  Let‚Äôs hope they can make a few minor adjustments and this would be a perfect holiday choice .    We used the sister hotel aqua pool with slides  highly recommend .

Review_Date: Luke J wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Just returned from a fantastic week at dar atlas resort. Honest review ahead.  The hotel and grounds are beautiful and spotless cleaners are constantly out day and night making sure everything is clean and tidy gardeners maids bar staff waiters all fantastic and very hard working.  Talking of hard working i really cant describe just how amazing the animation/entertainment team are at this hotel constant fun and getting everyone involved yes they do tey to get you up to join in but a polite "no thank you" is all you need. Big big thanks to Amin (the really lively one) sam rico zac mido and all of the others for making this place so memorable. Food: the restaurant is large and busy with the normal things that should be expected from a busy all inclusive restaurant its not nuggets and chips everyday always a good variety and always hot and plentiful morrocan night was great with lots of local dishes cooking away on traditional tagines. Plent of wine juice bottled water and fizzy drinks continental style breakfast with pastries cheese ham etc good coffees too. Pool. The pool is much larger than it looks in the pictures and our family of 4 never struggled to get 4 sun loungers with a parasol the pool are is busy and loud with music and activities going on throughout the day. There is a quiet (zen) pool on site too which looked lovely. You do have full use of the water park at the sister hotel next door (5-10 minute walk) which is great fun there is also an atm machine at the sister hotel which was handy. Room: we had a quad/family room upstairs in one of the many riad style buildings the room was quite basic but the aircon was good (weather was 40c during the day and 25-30 overnight) so the aircon was very appreciated. Our room was cleaned everyday with new towels provided and we were perfectly happy with it. Location: this hotel is a 25 min drive from central marrakesh and menara airport it's quite literally in the middle of nowhere with no shops or a.enities within walking distance the hotel provide a shuttle service to marrakesh for 20 dirhams each way per person.  Negatives: although we had a fantastic family holiday here there were some things that could be do a bit better. Although its classed as all inclusive there are hidden charges everywhere you have to pay for drinks at the zen pool why when they are included at the main pool 2 mins away ?? you have to pay for juice in the bar why when its free in the restaurant next door ? Premium cocktails have to be paid for and so does a city tax of 20 dirhams per person per night for your whole stay we didnt know about this until we arrived to check in. Glasses for drinks are so small you have to constantly queue up to get another one in the intense heat if only they used bigger glasses/cups it would save a lot of unnecessary queuing. Apart from these little blips i would highly recommend this hotel and would happily return for another stay.

Review_Date: Sarah A wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Lack of staff and all miserable  Food terrible bland tough and tasteless.  Not enough pool towels or umbrellas in 40 degrees heat.  Entertainment staff work the hardest.  Money needs spending on it.  Also better drinks in the bar and available ice  WiFi link low only works in the foyer or bar. Not your room or pool area

Review_Date: Happychick01245 wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: We booked 5 nights for our anniversary perfect for those few nights. Hotel and facilities are fantastic there is a big variety of activities each day and evening. The entertainment team are excellent always very friendly welcoming and helpful. They have a kids club which looks really good from what we have seen from the evening disco and we walked past the kids club when we first arrived and was exploring the hotel and it‚Äôs a nice big building with a small pool and play area for families. We would bring our children back here. The rooms are very spacious and air conditioning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Daniella L wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Title: Honest review below Average not the best hotel
Review_Text: Went with my sister and booked through love holidays    When we arrived we were told we had to pay tourism tax which we did not know which was about 600 diram for a week and was told our room wasn‚Äôt ready and would be ready about 3/4 hours time    We had spare clothes and swimwear in our hand luggage so went by the pool and came back a few hours later and it was ready    Amazing hotel with beautiful greenery and two pools (ones a big main pool and the other smaller and adults)    Rooms were nice and was clean very good aircon which was needed with the hot weather our room was cleaned everyday but had a few days were our towels were taken and none replaced so had to call front desk for towels which we didn‚Äôt receive till the next day. Shower was very slippery and asked if we could have a mat and was told they didn‚Äôt have any to give so had to use a hand towel as slipped and hurt myself multiple times in the shower    Entertainment team were really good during the day and had a lot of activities to do during the day which were fun and put on a show every night were VERY VERY pushy to get people to go into the nightclub and wouldn‚Äôt take no for an answer a few inappropriate comments and stuff made which made us feel uncomfortable and a few incidents with young girls being asked to go back to the entertainers room. Didn‚Äôt know if it was because we were two girls but the entertainment team would not leave us alone    Food was the worse part‚Ä¶breakfast was very limited no hot food and mostly just pastries lunch and dinner were very repetitive. If you liked meat then it‚Äôll be alright but no vegetarian options and hardly any variety especially for fussy eaters    Waiters were really nice and brought wine and drinks to our table most nights and made sure we are alright throughout the time    Booked all inclusive but found there was a lot of extra payments for things including the second restaurant tea/coffee cocktails etc and had to pay past 11 for any drinks wanted    Booked a few trips with the rep and they are not as advertised at all and were not warned went on a trip to the Atlas Mountains and wasn‚Äôt told this would involve climbing the mountain to see a waterfall with my sister who has mobility issues she couldn‚Äôt do this so wasted lots of money for something she couldn‚Äôt do was then told we had to pay the tour guide 100 diram for his time which was meant to be included in the price paid    All together was an ok hotel but not 5 star or worth paying for all inclusive. Would not return unless the staff changed as felt very uncomfortable a lot of the time and for that reason we would not return

Review_Date: Aaron wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Was at work when I had various emails from our travel provider that Valeria Dar Atlas Resort was overbooked    We‚Äôve had this booked for a few months and 24 hours before we fly getting notifications that they deliberately overbook so they are at full capacity is shocking    Luckily our travel provider managed to get us a alternative quickly but sounds like we dodged a bullet and seen some of the other horror story‚Äôs on here from last week which could of been us stranded    Would never go here or recommend here

Review_Date: Olivia D wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: The staff are very friendly and welcoming and help cater to all! The resort itself is awesome and is inclusive to all and offers great service. The food is amazing and has a variety of options. Staff members are very optimistic and are always positive. There are many activities you can partake in at the hotel like aqua zumba water aerobics darts tournament water polo and the big surprise every evening like the guitarist the singer‚Äôs africa show white party 80≈õ show round the world variety show and the karaoke night very amazing which is all staff run by the entertainers. big shout out to AMIN the energy one .  thanks to much for this lovely holiday with my family VALERIA DAR ATLAS coming back soon

Review_Date: Kayla E wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: I came with my family and we have had an amazing two weeks at the Valeria Dar Atlas Resort. The staff here have been very kind and welcoming in particular Sofyan who was very accommodating my family and I. The cleaners were lovely cleaned our room every morning and would always ask if we needed anything. The restaurant had a wide selection of food only downside was the food not being labelled - as someone with allergies had to be extra cautious. The overall hotel was very spacious clean and kept at a cool temperature which was ideal on the hotter days of our stay.    A great holiday at a great hotel!

Review_Date: gillybaby1962 wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Great holiday.  Hotel - staff are great help you all the time they are friendly and so attentive. Rooms are cleaned daily spacious with great air con. They also do currency exchange.  Food - so much choice worth doing all inclusive just to try the different dishes served.  Drink - must try the Atlas cocktail my personal favourite cold bottles of water always available but plenty of other choices too.  Pools - there are two pools in this hotel family one and an adults only one with a third pool/aqua park in the sister hotel 5 mins down the road. They are clean always plenty of sun beds and you can hire towels if you need to and if you can grab a parasol you will definitely need it.  Photographer - get your photos done by Hamza great photography great package prices hes lovely.  Animation - the best bit. The team get you involved around the pool in the daytime the bar area in the evenings and even during showtime they‚Äôre great fun lively and so energetic. Big big thank you to all the animation team but special thanks to Mamadou always smiling (my favourite) Sam Mido Rico Amine Jimi and the girls from the kids club. We loved every minute of our time there. Highly recommended and we will certainly go back. I MISS YOU ALREADY.

Review_Date: Tessa W wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: COME HERE ON HOLIDAY. Great food lots to do. The entertainment staff are very friendly. Do the aqua aerobics it‚Äôs great! We felt at home and didn‚Äôt want the holiday to end. We would recommend to stay longer 1 week is not enough. Was the best place to come to celebrate a birthday. Big shout to :SamRicomanadosoufaynMido

Review_Date: Hamza r wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Unbelievable experience.  The staff were very friendly and helpful specially Yahya a very nice guy and Ilham the best manager ever !  The food was amazing.  I really recommend this hotel.  A place to enjoy and relax !

Review_Date: Aabi WP wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Title: AVOID IF YOU HAVE DIETARY RESTRICTIONS
Review_Text: The general rooms cleanliness was absolutely fine. Most staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Entertainment team MAKE the hotel and are the best part of it. They're are different activities every day and always some form of entertainment.  Bartenders are lovely drinks were absolutely fine and the option for Shisha in the evening was nice.    The ZEN pool is a life saver if you want a quiet area for just adults (although if you want safe space under some shade you'll have to get there early. Soft drinks are free at this pool alcoholic drinks are not).    My biggest issue and biggest complaint is the food and the entire dining situation. Unless you are at the door for the exact time meal times started you are never going to find a clean table or have hot food. The table clothes are just flipped around so you can still see stains from the previous families eating on that table).  You had to hunt down cutlery and plates yourself. And if you were lucky you might find food that was actually hot.  My biggest concern was when I asked a chef for a spoon for a vegetarian item he told me to just use the same spoon from the fish dish. It made me concerned about cross contamination and being sick.    Unless you're a meat enthusiast you'll be eating the same food everyday and unfortunately food is a major part of being on holiday.    I once got some carrot mash that had a whole uncooked carrot it in that hadn't been mashed up properly. Some days my roast potatoes were completely raw in the middle. Lunch and dinner are pretty much the same foods (other than pizzas outside) which meant I lived on pasta and courgettes all week. (Once I had a real treat of a stuffed pepper).    Breakfast is acceptable but if you're looking for a hot breakfast you'll be disappointed.    The entire dining experience stressed me out and it felt like you had to fight for a table or just hang around and wait for someone to half clean a table whilsts certain others received special treatment with a clean table automatic wine on their table and some didn't even get out of their seat for food and drinks! (Once you see the coloured wristbands you'll understand).  Cross contamination happened all over the restaurant so if you have an allergy or worried about being sick don't come here.    I never expect much as a vegetarian travelling abroad but this was the poorest experience of food I've ever received.    Other negatives:  -They didn't change our bedding the entire 7 days we were there.  -They DO NOT exchange money at the hotel so please change it at the airport. You have to walk to the sister hotel to use the ATM.  - It's difficult to find seating on an evening most people were using deck chairs by the pool so they could enjoy drinks and some entertainment.  -shuttle bus into Marrakesh doesn't have air conditioning.  -Not enough parasols/shade to keep out of the sun when using the pool!    Positives:  -The Excursion team are lovely and we had the best time seeing the waterfalls.  -The hotel has an amazing photography team.  -Shisha on an evening was lovely and we were well looked after.  - the grounds are lovely and green and well maintained.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Zoe F wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Fantastic holiday!! So much to do all the Animation team are amazing. Special thanks to Sam Amin Mamido Mido and Rico. Everyone is so friendly and always so energetic! Love the pool area lots of sun beds. Hotel rooms are spacious and cool which you need when it‚Äôs 45¬∞  Lots of choice for food and all inclusive is worth it totally!  Hamza the photographer is so good! Get your pictures with him if you can :)  All in all a great holiday highly recommended!

Review_Date: James Gleave wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Title: Full review if Valeria Dar Atlas
Review_Text: On arrival we whwre met with city tax that was 20 dirraham per day oer person this should have been highlighted with our travel agent. Our rooms where not ready at 13.00 and reception gave us the light coloured orange band meaning we where English this I thought to be extremely poor and is not equality as we would learn over time.    Rooms where very basic with poor flow of weak Aircon. Tv was small and looked as if it was thrown on the wall. WiFi signal was very poor and no towels tl have a shower. We had to contact reception daily to request clean towels and toilet roll as the cleaning consisted of emptying the bin and taking old towels. After 6 hot uncomfortable nights we had to complain again as the bedding had yet to be changed.    The food was much the same ever day and manic at meal times. The day time snack bar was a bread roll and jam which is extremely poor. The zen pool offered foor for a premium price and charged you for alcohol.    Entertainment was poor from my opinion and the notice boards for Entertainment did not match what was on. The staff where friendly enough but as the week went on we started to notice how the dark orange bands clients where served quicker larger drinks and did not have to pay for coffee which we had to. If you spoke French you received a lot better treatment than any other language.    Overall if I could claim a refund I would. It has put me off returning to morocco as the advertised hotel was not what we got.    2 star at most.    Please read lots of reviews before booking this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lisa B wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Title: Went for 9 days to valerian club dar atlas
Review_Text: Holiday review of CLUB DAR ATLAS.    On arrival to the hotel we where shocked to discover that we had to pay morrocon City taxes at check in. It was 20 diraham per person per day. Our stay cost for 2 people 400 diraham.  Holiday review o  Holiday review of CLUB DAR ATLAS.    On arrival to the hotel we where shocked to discover that we had to pay morrocon City taxes at check in. It was 20 diraham per person per day. Our stay cost for 2 people 400 diraham.  Our rooms where not ready untill mid afternoon and we had to wait round with no offer to change clothes since it was 46 degrees.  The rooms are basic and need a update but ok for for a couple but not a family as far too small. Air con was not the best in the room and none throughout the rest of the hotel.  Rooms was not cleaned daily and we left our sign out to request it be done daily.  Limited on toilet paper where we had to take napkins from the bar and call reception several times.  Meal times was extremely busy and very unorganised. Not a great choice for children. The have a pizza bar outside the food court that is only open when restaurant is however 2 hour wait for a 6 inch pizza as children was sick of eating pasta.  No where to get snacks from when the main food court wasn't open as the snack bar didn't actually provide food and if they did it was a piece of cheese and a bread roll.  The was one bar of a evening with one beer pump that kept needing changing so they would provide small cans of luke warm beer. The was limited staff serving at the bar.  The paid cocktails was exactly the same as the all inclusive ones but just served in a nicer glass and with ice.  All the staff work extremely long hours and seem to be there every day. The was very friendly.  We was there for 9 nights and are bed had not been changed until night 6 after complaining to reception again.  One bath towel and two head towels provided however if u hand them in to be washed you struggle to get them back until 6pm ish.  The second pool area is called the trinity pool. It has a bar and a restaurant however you have to book to use the restaurant and you have to pay for the same food as the main hall. Only difference was that it was more of a private meal. The bar itself only provides soft drinks and charges for tea and coffee.  WiFi is poor through the complex  TV signal poor.  Excursions to Atlas mountains on 4x4 was absolutely a big rip off. Spent all day in a 4x4 with several stops to places that only forced us to buy things. I was personally told I must buy some morrocon oil. I said no and the lady continued to tell me I had to buy and followed my around the hut that ended up costing us 80 pounds for a small 30ml bottle We had lunch included in the excursion however my partner was told off for drinking his own bottled water. He was told must purchase from them. He bought two cans of sprite at just under 10 pounds english money.    You are given a nationality wristband. English was light orange French dark orange green Spanish etc. Personally I found this to cause a little diversity. Especially at the bar and a meal times as dark orange wrist bands seem to have had more of and advantage of being served and as a petty ad it may sound drinks measures
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sunshine293059 wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Arrived at this hotel to be told it was overbooked despite booking in advance and receiving confirmation. I can understand this mistake but what I can't understand is why this hotel denied us access to reception so we could connect to the WiFi to try and get in touch with our travel agent and use the facilities. Instead we were left with security at the side of the road in rhe middle of the day in 46 degree heat without access to food water or a toilet.    Disgusting way to be treated. If I could give a 0 rating I would.

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: kelly i wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: This was the first time my friends and I visit Marrakech the hotel was amazing plenty of green space to go around the rooms were simple and clean in addition to the bar which was top quality a very special and big thank you to the waiters for their kindness and big smiles and especially their chef Youssef. When it comes to the restaurant breakfast i would honestly say is fine but lunch and dinner are pretty repetitive because the choices are a bit lacking and there isn‚Äôt enough of them however there is 3 swimming pools : a pool with animations and activities another one for zen and the last one with the slides in which we had a lot of fun. The animation team was doing a great job the spectacles the activities and the night parties everything was mesmerizing and fun but there was one major incident which ruined everybody‚Äôs fun and it involves the leader or supervisor of the animation team he has to stop hitting on and harassing customers my friends and i were in the club having fun and he started harassing one of my friends touching her and trying to force her to his room and this without me trying to go to too many details because it was honestly disturbing and scary but luckily we were there to fend him off of her we came to the hotel to have fun and feel safe not to be harassed and especially not by personnel however i wouldn‚Äôt change anybody else because everyone was very professional and welcoming. Sadly we will not return.

Review_Date: K-L-C87 wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: We arrived at this hotel which we had booked and paid for 6 months in advance only to be told at the security gate that they didn't have our booking and we would have to phone our travel agent to sort it out.    It was 1am 40¬∞ heat and we had very poor phone signal and no Internet. The hotel would not even allow us in to use the foyer and WiFi to call home to sort it out. We had to wait by the side of the dusty road with only our (non-english speaking) taxi drivers and an aggressive wild dog for company. Scrambling around in the dark to find our documents and emergency numbers to call home with poor connection.    Whether it was the hotel's fault for overbooking or our agents fault for not organising it properly we don't know. However to not even offer assistance or a telephone to use was very heartless and made us all feel vulnerable at the start of our holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Aleksandra L wrote a review Aug 2022

Activities for the kids are always exciting. There‚Äôs always something for everyone from Aqua Zumba to Karaoke and Casino night. Review_Date: Charlotte M wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: We just came back from our 10 day holiday staying at this hotel and although we enjoyed our stay there were some negatives to our stay    The rooms were very basic not like in the photos they were very clean but the air con was not great at all most nights we slept with our duvets off.    We didn‚Äôt go to the main pool as it was loud and busy which some people may like however we stayed at the zen pool which was lovely and quiet only fault was that there are not a lot of umbrellas for shade so you have to get there early to get a bed.    The food was okay very repetitive lunch was the same food every day and dinner changed but not very often sometime the meat was very dry and there are lots of little bones so keep an eye out for your little ones.    The entertainment was incredible they make the hotel what it is they have something happening most of the time and there is something fun planned every evening.    The excursion team were very helpful we recommend going on the trip to the waterfalls in ouzoud. Was beautiful and a lovely day!    The hotel is very out of the way from everything which stopped us from doing a lot so please note that it is not that close to the city centre
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
