Review_Date: Cally wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Title: A fantastic first "all inclusive" experience for our family.
Review_Text: We've just returned from a magnificent family holiday spending a week at Valeria Dar Atlas all inclusive. The weather hit 46 degrees and was a little tooooo much but we did pick to visit Morocco in late July!  Let‚Äôs start with the best bit ‚Äì the staff. The staff make this hotel they made us feel truly welcome and took note of what made us unique as a family. Our thanks have to go to Ahmed (bartender and our v shy daughter‚Äôs new friend) Soulamain (bartender taught us some Arabic and showed us how to write ‚Äúthank you‚Äù) Sofyan (liaison agent and metal music fan like us ü§ò) Idriss (young bartender and the most polite person ever) Azzedine (bartender) Hamza (photographer) Rico and Thomas (both entertainment team). We hope this review reaches their boss!  The hotel - classically designed for a modern hotel in Morocco it's set out in Riads of maybe 8-16 apartments/rooms round each courtyard. Our family apartment had a very large double bed and TV in a large main room with a mirror and bedside tables. Kids had a twin (note no doors between them and us!) there was a combined bathroom and shower (shower tucked around a wall so quite private) and a separate toilet room. No photos/artwork just plain walls so it did feel a little basic but it was spotless - the cleaning ladies are amazing. The air con (2 units 1 in each bedroom) don't really work to the point of making it cold so i can see why some people have complained about them but they do bring it down to bearable-in-almost-no-clothes and stop the otherwise continuous perspiration!    Theres a shallow baby pool and main pool at the main complex hub the main pool is shallow one end (great for games and aquazumba) with a shelf to a 1.6m deep end. Plenty of space for everyone while we were there. The separate adult only pool (away from earshot of kids and music) isn't deep but it is quiet and very pleasant. The aquapark ‚ÄúPalmeria‚Äù is based in the sister Hotel next door about 8 mins walk from Dar Atlas. Its free for anyone staying here and was worth a trip the main pool is big and cooler in temperature and the slides were good fun!    Entertainment is varied different each night of the week with live music singers games discos. Kids mini disco every night 830-9pm. The entertainment team do try to get everyone involved. The pool party was our favourite üòç    The main bar is air conditioned but I have to say it waa still very hot in the afternoon! The staff in here were our favourites they work constantly serving the many clients and always have a smile. Drinks that are included are various sodas tonic water and fruit juices whiskey vodka gin and mahia. Red rose and white wine as well as hot drinks and Moroccan mint tea. There's a cocktail list of included drinks (about 8 alcoholic ones and 8 non alcoholic) as well as a "premium" list which costs 70dirham each about ¬£5.80. If you buy a premium drink from time to time and tip the staff go the extra mile helping to find you a table or popping over with your "usual" included drinks which adds a lovely touch.    Finally the food - I've never been all inclusive before but we considered it to be a large selection at each mealtime we didn't have to eat the same meal twice. Lots of vegetables stews and tagine roasted meats and couscous and always plain pasta with a simple sauce if desired. A large salad selection breads cheeses at every meal. Dessert perhaps wasn't to our taste - it's little bite sized layered sponges and the Moroccan pastries were v heavy with orange flower oil (think about eating grannie's perfume and you're spot on) but theres always fruit available at mealtimes. We didn't feel the need to snack!    We had some professional photos taken by Hamza on two occasions and are really pleased with them. He even rushed our last set through to get us printed copies of our last night at the hotel before our 0645 taxi and was just a genuinely nice guy. The photos have turned out so nice we‚Äôre busy planning where to display them now we have come home.  It really was a fantastic holiday and while we probably can‚Äôt afford to come back next year we will try to come back in 2024 ‚Äì for our first all inclusive experience it exceeded expectations and we‚Äôve all fallen in love with Marrakech. Thank you all team Valeria Dar Atlas xxx

Review_Date: G C wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: We've had a lovely time the hotel team were amazing and were the best part of the holiday. They're always having fun and can't do enough for you. The food was ok and unfortunately the lack of shade around the pool was uncomfortable at times esp for lil ones but we had a great time.  Greg

Review_Date: Georgia wrote a review Aug 2022

Review_Date: nemo wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Honest Review.    Marrakesh in general was lovely but this hotel was very out the way about a 25 minute drive to the centre which also meant you had to pay for the hotel shuttle each time you use it or pay for taxi which is almost equivalent to ¬£15 one way. There was a lack of air conditioning around the whole hotel which was quite frustrating as it was hitting 45+ degrees. Entertainment staff was 10/10 along with the housekeepers excursions guide security guards and restaurant staff but receptionists came across very rude.  Food was very repetitive and basic. Same stuff ALL the time. Rooms were very outdated and nothing like what it looked like on the pictures. No ice ever lol. As a British person it was extremely difficult to communicate and understand anything as they seem to only want to cater for French people.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Helen wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Had the best week. Cannot say one negative about the holiday. Travelled with a friend. Was welcomed from the minute we got to the hotel. Rooms were clean food was great but must say the Moroccan night cuisine is out of this world (honey chicken is the future). Staff and entertainment couldn‚Äôt do enough especially customer liaison manager sofyan who made our stay comfortable and helped with any query. nothing was too much trouble. Lots of choices on what to do whether it be join in aqua Zumba or relax in quiet pool or slides on the aqua park. Shows on every night with disco Disco til 1am. Musicians Marwen and Jad are fantastic with good range of songs. Overall a fantastic holiday which caters for families or friends. Will definitely be going back. Thank you to all the staff for making our holiday so amazing!!

Review_Date: Grace B wrote a review Jul 2022

Review_Date: sigge29 wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: We stayed for 5 nights in July after 10 days travelling and this was perfect üòä  The staff is very nice and helpful (we all loved mr. Happy guy - entertainer and Hamza the photographer) the pools are great (a big pool with music and entertainment a smaller one next to it and the zen pool).  We had a apartment/chamber build like a riad our only complain is two chairs for 4 pers but everything was clean and lovely.  The buffet was plentiful good food something for everyone. If anything it lacked a kids buffet. Soda water and wine was available for all meals.  We really like the small detail of white tablecloth for dinner and the guests dressed up for dinner.  Entertainment was good mr happy guy was brilliant at getting the guests to participate üòä  Shuttle bus was available to the centre (20 dirham pr pers) and it stop 10 min from the square however you are met by 5-10 guides trying to convince you to buy a guided tour the only time we felt really pressure to buy something on our entire trip was here.    We loved it and hope to return soon.

Review_Date: Amie M wrote a review Jul 2022

Review_Date: Sana S wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: The entertainment staff was beyond brilliant as they packed a lot of entertainment throughout the day such as pool activities my favourite part of the entertainment was the evening part as they had karioke  80s night show and much more to offer! I will definitely return back as the entertainment team made my holiday ! Shoutout to amine and the rest of the valeria atlas team. The shisha here is affordable and good aswell overall best experience here thank you a lot valeria atlas team !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Yazmin wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Amazing hotel great staff! So friendly and helpful! The activities are great and kept you busy however the choice is there to relax by the pool. So many facilities to use including a spa a choice of a pool with water slides food available 24/7 and good cocktails! Evening entertainment is great including live music a show and a nightclub to dance the night away the staff are partying the night away with you!

Review_Date: Bruce Wayne wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: On a 10 day holiday with my girlfriend we arrived at 11am and met with cold drinks with extremely friendly staff. We were told our room was ready for us early so we was very pleased. The room was also clean and tidy. Couple days in you find the food is very basic and it‚Äôs basically chicken or beef in the evening. Lunch was always better. Breakfast was ok but it‚Äôs mostly sweet treats. Pools are always clean and entertainment team are amazing big shout out to Rico Mouse Zak‚Äôs and Mido who made our holiday so fun. We enjoyed playing cards darts volleyball and water polo.    The pool bar is run by a guy called Salah and he was amazing and was always so happy. He always joked with me and was helpful with bringing drinks over made the days by the pool so much better. However the drinks are in very small cups. Some reviews say all inclusive drinks aren‚Äôt great but tbh we were more than happy. They have the usual with some alcoholic cocktails. Some weren‚Äôt great but we enjoyed the ‚Äòatlas sunrise.‚Äô Also you do have to pay for drinks after 11pm. But we always took a bottle or 2 of wine from lunch or dinner and brought that with us.    Had a few issues with evening bar staff we met other groups of couples and friends and they got funny with ordering more than 4 drinks even though it was clear there were 7 of us. Most of the time the girls came back with drinks which were clearly stronger. Also there was a member of staff from the bar seen asking a 15 year old for their number.    We had a few incidents here. My girlfriend choked on some food but the team are not allowed to touch anyone. Luckily the photographer came to help and he was amazing. There was also another incident which did result in an ambulance coming due to severe injuries. My girlfriends a nurse and we‚Äôre glad we were there at the time however some staff were caught videoing the incident and sending the video to all staff. She then asked reception whether they could wash her dress but they said she would have to pay which I find outrageous considering no staff knew how to help the guy after the incident. It seemed like no one was first aid trained at all.    Yes we had a few incidents however the hotel is average. They had a few good evenings where they had singers perform which were great. Some evenings were repetitive and often staff did nag you to dance. Which is hard when it‚Äôs still 40 degrees in the evening. One thing I will say is that the zen pool and water slides in the sister hotel is defiantly worth a visit. I hope this review doesn‚Äôt put anyone off as like I said the hotel is average and worth the money you‚Äôre paying.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Claire H wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Have just returned from this hotel a four night break for rest and relaxation with my husband. Firstly we have travelled extensively on the med and north Africa and were pleasantly surprised we found this hotel to be a good value choice for what we paid. The few negatives.... Not enough sun umbrealls/shades around the pools in the 40C+ heat this was sometimes an issue and hotel was only 60-70% occupied do it voukf get worse. Not enough hand sanitiser around (saw just 1 bottle at reception!) with covid on the rise and sharing of serving spons for food we thought his was an issue (we took our own small bottle everywhere) the zen pool does not serve booze?... Why? rooms are a little dated the main pool is bonkers loud busy chaos but if you want a bit more peace a 5-10 mins walk away is the zen pool utter bliss highly recommended. Now all the positives... Hotel has friendly staff spotlessly clean rooms well appointed rooms excellent air con any 'issues' (we had a broken safe) were dealt with really fast food was exceptionally good varied tasty and well presented the hotel caters for a French and Arabic customer think amazing pastries crepes at breakfast and amazing tagines at dinner this is not somewhere for an English brekkie chips or junk food you need a cultured palette and try the food out! drinks offering was fair to good branded non alcoholic and local alcoholic all tasty bar staff were patient and polite despite the lack of tips the staff especially animation team work soooo hard they deserve a medal entertainment was good especially for kids. This is a 4 star hotel officially and they'd get that for value and effort but technically I'd say it's more of a good 3 star if you want to dip into Marrakech it's close by (about 15 mins in a taxi) cost 150dh about ¬£12 there is a shuttle but we didn't use it it's much cheaper but at set times. This is overall a good hotel if value is key freindly people and tasty food is your thing you're onto a winner here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Esn141 wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: I have just returned back today from 10 days with my family. I have to say that the enthusiasm of all the staff was fantastic. From the manageresshousekeeping front office activities team all were so polite. I would like to say a big thank you to Mustafa who looked after us in the restaurant every night and Khalid on reception. The staff in the excursion office went above and beyond to help us. The entertainment team worked day and night and always with a smile. A great hotel for a stay in Marrakech in a resort but within easy reach of the city via the shuttle or a taxi. A big thankyou to you all for making our family holiday so good. Thanks again. Do not hesitate to book this hotel it's extremely clean with fantastic food and a great pool. There is entertainment every night an adults only pool if you want some peace there are kids clubs pool side bars and even access to a Aqua Park for free a few minutes across the road in their sister hotel.

Review_Date: gillycan wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: The staff in this hotel are absolutely fabulous. They look after your every need. The entertainment team are the best we have experienced and we have travelled all over the world. It was such an amazing holiday and was our first time in Morocco . The VALERIA DAR ATLASS hotel was incredible high standard. From the wonderful world buffet drinks selection of meal in the restaurant. The pools are is fabulous and you have a choice to take part in the many fun water games or dancing or chill by your lounger. We experienced an incredible fire show which every guest in the hotel probably came to see. Spectacular event! A massive Thankyou to all the staff- lifeguard who is super efficient DJ bar staff gardeners and cleaners who ensure the standards are very high. The Moroccan people are super kind respectful helpful and we never at any time felt unsafe even in the souks in Marrakesh. Massive Thankyou to the entertainment team who really made our holiday- (MAMADOSAMSOUFYANERICCOMIDOULILIFAYROUZADWA).and the lovely üíÉSANYAüíÉ the choreographer. Amine is just brilliant. He is incredible at motivating everyone and makes every activity super fun. Where does he get his energy!! Midou was such a lovely guy to chat to and we have lots lovely chats about both our countries.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Thomas M wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Spent 6 days here and loved every moment of it reps are all really friendly Rico the best break dancer üï∫ and al the team of Valeria dar atlass. The shows in the evening are very entertaining really good atmosphere all round definitely recommend thanks again for (SANYASAMAMINSOUFYANMIDOUFAYROUZFADWA). big mention for DJ ABDEL in night club and the bg boss MAMADO .  LOVLEY HOLIDAY üí™

Review_Date: Taryn K wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Arriving at the Valeria Dar Atlas resort we were met by friendly reception staff the room wasn't ready for us to check in but we were given our bands to access the all inclusive. The surprise at the reception was the city tax we had to pay this hadn't been mentioned on any previous reviews or had come up on the gov website when researching Morocco. The rooms were basic and clean however the maid helped herself to my friends money when she reported the incident the process was unclear as to how this would be resolved no compensation offered or follow up was made by they hotel. The member of staff had informed us similar complaints had been registered from other staying without our block of rooms. Moving on to the entertainment team. They do work hard and put a lot of effort in however they are relentless and do not accept no for an answer which I personally find frustrating especially when you are then told "you're lazy" "you're boring" not what I expect when I politely decline to join in. I found them to be very intrusive of my personal space constantly touching you grabbing your hands some would put their face very close to your own which is difficult to move when you are seated. One evening the entertainment team tried to force us to write a review he offered to write it himself this could possibly to flood down the serious incident review from the previous day. We used the spa which was a great experience the hotel has a shop with some basic snack bits no lays :( I would recommend researching any excursions you would like to do as the "hotel rep" didn't provide accurate information for a trip we booked. The food was alright nothing exceptional room for improvement. Previous reviews mentioned a Moroccan evening however when we arrived there was no mention of this by staff or on the activity schedule board. Despite previous reviews stating there was no food labels this seems to have been taken on board as the majority of food did have a label if not staff would advise you what the dish was. There was a lot of flies on/around the food which I know can't be overly controlled but just something to mindful of. The snack bar would serve drinks in small paper coffee cups no more than a couple of gulps per cup. Plenty of bottles of water they are colder from the snack bar opposed to the restaurant. Overall generally happy with the time spent in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Bek wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: I recently returned from a weeks stay at this hotel with two friends. Positives the hotel was basic but clean the pool area was lovely. The spa was wonderful! Entertainment staff were freindly and regularly tried to get us involved however im more of a spectator rather than a participator. All bar staff were friendly and really lovely!    Negatives food was below average for a 4* hotel. Limited choice and felt repetitive. Food was occasionally cold.    We did have an incident within the first few days where money was missing from my purse this was reported. This was missing as me and another person in my party withdrew the exact same amount in the UK before travelling and I only went into my purse the first time we left the hotel to realise I was missing money. I reported this as soon as I was back at the hotel the security man came to the room to view where the money was and take some details positovr start... please note I take responsibility for leaving my purse in my bag and chosing not to pay for the safe but i didnt expect someone to help themselves to it. I was told to either file a report at reception or go to the police station i went back to the reception after dinner to file this report to be told the security man will do this and to come back a few days later. A few days later arrived so I went back and the reception had no report and seemed unaware of this. So I cut my losses checked out and it was never mentioned again.    I have given 3 stars as I enjoyed the holiday things could be improved but I don't want 1 individual to ruin my experience or anyone else's. My recommendations provide safes for free if there is an issue in the hotel and improve customer service when issues are reported. And mix up the food choices.

Review_Date: Michelle B wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: On arrival we were met with cold refreshments but to be told our room wouldn‚Äôt be ready till 3pm even though we arrived at the hotel at 11am. Eventually got our room 902 not a lot of space to put clothes away especially if your there for 2 weeks and travelling as a family rooms are very basic and definitely need upgrading. Air conditioning wasn‚Äôt working properly so we asked to move rooms hotel did accommodate us straight away. Moved to room 1007 air conditioning was working great. Food is very basic and very repetitive after the 1st week we were dreading getting up to go food wasn‚Äôt cooked properly and we did complain to the head chef who corrected the problem straight away. Never seen any chips for a whole 2 weeks until it was EID then chips appeared. The drinks are not the best glasses are not washed properly leaving residue from the previous drink in it. This hotel is advertised as a 4‚≠êÔ∏è Premium it‚Äôs no we‚Äôre near that it‚Äôs not an all inclusive holiday you have to pay for the Al Alarcte restaurants if you visit the quiet pool or ZEN POOL you have to pay for alcoholic drinks and food. The water park and infinity pool as advertised is NOT at this hotel it‚Äôs in the sister hotel called Mango with which you can use but drinks and food you have to pay for. The only thing that this hotel has going for it is the entertainment team the go out of there way to entertain you work really hard and very long hours there a credit to this hotel 100%. I‚Äôm rating this as a 2‚≠êÔ∏è And will not be returning üëé

Review_Date: TravelNotComplete wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: This is my second time visiting this time with my husband it didn't disappoint (to much)    Let's get the negative or disappointment out the way first the food let it down a little bit this time breakfast it all seemed to be the same options I'm sure last time we got more options including sausages etc (not cooked in sauces) and 2 days the evening meals seemed very limited but the soup was nice everytime I had it and the desserts were always great.    Now onto the staff I didn't encounter anyone who appeared unhappy in their job the Animation team were amazing as ever Soufiane Sam and everyone else ensured everyone had fun and nothing was to much bother for them.    I also have to mention the spa....you have to visit and get a hammam at the very least I ended up going back for a second hammam royal and my husband joined me for the second one definitely worth every penny.    We will be returning again thanks for another great holiday guys x    p.s take a trip to the atlas mountains it was an amazing day and if you go take some sweets for the kids x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ellie-Sue wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: Amazing holiday at dar atlas valeria
Review_Text: We had the most amazing stay here at Dar Atlas. When we first arrived we had arrived late after our flight and the food service had stopped. However the man at the desk sorted us some food special from the kitchen himself. The room was lovely they are located in little blocks with amazing open courtyards in the middle of them. The air con was great and made the room a nice space away from the 45 degree heat when needed.  They mix the food up every day and at every meal which is great as you never get bored of the food. Some days there was burgers and and bbq for lunch and then a nice leg of lamb for dinner. There‚Äôs a salad bar as well if you fancy something lighter. All of the food is really nice whatever you fancy.  The pools are great and the entertainment that they put on throughout the day is great. They do water aerobics water Zumba and games of water polo. There is always something happening and to get involved in if you would like. Or if you would rather relax then there is a quiet adult only pool. Everywhere you go though there is always someone there get you anything you need and help in any way.  In the evenings as well there is lots of live music and other activities for people to get involved in. We got to dress in traditional Moroccan dress and take part in a fashion show which was a lot of fun. The entertainment team are always brining the fun so there is never a dull moment whilst staying here. Big up to Sofyan and sam sania mamado dj abdel rico mido mouss fayroz and fadwa Taha‚Ä¶ thank you so much for making our holiday amazing .  10/10 definitely would recommend wether you‚Äôre in a couple or with family or even solo!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: r1tracey wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: Beautiful trip with my kids xx
Review_Text: We are currently on holiday at the Dar Atlas Resort. Such an amazing place. I would definitely say that this hotel is more a 3 star hotel but 95% of the staff make it a 5 star without a doubt.The entertainment team are so friendly. You are asked to join in activities but not harassed and all. Every single one of them are making our holiday memorable with daily and evening activities and entertainment . Soufiane Samsania mamado rico mouss fayroz mido fadwadj abdel‚Ä¶  Sala at the out door bar is brilliant and always remembers our drinks with a smile on his face. Food is ok a bit repetitive but ok and the chef and restaurant staff work so hard. Room is ok a bit basic but ok no iron in the room worth knowing. On the whole I would definitely recommend this hotel and the management should be so proud of all their staff.

Review_Date: chanellecrosby wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: Valeria Dar Atlas family holiday review
Review_Text: We‚Äôre having a lovely time in the Valeria Dar Atlas. The bar staff for both the indoor bar and the outdoor bar by the pool have been amazing especially Salah his very attentive.  The entertainment staff by the pool have been lovely always coming over to have a chat. The aqua Zumba was the best entertainment by the pool. all the staff get involved and make everyone feel included even if they don‚Äôt participate in the activities. I would like to thank you all for your hard job Soufiane Samsania mamadodj abdel Rico moussmido fayroz and fadwa. And FAHD the friendly pool man.  The food has been ok not too much variety day to day but the head chef makes sure everyone is ok and is very pleasant to speak to. There is meant to be snacks as part of the all inclusive but it‚Äôs very hit and miss with what comes out. The best day for food was Sunday for Eid there was a bbq and the entertainment during breakfast was nice to experience the culture.  We had a power cut whilst we was here one evening and the reception staff handled it very well.  The room does slightly let down the hotel it‚Äôs very basic and although there is air con it doesn‚Äôt feel as cold as it should.  I would say the hotel is a 3 star but is made a 4 star by the bar staff and entertainment team.

Review_Date: Lauren G wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Just returned home from holiday with my mum and sisters after staying at the Dar Atlas. The weather has been amazing - although almost too hot at times! The facilities at the hotel are amazing with enough space in the pools and outside areas for everyone and there needs.  All the staff at the hotel are more than helpful and everyone from the front desk to chefs and lifeguards are more than happy to help with whatever you need - often without you needing to ask them. The animation team here are amazing - we felt at home and welcomed the moment we stepped foot through the door. They work tirelessly and are so much fun - Soufiane Amine and Sam to name a few! Dancing and getting involved is very big here and there‚Äôs always something for you to do with them! The only thing letting the hotel down slightly is the food - but not everything can be perfect! If your looking for an amazing place in Morocco to stay then I would 100% recommend the Dar Atlas!

Review_Date: Nahsfa1 wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Had a fantastic time in a very hot climate - next time will come in colder months :) all the entertainment staff are very friendly at the hotel and full of energy despite the hot weather! Special shout out to Moussa Sam and Rico who were very friendly and encouraged everyone to take part in activities. Also the female serving staff at meal times were very helpful especially Amina. Only two points which are disappointing is the food (quite dry and bland meat and deserts taste essentially of just cream). I had expected more traditional tagines and deserts! Also the hotel is on the outskirts of Marrakesh and you do have to pay for the shuttle bus all of which can add up. We did do a day trip to Casablanca too which was arranged through the hotel and which we enjoyed especially due to the cooler climate! The female member of staff who organises day trips is lovely and very helpful. Lastly the massages at the hotel are amazing!

Review_Date: Leonardo Alves wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Right so where do I even start  from the beginning the staff have been exceptional. The rooms are clean and are always left clean after your day in the pool with fresh towels and the bed beautifully made.    The food in all inclusive is always amazing and up to the standard I‚Äôve been extremely impressed.    Let me not even get started with the entertainment and the staff here I couldn‚Äôt of asked to feel more part of a family and welcomed. There‚Äôs always activity‚Äôs to take part in during the day and night and the staff are always trying to get you involved never ever make you feel left out  good mornings good afternoons asking how your day has been etc never ever ever fail making you feel like your part of a family from the day I got here.    The night entertainments are something to die for I couldn‚Äôt of asked for anything better the effort the team here at this hotel go through to make sure people here are entertained is outstanding honestly I‚Äôm lost for words with the people here it‚Äôs deffo the best hotel I‚Äôve ever been to in my life.    The experience and the team that work here have made this holiday very special for me and I couldn‚Äôt ask for anything better I very big thank you to soufiane sam Sania the choreographer mamado dj abdel rico mouss amine and mido fadwa and fayroz. For making this holiday something really special i highly Recommend it for anyone wanting to take a trip down to Marakesh although there‚Äôs no beach nearby everyone here deffo makes up for it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Carly B wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: We stayed here as a group of friends. Staff are all fantastic very friendly and helpful. Lots of choice for food all fresh. Lots of activists all day including aqua aerobics Zumba salsa dancing water polo darts the list goes on. evening entertainment equally as good with things going on all night. The entertainment staff really go above and beyond to ensure your stay is enjoyable as possible. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Huge thank you to soufiane who is a real asset to the place he has been so helpful with everything we have needed. Would definitely return üòÉ won‚Äôt forget about Sam sania the choregrapher mamado dj abdel rico amine mouss mido fadwa and fayroz for looking after our kids.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alice wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: Hot holiday and full of entertainment
Review_Text: Came here and was hesitant due to the mixed reviews. However since coming here we were welcomed by the reception staff with a cold drink. We were then told our room was ready even though we were 3 hours early which was just what we wanted to hear after a long journey.  Animation team make this holiday- if you don‚Äôt wanna join in with anything then they‚Äôll say ok and walk away however most of the tom they get you up and moving- won‚Äôt lie I‚Äôve never played water polo but I had an amazing time. Big thanks to soufiane and Sam Sania the chirrgrapher mamado abdel the Dj. Fayroz fadwa rico amine mouss mido.  Food is ok- had a choking situation with the fish which resulted in the nurse coming but my fault really as I forget to chew when I‚Äôm hungryüòÇ but the nurse management and photographer came to help and they haven‚Äôt stopped apologising and asking if I‚Äôm ok!  Ignore the bad reviews-it‚Äôs hot but it‚Äôs a good hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Adrian C wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Even it was very hot but the entertainment team encouraged us to have fun Mouss made us smile even he was better than me in Tennis  The food was amazing if you have any doubt about coming don‚Äôt hesitate this is a wonderful place to relax and have fun

Review_Date: Alfie A wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: The entertainers are the stars of the hotel
Review_Text: First time coming to Morocco and I can say I was greeted by the lovely team. Friendly and helpful team who are always down for a laugh and joke. The activities during the day are also brilliant ranging from aqua aerobics darts yoga. The rooms could be a bit better the beds are a bit hard and only get one pillow. One entertainer named Mouss was so friendly and made my days better.

Review_Date: 248dee wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Had an amazing week at an amazing hotel!    The food and drinks were great and there was such a variety even my fussy friend had plenty to eat.    The rooms were clean and tidy and the staff were always so helpful.    The entertainment team were fantastic and there was a variety of games activities and shows throughout our trip that were incredible! Nothing was ever to much trouble and we were well looked after. Shout out to Sam and Mousss for being the best :)

Review_Date: Lydia K wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Had the best week at the Valeria Atlas was a perfect chilled getaway with a group of friends. Lots of time to chill but also plenty of activities throughout the day - the entertainment team in particular have been fab.  especially Mamado  Mouss  Sam Dj Abdul  Amin Mido and th good breakdancer Rico  Fanroz and Fadwa Would definitely come back!! üëçüèΩüòò

Review_Date: Heather wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: First experience of Valeria Dar Atlas
Review_Text: We had a great first visit to Valeria Dar Atlas for our girls holiday. All the staff are really friendly and helpful. The waiting staff were very accommodating with dietary needs and the event team were fabulous at getting us to enjoy our holiday. Mousse especially was very helpful and friendly! Will definitely be returning.

Review_Date: upg_uk wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Located 25Mins drive from the airport just on the outskirts. Arrived but rooms very not ready at 2pm and were asked to left luggage in untidy undone room.  Rooms were clean otherwise good size for a quad family with balconies no toiletries provided apart from shower gel and always had to ask for towels on numerous occasions even though it was a family quad room. The arc was a bit noise need a bit of maintenance.  The hotel grounds are kept clean and well looked after with lots of green and trees.  We enjoyed the spa facilities at a charge and found it to be very good value to money and enjoyed relaxing massage with hammams.  The property has 2 swimming pools including one for adults only and we enjoyed the both.  The food spread was good and offered a variety every day something for everyone. The AI  Local drinks were not upto scratch but enjoyed the beer and mint tea and coffee.  The hotel provides entertainment everyday and night to keep everyone busy with lots to do like Table tennis darts yoga classes aqua games cards etc.  Evening entertainment was set at different theme and enjoyed the atmosphere.  The entertainment staff were very friendly and attentive and look after their guest well with good laughs.    We had access to Aqua park located next door in sister hotel as part of the AI deal and thoroughly enjoyed it.    Staff at restaurant work hard but leave all the crumbs on the mats and chairs set for next diners need to be a looked at  and even saw a couple of times staff helping themselves to salad whilst clearing plates it was shocking when it comes to hygiene cleaning tables and putting same hands in the salad.    Overall a good experience with the family and will visit again.

Review_Date: IrinA wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Title: My teenage daughter and her friend were sexually assaulted by a hotel worker
Review_Text: As I write this I am on the verge of tears and I hope this serves as a cautionary tale for others. My daughter is currently at this hotel with her friend. the girls are 19 and 20 years old. On the 2nd day of their holidays both were sexually assaulted by a worker. Listening to them describing what happened tells me the individual is a sexual predator and is used to doing this with tourists. I encouraged my daughter to report this but she felt vulnerable. I contacted Love Holidays who they booked with sending an email to an email address that no longer works. finally today my daughter having found alternative accommodation for the remainder of her holiday reported the incident to the hotel. initially the hotel seemed supportive but as my daughter waited for them to take action the hotel became more hostile and are now saying because she didnt report it at 12 o'clock today its got nothing to do with them and that my daughter needs to go to another hotel and get a taxi to the police station. earlier the hotel told my daughter that there have been other similar complaints made against the same worker yet despite this she just saw him working in the kids club with children sometime after she raised the complaint. I tried to speak to the hotel as a concerned parent but they didnt care - I asked to speak with a manager and was told the only way I could would be to send a message on tripadvisor.

Review_Date: Asif_Nazeer wrote a review Jun 2022

Review_Date: Abbie C wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Title: Valeria dar atlas is the best
Review_Text: The hotel rooms are lovely and clean - air conditioning is a god send! Review_Date: M S wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: The resort offers many tours and experiences with the advantage of pickup being from the hotel. In addition the reosrt has its own bus which travel to Marrackesh centre (Medina) every hour and costs 2 Euros. the quad biking was excellent and makes good use of the terain. Moreover it is only a few minutes walk from the resort.  Bear in mind the resort is in the middle of nowhere and you will need transport to venture into Marrakesh centre.  The waterfall tour was really great and is not too demanding on the legs. The food at lunch was also nice.  During our stay we opted for the all inclusive. The food was well presented and offered different varieties of meat dishes etc.  The bar at night was limited to just one barwhich meant the services for drinks was slow and often had to queu up for drinks. The entertainment was on everynight and is great if you have kids. The pool was adequate for the volume of people on the complex.  The staff were really friendly and helpful.  The rooms were ok. I was transferred twice from my original room because the AC did not work. Eventually I was given a room which was nice and cool. However many people complained that the AC was not cool enough in their room.  Overalla decent resort good food offering many tours from the resort. The rooms were average. 7 out od 10.

Review_Date: Ivan B wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: From the monement of arrival the experience was made a good one. check in was easy and speedy and our bags carried to our room. Reception staff are so helpful and friendly as are tour office staff.  Rooms were very clean and the pools well looked after. Our room was cleaned everyday and clean bedding and towels were always there.  we used the pool bar during the day and Salah and Yassaine were brilliant as were all the staff but they stood out to us they were always happy and smiling and nothing was too much trouble.  Meal times were pleasant with a great variety on offer and no lengthly queing. we are in the mango restaurant which was an additional cost but so worth it.  The animation staff are absolutely fantastic in particular Amine Rico Mousse Sam SanyaNinaMamadofayrouzfadwamidou who worked their hardest to make us feel welcome and included. Both during the day and in the evening. theres always something to do if chilling out is boring for you.  would definately recommend this hotel even if based on staff alone. sorry to be leaving but im sure we will be back. We met these people as staff but we are certainly leaving them as friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Elly H wrote a review Jun 2022

The entertainment would be better in English as we are the fun ones ü§£  Honestly I don‚Äôt want to go home tomorrow thankyou to all the staff cleaners to management be proud of yourselfs I will be back x

Review_Date: lsdmg wrote a review May 2022
Review_Title: Very good holiday on a budget
Review_Text: I went on a solo trip for 4 days to this hotel. I was straight away made feel welcome by all of the entertainment staff and the reception staff. In particular Sofyan would always check that I was OK. There is plenty to do. The entertainment schedule had lots on all day every day and a show in the evening. The entertainment staff are mainly there for the French travel company but they do make an effort to include everyone and speak both English and French. They work amazingly hard and a real asset to this hotel. The rooms are clean and spacious. The pool area is fairly small but there are plenty of sunbeds for everyone. I managed to get a sunbed at anytime of the day. The pool bar provides drinks in very small cups but they will give you a large bottle of water if you ask. The all inclusive drinks are OK. I mainly drank rose and the white wine which was decent. The all inclusive buffet food has no labels so you have to guess what it is. Again food is OK nothing amazing but is sufficient. Be aware that some food at breakfast and lunch is outside which can be confusing. The Wifi is hit and miss. Worked perfectly first couple of days including in the room until the 3rd day where it was only available in reception and then at the end of the 3rd day and whole of my final day the wifi was completely unavailable. I booked one trip via the hotel but it is designed for the French so worth looking into an English speaking company. The trip I was on was completely French speaking people no one spoke English apart from the guide who would describe everything to me on my own privately. There is a shuttle to the souks but I wasn't brave enough to go alone but everyone else coming back seemed happy with bags full of stuff. There is a little git shop on site selling souvenirs and basic stuff however I would recommend making sure you have everything you need such as sun cream toiletries etc as there isn't much to buy at the hotel nor is there anything around the hotel to walk to. It was a very good holiday on a budget.

Review_Date: Brunilda wrote a review May 2022

Overall the resort provided us with the best facilities and everyone is super friendly and loves to get to know more about you and your experiences in Morocco.    Would deffo recommed to friendship groups families and couples thinking of a getaway.

The bar staff were very attentive and nothing was too much to ask. Youssef the boss and his assistances samir and sbiti were great!    Our rooms were cleaned to a very high standard on a daily basis with clean towels always at the ready.    The food in the restaurant is more catered towards the French taste buds - so as a Brit I would certainly pack a few tubes of Pringles for times of desperate measure. Again this is more of a personal thing as I did see a lot of people piling their plates up from the array of food which is available.

Music around the main pool is fun but there is the Zen pool if you want a quiet time.  The evening entertainment is also very good well I‚Äôm here alone so after the kids disco! Short show outside and then a choreographed show by Sania is fab if a bit warm in the Theatre. Join in and have a blast it really is a great hotel. The grounds are lovely and the rooms spacious and clean. Bed is very comfy. Drinks especially for an all inclusive are great - even the wine at lunch time!  I will definitely look to come back here but will check when the French holidays are first!  Oh and weather was so so hot the cold pool was a blessing. Thanks all at Atlas.

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: leehaddock wrote a review May 2022
Review_Title: NOT all inclusive - worst holiday I have had in Morocco - Not even a 1 star
Review_Text: 1. This hotel is supposed to be all inclusive we were on a 3 day high end mini break the the bathroom light didn't work we complained 3 times to reception no one came and fixed it we had to use our phones for light they didn't replace the toilet rolls and towels as standard we complained to the reception and nothing happened we ended up having to ask the maid directly we were charged to rent a safe and the beer they gave us as part of the all inclusive package was served in a small coffee cup ( 4 cups made one pint ) All other drinks were charged apart from one disgusting tasting cocktail and flat soft drinks. They charged for pool tables and when I asked for change to use the tables they didn't have any ( tried at reception and at the bar).    2. The sun umbrellas were all broken apart from 5 which people were fighting over people kept steeling ours when we were in the pool made it very uncomfortable.    3. The bar staff were rude the manager in the main bar poured my beer in a small glass and I saw there was a pint glass I asked for a pint glass he said' maybe later' gave me a filthy look handed me the small glass and walked off.    4. None of the food was labelled my wife is allergic to fish and we didn't know what contained fish. The meat was so tough it was inedible. Mass produced slop.    5. We have been to Morocco 5 times and this is the worst trip we had. If you want small cups of watery rank beer and food that tastes like it was frozen before covid then this is the place to come.    6. The pool guys were good though ( sports events thumbs up).    7. Evening entertainment was non existent.    8. Day trips trying to get information on them was like pulling teeth so gave up.    9. In the dining hall high end food items ( freshly cooked stuff) was put on the side of the counter ( such as large pies ) but not cut so you had to wait for a chef to walk over and cut them people came up to the counter for a piece of pie and the chefs looked up saw you and ignored you so people walked off if you stood there for ages eventually they came over and cut a piece (probably another way to cut cost).    10. weather was great.    11. The free bus drops you miles from the main market (souks) centre you get jumped on by so many people waiting for you there ( tour guides etc) after fighting your way through these people you have a long walk in the backing hot sun to the souks. Never had this before all other hotels drop directly at the main souks.

All the staff are courteous and polite eager to please.    Great entertainment by the pool each day Soufiane and the team always have time to chat and encourage us to step up to the aqua aerobics and get our pulses racing. Big thanks to all of you sam mamado sania the choreographer jimmy locos fayroz fadwa and the great DJ abdel .    Can't recommend enough best holiday ever.  Hazel and Paul
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: hannah vale wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: Lovely stay room basic but comfortable. Nice food but not labeled so little tricky knowing what your having witch is hard for allergies. Lovely pool and staff. Soufian and Sam were so friendly and we enjoyed the evening entertainment! All the day activities were super fun. Sanie also did a great belly dance class too. Abdel is a fab DJ and super friendly. Fayrouz was also very nice and great with the kids. Fadwa was also very lovely and kept everyone entertained! Thank you for a lovely stay. Good selection of drinks in the bar and nice cocktail selection.

Review_Date: Andrew D wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Title: A great hotel for couples and families alike
Review_Text: Dar Atlas is a great hotel with a great variety of activities to keep visitors of all ages entertained. I attended with my partner as part of a larger family group. The staff are universally friendly and are always happy to help out.    The animation team are truly the stars of the show. They're hard working and have a seemingly endless amount of energy and always aim to keep the guests happy. In particular Soufianne was very friendly and always made an effort to speak to the family and keep us entertained. Sam also did a great job of involving and encouraging our group to get involved without pushing us too far. Be warned - the animation team will try and get you involved and they can be persistent but if you're willing to go with it you're going to have a great time. If this isn't your thing you can always escape to the relative peace of the serentity pool. We attended as part of a large family group with a range of ages but we we never found ourselves short of activities to suit everyone. Across the course of the week we found ourselves involved in everything from volleyball to darts to the onsite spa.    The hotel is generally well presented. The gardens in particular are beautifully maintained and present many opportunities for holiday photos. The bedrooms are basic but generally clean and fit for purpose.    The hotel's main restaurant provides a good choice of food that will cater to most tastes. The Morrocan themed night went down particularly well with out party with a great choice of tagine dishes on offer. The restaurant would benefit from the use of labels on dishes. Often the soup of the day would be a lucky dip. While there were a good variety of dishes suitable for vegetarians the absence of labels was could be a little concerning.    Evening entertainment was varied and interactive. The animation team put in a lot of effort with kids and adults alike. The bar offers a decent selection of cocktails while the house wines and beer were not bad for an all-inclusive. My only criticism would be that the drinks tend to be served in tiny cups resulting in multiple trips to the bar.    Overall a great hotel that I would recommend to anyone visiting Marrakech.

Review_Date: Clive wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: My partner and I visited Dar Atlas with her family for a week in April.    The hotel is pleasant and the pathway to the rooms (or riads) are particularly beautiful. However it is out of the way which means that you can't go for a quick walk - instead you will need to jump in a taxi or book the hotel shuttle (a day in advance) for transport into Marrakesh.    Rooms are suitable but perhaps in need of some modernisation. The patio and balconies looked out onto wonderfully managed green areas. Air con worked a charm. One room key card stopped working multiple times and probably should've been replaced by reception staff rather than being reloaded.    Breakfast lunch and dinner had plenty of variety although at times food items ran low and wasn't replaced quickly enough (or at all) by service staff. Cutlery also ran out quickly and was often unclean. The Morrocoan night was by far the best for food - with proper tagine rather than food being cooked elsewhere and then put in for effect like it was on other days. Lack of labels and allergy notices for food was disappointing.    Animation are the highlight of the hotel and other staff could learn a thing or two. They were very enthusiastic with their daily activities and events but weren't too pushy if we just wanted to relax by the pool. Particular thanks to Soufianne and Sam! I had a blast with the volleyball! Truly awesome group here.    There is plenty of pool space and sun beds however it was more of a hassle to get pool towels than it should've been!    Bar staff weren't very friendly to myself but seemed much more comfortable with women. Beer was pretty good and cocktails were fun even with vodka at 30%.    Spa was very reasonably priced and I really enjoyed the hamman experience! Worthwhile knowing that you may need to book 24+hrs in advance.    Lastly this is a predominantly French speaking hotel and many staff don't speak English particularly well. This means many activities are held in French and some documents such as pool towel reservation cards are only available in French too. It isn't a problem but just something to be aware of - brush up on some basic Arabic and French to help you along.

Review_Date: Clarissa O wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: My family and I and our partners all came to Club dar Atlas for a week during the Easter Holidays.    The riads and the setting was beautiful although there is not much near the hotel and you will need to taxi or shuttle to get into the city centre which is easy enough with the taxi rank just outside.    There is just enough sun loungers available for the amount of guests although on our first day there were not enough towels.    The food was enjoyable though there are no labels and as a vegetarian it was guesswork to know if there was any meat in what I was eating. The Moroccan night was especially my favourite with the wide variety of beans. Really enjoyed the extensive amount of traditional pastries available for dessert.    There is a wide variety of alcoholic drinks included in the all inclusive so there should be something for everyone.    On our last day we went to the hotel spa that are on the grounds for a traditional Moroccan Hammam which was relaxing however the description should not include the term ‚Äúmassage‚Äù as it was more of a relaxing rub and scrub rather than full on massage but would still recommend.    The animation team are really enthusiastic with different entertainment provided every evening. There are a variety of activities provided throughout the day such as volleyball yoga dance classes darts tournaments as well as specific activities for older kids and although they encourage participation they also respect when you wish to just relax by the pool which is appreciated. Big shout out to Soufianne and Sam who took their time in trying to get to know us all individually as guests to ensure our stay was continually enjoyable.

Review_Date: Courtney K wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: For a first time experience the Valeria Dar Atlas resort is certainly one to remember. A group of 9 ranging in ages each had something to keep them occupied. Many sports competitions dance classes and pool activities as well as the use of the spa and the zen pool. The animation team are friendly and inviting (especially Sam and Soufiane). The music and fun throughout the day was unmissable with Mamado and Abdul. The family friendly evening activities are great fun with Santa which lead to the discotheque into the night. The food varied each night and was enjoyed by all of us. I would definitely recommend this resort for all of your Moroccan needs :)

Review_Date: Precious wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Title: Great resort for a mixed age family group
Review_Text: Great mixed age group family holiday. Multiple activities facilitated by the excellent animation team including family friendly games and sports to less strenuous activities such as funny quizzes. The hammam experience and body scrub was amazing relaxing experiences. There are interactive shows each night my favourite was Moroccan night showcasing traditional Moroccan musicians and dancers including the candle dance and belly dancers. This was also my favourite night for food. With the tasty tagines and spiced lentils beans and chickpeas. We were well looked after from start to finish by the animation team including Soufianne Sam Rico Sonia the choreographer DJ Abdel and Mamadol. Great drinks and service from bar staff Samir Yusuf Momo Mahdi Hisham Suliman.  Would recommend and come again!

Review_Date: Josephine O‚ÄôDriscoll wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: Stayed at this resort with my family (group of 9) and there was something for everyone! Multiple fun activities such as sporting events/competitions and some less strenuous activities for those wanting to relax! There was different food every night with my personal favourite being the Moroccan cuisine night as it was so flavourful. The staff were super friendly and Sam and Soufianne from the Animations team made us feel at home and entertained us.Also Sania who used to shine the dances show and also Mamado and Abdel the dj with his good music daily. I would definitely recommend this resort if you want a fun filled stay with lots of involvement everyday.

Review_Date: donrash wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights over the Easter Holidays.  Rooms are situated in lovely surrounding grounds they are clean & basic.  Food - nothing is labelled it can be a guessing game what you are eating. If you don't get in to the restaurant early it can be difficult to get a clean table or cutlery.  Pool bar - drinks are served in small paper cups there is a snack bar but it only serves pancakes & pastries at 4pm. There is no problem getting a sun bed you don't need to get up at the crack of dawn! Wi-Fi can be a bit hit & miss.    Reception staff - no customer service - they need some training from the Entertainment Team we asked for change for the pool table he just shrugged his shoulders not helpful why have a pool table if you can't provide change for it!    The Entertainment Team - They are a credit to this hotel they work really hard day/night offering a lot of different activities. These guys made our holiday enjoyable a BIG THANK YOU to Soufiane Sam Mamado and the rest of the team.    If you are after a cheap & cheerful sun holiday then I would recommend this hotel.

Review_Date: greenie345 wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: Sorry to say this hotel is no way a 4* the hotel layout is lovely but that is where it stops.  The entertainment team are brilliant and work so hard  The restaurant is not good at all  none of the food has labels so you have no idea what anything is  if you don‚Äôt get in there straight away you spend time looking for clean glasses  clean cutlery and food runs out.  Nothing special in place for kids they must que with parents to get food instead of  Not enough serving spoons so same spoon being used for different dishes.  It is all-inclusive but all drinks given  In small paper or glass cups so you must keep going to bar to refill.  Indoor swimming pool chargeable  nothing outside hotel so you can‚Äôt go for a walk to local shops  pool table in reception has to be paid for but unable to get coins to play.  The rooms get cleaned each day  well the beds are made but never changed in 10 days  towels taken but new ones not always put back so a call to reception!

Review_Date: Lily S wrote a review Apr 2022

Review_Date: Sue Hamilton wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: The hotel is situated in lovely grounds 2 outdoor pools good value for money rooms ok food ok good selection along with the all inclusive drinks  Entertainment was great great shows put on by the animation team & fun daytime activities Soufiane Sam Jimmy Mike Fayroz Sania we‚Äôre fantastic would recommend a stay here to relax & also experience the city

Review_Date: Kate S wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Title: Mixed bag, room for improvements but we had a very good holiday
Review_Text: Stayed in April 2022 with family.  On the plus side the hotel is beautiful and very clean reception area is stunning with a mosaic ceiling and enormous Moroccan lanterns. All communal areas are very good especially the grounds and gardens. Staff were welcoming and friendly in the main too. Lovely view of snow capped Atlas Mountains low level 2 storey hotel.  The negatives were that bedrooms are in need of an update especially the bathrooms which have a walk-in shower but no grab rail or rubber shower mats. A few of us in our party nearly slipped over - quiet dangerous. The food was average at best I ate mostly salad and bread all week. The dining experience was chaotic- not enough plates glasses cups serving utensils etc. When an item ran out there was no rush to replenish it nothing was labelled and due to the lack of serving spoons/tongs etc there was lots of cross contamination between dishes. Allergy sufferers nightmare! They don‚Äôt seem to have the basics right and definitely don‚Äôt cater to children‚Äôs tastes my son stuck to pasta all week. Deserts were better than mains lunch generally better than dinner.  Animation team were very good friendly and energetic. But after 7 days it did get a bit wearing and same-y. Still taking nothing away from them they work very hard and made our stay enjoyable.  Lack of umbrellas around the pool area and those that were there kept getting blown over. Needed to be more plentiful and substantial- another H&S issue. No tables with the sun beds either so when anyone jumped into the pool there was a surge of water which repeatedly soaked the floor and our belongings. Pool itself is ok but not heated so it was chilly - minimum depth 100cms in the adult pool with a shelf going to 150cms at the deepest part.  Towels provided for use at the pool have seen better days some were stained and a little threadbare.  Soft drinks served from 1ltr bottles which meant they kept running out and this caused delays at the bar.  All in all we had a great week the hotel is good but there is room for improvement especially on the H&S and catering.

Review_Date: S L S wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: The animation and the lay put of the hotel is fabulous. The animation and reception can‚Äôt do enough for you. Really made our holiday. Very good price for what you get but the kitchen side of things needs a lot of work. Lack of plates utensils etc abs waiting around for ages. Very mixed dinners. Things in different places not replenished quick enough and a change of place for salad desserts etc. meat was awful nothing signed so if you suffer from allergies it‚Äôs a hit and miss situation.  Despite the lack of good and offerings the hotel and staff were superb and extremely helpful. Animation team are awesome. 100% in everything they do. Beautiful location and trips are fabulous and not expensive. Great poolside entertainment with plenty of room to sit and thank god no towel problems. French and britsh mostly. Highly recommended if you can bypass the food situation .

Review_Date: Ellie F wrote a review Apr 2022

The Animation / Entertainment Team - Sam  Jimi  Sophian  Issa  Fairouz DJ Abdel & Sania were very professional and at the same time super friendly.  Special mention to Sam who is an absolute superstar !    The staff at bar and restaurant are very welcoming and friendly. Restaurant team was great and very welcoming. They even made some special request custom food for my 11 year daughter during our stay!!    Overall Great experience. This resort is a ultimate combination excellent facilites and very warm and super-friendly staff ! Must visit if you are travelling to Marrakesh !!

Review_Date: xomonkey wrote a review Jan 2022

Review_Text: I booked a week for two in July 2019 via loveholidays and it cost ¬£1288.12. This included airport parking flights hold luggage x2 transfers on arrival and all inclusive at the hotel.    We ate like a king and queen for the week and loved spending an uninterrupted week by the adult pool just soaking up the sun enjoying each others company and enjoying the delicious food. We didn't partake in any of the sports or evening entertainment but had a couple of drinks in the bar.    The staff are all extremely hard working there was only really one member of staff we found easier to communicate in English although the others did try. We booked a massage at the spa which was ok value for money.

Review_Date: C S wrote a review Dec 2021
Review_Text: We had a great time at the hotel. We have enjoyed the relaxing rooms that offer all amenities. we were connected during our stay with free internet access.  The hotel offered a great pool and a poolside bar with a great view and service

Review_Date: Bethany hart wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: Let‚Äôs start off with the rooms. On our first day we had to be moved rooms 3 times due to ants everywhere on every single room! Lucky on our 4th room there was zero problems and we could then start to relax and enjoy our holiday.  This hotel is lovely has beautiful scenery however the food massively lets it down!!! There isn‚Äôt a lot to eat and if anything I lost weight on holiday rather than gainingüòÇ  The bar staff were lovely especially said he made us feel so welcome from our first visit always would joke and laugh with us.  I just want to say a massive thank you to abdel and Sam from the animation team and they made us feel so welcome and relaxed and probably were the only highlight bar the sunshine within our stay here. Our holiday got cut short due to government guidlines changing. So it was a bit of a sudden leave for us but I just would like to say thank you to the manager at reception for understanding and sorting our rooms if any problems with your room go to him first as he sorts it right away that was the mistake we didn‚Äôt do. A massive thank you to Sam and Abdel and apologies for not being able to have a proper goodbye!!! We all ready miss you.

Review_Date: Scott P wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Title: Great holiday. I would stay here again
Review_Text: I stayed here for 4 nights from the 12th to the 16th of October I had a great time and I wished I stayed longer. The hotel is about a 25 minute drive from the airport. There's not much to do within walking distance to the hotel. There is a shuttle bus avaliable which was pretty cheap.    The hotel was clean and tidy and the gardens were picturesque. Both of the pools were very big. There's a main pool and also a quieter pool.    The food was pretty good it was mostly Moroccan food and there were plenty of things to choose from. Breakfast would have been better if there were more English food like beans sausages and bacon. Although the omelettes were great. The all inclusive beer was a bit watery but the gin and tonics were good.    The best aspect of the hotel was the entertainment. The entertainers were great at getting everyone up and dancing in the evenings. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Review_Date: Abi_akram wrote a review Oct 2021
