We really appreciated all the efforts she made to make us enjoy our holidays  really fantastic . We won‚Äôt forget her that‚Äôs for sure. The food was great and the shows were good. We will back here again for sure !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jeb wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights from the 11th till the 15th of october. So I must start this review by mentioning the worst aspect of this hotel which was definately the sevice or shall I say the lack of service. The Waiters and staff running the bars are completely incompetent. We went all inclusive and each time we had lunch and dinner we would have to ask about 3 times for a bottle of wine. We are a party of 4 and they keep bringing a small bottle of wine which is not sufficcient to pour for all guests. Our hotel room did not have pillow cases and the sink in our bathroom was constantly blocked. When we pointed this out the estates lady simply unscrew the sink and left it upside down in the bathroom. You could see all the raw waste. absolutely disgusting. On thursday night they served food however decided to bring food to 3 of the guests on our table and kept serving other tables before actually finishing our table. This meant that everyone had to wait 22 minutes whilst there food was getting cold for them to bring the fourth guests food. What a terrible service. The bar staff are very impolite and everything felt like a chore! I would not recomend this hotel to anyone.  The animation crew where really good and friendly. They where very inclusive and tried there best. Also they kept saying snack bar however each time you asked for a snack they would say its run out. they dont actually have a snack bar!    I dout this is actually 4 star. more like a budget 3 star.

Review_Date: rosieellacott wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: My mum and I came here for a mother daughter holiday and it delivered everything we wanted. The food was great the staff super friendly and helpful. The bar staff were attentive and drinks were yummy. Entertainment team were very professional funny and fun to be around especially mono Sam yasmin zizu Abdul and mamadou

Review_Date: Edward O wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: We came for one week. Great food and drink quality  Service great friendly staff hotel clean and tidy  Momo the entertainment rep was very happy and good interaction with us in the evening. Good value for money.

Review_Date: Abida B wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Title: Good vacation at dar atlas with the good entertainers
Review_Text: We stayed in the hotel for 7 night I really enjoyed our stay with my husband. the food its very good entertainers good with All the entertainer teams especially Momo and Yasmin and Zizou were the best.

Review_Date: Clevkar wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: We Stay there from the 6 of October to the 12 of October. It was to celebrate my misus birthday. Stay was fantastic. Staff or friendly and nice. Food is great. They make a special effort to make sure we enjoy. Will be definitely returning
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Getaway724715 wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I spent a week here and we thought it was great value for money! No complaints at all. The entertainment team were fantastic and the chefs and barmen were incredibly attentive and always looked after you!  Special thank you to barman Momo and manager Youseff for looking after us all week and always making us smile!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: ZachGM wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: My girlfriend and I are both from the UK and we cannot complain about this hotel! The food is amazing and there is so much variety! Big thank you to Chef Youssef! The entertainment team were brilliant and we got involved in most of the activities. They were very welcoming and very helpful! Whatever you needed they would sort! Big shout out to my table tennis partner Sam! Yasmine Momo Zizou Mamadou khaled sania Jiji fayrouz were all great!  Overall we had a great time and would definitely recommend to any couple who‚Äôs looking to go to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: castigergirl wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: Stayed here for a long weekend. Would recommend for people on a budget but would pay a bit more and stay elsewhere if I were to return. The hotel itself is very nice spacious reception and dining area grounds are lovely and everywhere is well maintained and very clean. The two pools were spotless. It was quiet when we stayed and always plenty of space around the pool and minimal waits at the bar. The room was large and comfortable. The bathroom needs updating a shower room that has seen better days. The air con was effective against the 40 degree outdoor temp. The rooms were clean but do need a refurb. There is a lack of storage space small hanging area but no drawers or cupboards for a weekend it was not a problem but would struggle if staying a week or more. The walls are very thin and we could hear every noise from the room next door. The balcony was small but perfectly fine and private. There are no toiletries' provided other than a general dispenser of liquid soap. (not a problem but good to know) Daily housekeeping provided and one day we did have bottled water left for us. The hotel provides a shuttle service into Marrakech for 20 Dirham each way it was a 20 min trip and frequent. The all inclusive aspect was not what I have found in other places supplements were payable for most cocktails fresh juice and some hot drinks. The drinks were very small which meant returning to the bar more often. The package is supposed to include breakfast late breakfast Lunch late lunch snacks bar and afternoon tea and evening meal. We never found a snack bar open. One day at lunch i did not like the food (my personal taste nothing wrong with he food) went to find late lunch or a snack and was told it was closed until 4pm i asked at reception where i could get a snack and they directed me back to the person who said it was closed eventually a member of the entertainment team got me some food but this was a plated meal from lunch and not a snack or any choice. Dinner starts at 7.30pm which i find a little late. The choice of food was good fresh salads and different meat choices desserts were the same all the time. There is a lot of fish and poultry!! It would not be good for a vegetarian.  The best part of the hotel are the entertainment team they are all so lovely friendly and helpful. I took part in Arabic lessons but there was pool based activities and poker etc.. Each evening there was entertainment in singing disco and productions however the main even did not begin until 9.30pm.  Overall it was a good value for money trip.

Review_Date: Addo wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: Had an amazing time. We got the bus for 80Dh into Marrakech. That‚Äôs for 2 return. All of the staff are great we are sat with Salim now having a coffee before we leave it‚Äôs been a great time there is loads to do or you can relax. Food is great BBQ and restaurant great meals all day
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: sunseeker1606 wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: having a fantastic time herenothing is too much trouble from the bar staff to the amazing entertainment team many thanks to SalimSamMamadou  Momo  Khalid sania fayrouz  jiji Abdel dj  also Ahmed at the bar thankyou for making us so welcome with lots of good memories
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Adam F wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: It is unfair to review this hotel as an overall instead I have reviewed various areas of the hotel    Grounds: 5* - The grounds are spectacular everything is very well tended with staff constantly maintaining the grass trees pool etc. The two pools are fantastic I can‚Äôt find any fault there    Staff: 5* - The staff are very accommodating they genuinely want to help you and seem to love their jobs. Sam in particular from the entertainment team is very personal not pushy but friendly    Room: 3* - Outdated and quite basic nothing wrong in particular just needs renovating hard on dirt in the rooms and on the windows. Not dirty in general but needs a touch up    Room Bathroom: 1* - Only word to describe these bathrooms is foul very basic just a standing shower that didn‚Äôt stay on the wall dirty and not maintained. If you are looking for a luxurious bathroom you wont find it in your room. The only positive of it is that the shower is powerful so you can get clean.    Food: 3* - I am not a picky eater whatsoever but this was very limited if you are or have a fussy eater or have a restricted diet I would avoid this hotel. The food they serve is okay in terms of taste but limited. When they serve Moroccan cuisine it is nice but the rest seems a stretch for the chef    In general all we enjoyed our time at the hotel but wouldn‚Äôt stay again its too far away from the city and there is a bit of a language barrier with most staff speaking broken English.    PRO TIPS!  - The shop at the hotel is limited you can buy some souvenirs and cigarettes but not much else NO TOILETRIES.  - The hotel offers a very limited shuttle service to the city so if you want to come or go to the city outside of these times you will pay 250-350 Dirham  - Taxis from the airport cost 300+ Dirham  - Go to the city to see the sunset!!!!

Review_Date: Chelsealou wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: We went as a group of 4 friends for 7 days and we had a fantastic time food was great staff were welcoming. Even though there was a curfew of 9pm at the time of our visit we still had a great time.    activities and entertainment was always great    I must say the customer relations manager was exceptional we had a few minor issues which was dealt with so professionally and quickly. he made time to introduce himself to all guests and made himself available when ever needed I was stung by an insect and he arranged for the nurse to check me.    TIPS:  This is a predominately French speaking resort staff have got a basic level of English but if you need a nurse ect. I would recommend to google translate questions/symptoms    They have an onsite shop which has your usual ciggerettes souviners ect. However I would recommend to make sure you pack enough hygiene items sunscreen ect as the shop didn't seem to have any.

Review_Date: michaelmX9291BW wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: Had an amazing time here. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The entertainment team were excellent providing us with a variety of shows in the evenings. Food was very nice there's something there for everyone. The desserts were exceptionally good.  The excursion office has a wide variety of trips giving you a chance to really explore morocco and its history.  I would recommend this resort for anyone coming to morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lauren R wrote a review Sep 2021
Review_Text: I stayed here for 2 weeks and honestly it has been the greatest holiday I have had especially after all that has gone on! The entertainers are always happy and smiling looking after you getting you involved in varied activities Momo Sam and Samil are amazing at what they do! Evening entertainment is amazing and interactive. The bar staff and the maids are also so amazing looking after everyone. The food is honestly great there are plenty of varied options for everyone I recommend going to the ozourd waterfalls it is beautiful. All in all a beautiful holiday and a beautiful holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Josh T wrote a review Sep 2021
Review_Text: We stayed here for 1 week. It has been an incredible holiday. All of the staff have been amazing. There has been different entertainment every night. The food was delicious and very varied.  Thanks you for all staff Momo for big smile and Ahmed Yousif ssbiti Sam Salim and everything you have done for us. The maids have in been every day making sure everything in the room is perfect.  What a wonderful place to be!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Zo√´ Patrick wrote a review Aug 2021
Review_Title: A lovely 5 night stay but rooms not 4 star
Review_Text: A lovely 5 nights with perfect weather and lovely staff.  We booked this holiday with easyJet holidays and it was down as a 4 star. I agree that the facilities spa pool areas cleanliness food and animation were probably to this standard but the rooms were definitely not. Unfortunately the rooms were quite basic and tired looking. The beds were too firm and the pillows weren‚Äôt great either (sorry!). It‚Äôs such a shame because the resort is so beautiful and picturesque. The air con was only to one setting and we couldn‚Äôt change it. The WiFi worked in the room but only in certain locations.  The food was fine but the queuing got a bit ridiculous I don‚Äôt know whether it was because were British and we know how to queue but there were several occasions where people cut ahead of us which got really annoying. Luckily the staff started to notice this the more busy it got.  It‚Äôs probably worth mentioning that we were perhaps only 1 of 3 other British families in this resort during our stay. The majority were french speakers and it was great obvious that there was a bit of a hierarchy when it came to getting drinks at the bar/ queuing for food/ entertainment (everything was in french).  Apart from the above we had a really nice time. The excursion team were wonderful and Sam and Momo are worth a kind mention too.  Thanks for the happy memories!

Review_Date: ahmed f wrote a review Aug 2021
Review_Title: best holidays after a boring pandemic
Review_Text: i v been here for 5 nights and honestly its relaxing and really good after a year of being lockdown  the food is good  the animation is great  pools are amazing  people are nice and joyful  especialy animation team and the mans of the hotel momo  sam  mamado  i recommend it and probably we will meet next year
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed 10 days at Dar Atlas and we all ha a great time .  The staff were amazing couldn't do enough few names to mention snack bar " Youssef and Nouredine .  At the bar " Ahmed Ahmed and Momo.    Animation team special thanks to Sam who is the heart and soul of the hotel .    Mamadou Great energy and spirit.    Thank you all for making our holiday special.  Hope to see you soon inchallah    Haifa

Review_Date: Tracy M wrote a review Aug 2021
Review_Text: We arrived at the hotel at 10:30pm and straight away was offered a meal which was appreciated. Then we were shown to our room which although was basic had everything you needed and what lacked with the room was more than made up for with the staff and the food.    The hotel is clean the bar area and terrace were lovely to sit in the evening and relax.    All the staff work extremely hard however they always have a smile for you and are so friendly. They couldn't do enough to provide you with a fabulous holiday.  The entertainment staff were amazing In particular Sam. He kept us laughing the whole time always had a smile and went above and beyond. My husband had an ear infection on holiday and Sam took him to see the nurse and translate.    I would be happy to return back to the club dar Atlas.    Well done to you all and many thanks from Tracy and Richard.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Souhail wrote a review May 2021
Review_Text: The hotel is nice we had a good fun in valeria dar atlas  we talking about the best animation team  we meet a crazy nice freinds Sania Sam mamadou jiji and mano the make a good show an activity all day .we had a good day in aquaparc with mehdi and all the team the jardin and pool are so nice staff of the bar and restaurant are good thank you guys for this holidays

Review_Date: hamza h wrote a review May 2021
Review_Text: Happy to be in hotel dar atlas marrakech  we had to much fun with animatoin team a good shows in night time and to many activitis in day we cani't wiat to see sania and sam  mamadou and crazy abdel and jiji with wiht her frind mano in kids club and we dont forget about the bar sttaf and we had nice walk in big gardens ....

Review_Date: Denise wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Booked a trip for the 22nd Feb for 4 days with my daughter. Firstly the check-in .. they didn't make you feel welcome and it felt as we were an inconvenience . The hotel mainly seems to cater for the French. The food is horrible whilst there is a selection most of it is not edible in my opinion. Birds are eating the bread you will be lucky to get a clean table and if you do good luck finding cutlery. The drinks are as bad all local drinks but dont taste anything like the drink they are supposed to represent. There is nowhere to sit in the evening except the bar or outside which is packed. WiFi is only available in reception. The pool was nice but get there early as its packed and later on we saw guests sitting on the floor . The rooms are ok and clean and the entertainment team try their best . I have been to Marrakesh a number of times and have to say i would not come back here and would stay in the city instead

Review_Date: Paul i wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Arrived late on Friday 13th ( which should of been a omen) first impressions nice hotel woke up saturday breakfast lunch and evening meal lovely staff very friendly sunday is were the holiday started going dreadfully wrong flights started to be cancelled because of coronaviras all guests started panicking this is were you would expect the hotel to reassure all guests that they would do everything that they could to help everyone instead staff started to get sent home  food went from very good to practically rationing no help what so ever even electricity getting turned off in rooms in daytime even manager informing guest's the hotel would close on 20th wether you got a flight or not  i must add to this that we booked with loveholidays who had no contact with us what so ever for the duration of our stay all in all apart from the other uk guests who stuck together in this telling time a terrible experience
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: flukeySouthWales wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Having booked the trip 4 months ago left on the 15 march the flight should never have left as soon as we got there the first day was fab food and cleanliness from there on in a nightmare. Empty ed the pool no spa put away sunbed and tables in the dining room no rep no help what so ever from the staff couldn't use our phonethey had our money end of sports then the receptionist came running for the plastic card the only thing I seen pro active the whole holiday.

Review_Date: ryanpoole12 wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Wow where to start? Taking into account the coronavirus I had to give the hotel a small break but even so the hotel was nothing short of awful. The staff were in the main unhelpful and on occasion rude. The staff on reception being the main culprits uninterested and couldnt care less about customer service. The level of all inclusive here is very low and you will be searching for food outside of breakfast lunch or dinner. The snack bar is a joke a couple of crossaints or a pancake. Poor selection and nowhere near enough on offer. Not all drinks are covered in the all inclusive either so be aware. The entertainment staff were good but they were sent packing by the management on day two of the trip due to the coronavirus. I have to be fair and say that these were exceptional circumstances but nevertheless this hotel was still very poor and I wouldn't recommend to anyone to visit. If you like a little bit of luxury and good standards then this isnt the place for you.

Review_Date: kevred123 wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Got to hotel in Friday night check in was nice and quick as they told you nothing just gave you keyhad to search for room. Room was good clean and cleaners were fantastic. Hotel grounds were amazing. Animation team great and food was good. This all changed on Sunday when there was a mass checkout of French and Dutch due to the covid 19 and the airport closure. With only english left the staff became rude the food became poor to say the least and help was non existent. We were all at risk of being stranded in Morocco for months and they did not give us any help what so ever and even refused to print our new flight tickets off. We were leaving 3 days early so surely would of been cheaper to do this. I understand these were exceptional circumstances but a little help would of gone a long way as this was horrendous for us and the worry was horrific
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mel P wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Stayed beginning of March and blessed with excellent weather all week.  Arrived late and no problems with checking in no welcome or complimentary food or drink in the room - we booked through on the beach and I wonder if this is offered if booked through tour operator.  Room is adequate in size and very clean mattress was very clean with protector though not especially comfortable I have however had worse. Duvet clean and warm with additional blanket and only one pillow.  The room was dated the bathroom in desperate need of a revamp mould in the grouting and the condition of the shower was quite unacceptable though it did offer hot water. The position of the shower resulted in water coming over into the main bathroom area making it very slippery. The hairdryer kept cutting out.  The towels changed daily and where soft and white. No toiletries other than wall mounted soap dispenser.  No drinks making facilities.  Working safe but you had to pay for it.  Wall mounted TV offered some British viewing.  The whole complex was clean.  We spent the whole of our stay making use of the Zen pool and can only comment on that though we did use the pool bar in the late.  All inclusive at the bar by the zen pool only allows the bottled water all food and drinks have to be paid for.  When going to the pool in the morning - around 10.30 the beds would still be in the hap hazard way they where left the previous evening the water bottles and rubbish not tidied up  on two days the rubbish not removed at all.  We didn't participate In the entertainment and unable to comment other than to note people seemed to enjoy it.  The food was ok quite repetitive especially breakfast and lunch dinner was themed - Spanish Mexican Moroccan and a gala night. Service was good in majority sometimes too good where the plate was whipped away too soon.  My concern was the cooking process the omelettes where often undercooked though if asked they will continue to cook them for longer. They often serve the meat as rare and the burgers where just a little too pink In the middle. Pudding where a little disappointing and very repetitive.  Getting a morning drink was often a problem be aware you are charged for the orange juice and there was insufficient cups and machines for the hot drinks no decaf of anything.  All inclusive drinks where the usual none branded and good the bar always appeared to be well staffed but I failed to work out what system they were working to if you asked for a coffee they referred it to someone to the right they seemed unable to take an order of more than one drink or they just ignored you.  Money exchange on site and reception very helpful if not busy at most times.  Having looked at previous reviews it talks of language barriers I can‚Äôt say there was any problem with this other then as a Brit often it is our only language where as most staff seemed to be capable of offering us three options.  In summary we enjoyed our stay and on the basis it wasn‚Äôt expensive it was value for money. However it does not offer the 4* facilities you would expect like toiletries slippers WiFi throughout a sensible gym and more modern interior.  If looking for a inexpensive break I would consider it again but have stayed in a number of places in Morocco previously that have the edge on this.

Review_Date: Susan W wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Title: Nice hotel shame about some staff
Review_Text: Hotel facilities are good - you get what you pay for as always. Rooms spacious and 3 beds comfortable and clean. Bathrooms dated and our shower head broke sadly.  Small terrace to sit out although rooms sleep 3 every room only had seats outside for 2 !!    Food very good. Always plenty of choice and to a high standard for all inclusive. Breakfast hot drinks a little more tricky and would often run out of cups and with only 2 self service drinks machines they were often running out of something.    All inclusive drinks good - the usual beers wines and local spirits. A few cocktails also available with the option to pay for branded spirits and wider range of cocktails.    Pools lovely. Always plenty of comfortable sun beds at this time of year. Pool area clean and towels provided.    Entertainment team lovely. Very hard working and friendly. Always something to do if you‚Äôre that way inclined- aqua aerobics stretching darts dancing shows etc. Friendly and encouraging but we didn‚Äôt find them too pushy.    Sadly the only negative would have to be the attitude of some staff. Grumpy and unfriendly at times. Reception badly managed and we were made to feel like an inconvenience. When we asked about late check out we were offered to keep our room for 30‚Ç¨ - not worth it for a few hours although be aware there are no shower rooms available either to wash and change prior to departure.

Review_Date: Chelsea W wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: We came to club dar atlas and out of every hotel around the world this one is by far the best all staff especially animation team (abdal mano soufiane hannan mamado samia.Zana.) are attentive and will do anything to help! Food is very good massive range to pick off all fresh and warm good choice of drinks and cocktails (bar staff are good his ham. rooms big and clean. Already looked to book to come back later this year I'm very impressed and would recommend to anyone. Cocktail on arrival which was very welcoming and nice 10 stars all round

Review_Date: TravelNotComplete wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: We stepped into the hotel and were greeted with smiles politeness and courteous staff the rooms are great the food is varied and the hotel is clean the animation team wow they are fabulous interactive and the shows in the evening are great come and watch the fire show.

Review_Date: Shannon Cook wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Couldn't recommend a better place to stay in Marrakesh the staff food entertainment is all so amazing. It's always kept clean and tidy couldn't fault it at all. We're on day 3 and already dreading leaving.

Review_Date: Claire L wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Animation team one of the best always smiling and go out of their way to make your holiday an amazing time.  Fire show was amazing. Soufiane is one of is the best. I wont forget the others Hanane sania abdel sam mamado zayna mano and the big head of the team MOKII the dragon
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Diane H wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Just returned from a wonderful 10 day holiday at this hotel.  The staff were all lovely especially the animation team who worked really hard at various activities near the pool and encourage guests to join in. The staff always had a smile on their faces and ran the entertainment with much enthusiasm.  The swimming pool was clean and warm. There was plenty of sunbeds to sit on too.  The evening entertainment was really good especially the ' Fire Eating' evening.  We went on one of the trips to the 'souks' in Marrakesh. the trip was very well organised and gave us an insight in to the Moroccan way of life.  The food at the hotel was very good with a lot of choice even for picky eaters. The wine at lunch and dinner was really good.  I would recommend this hotel to everyone and I hope to visit there again soon.

Review_Date: Adil G wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Isolated location outside Marrakesh but decent facility. Staff could do with training on customer service - sullen almost to the point of rude. English not commonly spoken. French is the predominant communication language. Food OK. Rooms clean and reasonable. Quiet when away from main block. Two swimming pools - one for adults only. Annoying extras you have to pay for - like fresh orange juice!!! And Ourika restaurant. Otherwise food and choices good.  Otherwise not too bad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David W wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Haven‚Äôt got a bad word to say about this resort. The entertainment team completely amazing fun and attentive. Very talented bunch.  Food and drink good and plentiful.  The only feedback is the need for bigger beer glasses which tend to come in shot glasses. Although the bar manager was great and sorted us larger glasses

Review_Date: karenj27 wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: I went for my first solo holiday here in Marrakesh. Absolutely loved it! The hotel staff were very welcoming put on great entertainment and I didn‚Äôt need to spend a penny on top of what I‚Äôd paid.  The weather was ideal taxi transport to and from airport also really handy (I pre booked through Love Holidays).  I only stayed here 3 nights but will definitely be coming back for longer to do more exploring.  Room was clean and tidy. Perhaps a little tired in places but I‚Äôm not one to care about that. It‚Äôs only a bed for the night after all! There is a fridge in room so you can keep your bottled water cool.  No fights for sun loungers plenty to go round. Pool bar is great and offers snacks inside. Music is sometimes played around pool which I didn‚Äôt mind.  All meals in dining room were fine. Good choice of hot and cold options. The paella was lovely the tagines delicious and the omelettes were freshly cooked for you at breakfast time.  Tables were cleared a little too quickly sometimes I saw a few diners get up for more food only to return to their table to have it cleared away along with their drinks! But if paid AI you just get another. I recommend leaving an item on the table do they know it‚Äôs still occupied.  I asked my taxi driver to take me around one day as I wasn‚Äôt keen on doing the markets alone. I highly recommend you do as it was stress free and he takes you to see the sights. Only cost ¬£20. I visited the Marjorelle Gardens (note YSL Museum is closed on a Wednesday I got caught out ‚òπÔ∏è)  I didn‚Äôt use the spa but another solo lady I met did and she recommended it. Or at least to wander towards it as the area around the hotel is lovely.  Thank you for a very relaxing stay. I will be returning!  Xx

Review_Date: Samuel W wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Went to Hotel Dar Atlas for a family holiday. Brilliant hotel! Phenomenal all round hotel entertainment fantastic friendly talented and keep you busy throughout the day BUT not pushy!! Food very good and environment so relaxing! Couldn‚Äôt recommend anymore! Definitely coming back!

Review_Date: Jasmin B wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Really great hotel and amazing animation team so friendly and welcoming! Activities are fun and active rooms are clean and big! Lovely scenery and they offer a variety of food! Will definitely be back! üíó

Review_Date: Lizzie Thomas-Davies wrote a review Mar 2020

We enjoyed the food and the whole experience. The room was fine and kept spotless by the staff. The only slightly negative comments were that the hotel reception was understaffed and this meant waiting in line. Also the Wifi was rather limited and not available in our room.

Review_Date: Aen wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Great hotel with a good stuffs   I spent one week in this hotel very nice pool the rooms very clean and clean women they are friendly  the food is not bad need more choice  Entertainment team the they always nice and makes your holiday better thanks everyone for everything    Aen üòç

Review_Date: tom2tom27 wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Excellent hotel excellent staff excellent entertainment team we enjoyed the shows each night. Perfect holiday entertainment available all day/night from excellent team! Pool lovely and food brilliant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: anita h wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Had a fantastic time here all the staff are happy and friendly entertainment all day everyday which is fun and family friendly food is lovely will definitely be going back. Lovely surroundings to walk around rooms lovely and clean pool lovely and refreshing hotel always clean all staff talk to you every day.

Review_Date: Nick B wrote a review Mar 2020

Review_Date: lovellphotography wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Main language of visitors seams to be French but there is a good mix of languages. Polite and courteous staff. Great surroundings within and the rooms are more than adequate. Easy shuttle bus to main areas and cabs available. Pool was a bit cold but I did enter bravely twice when on grounds. Tennis courts shows and lively activities available most of time. Large eating area with good food.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: kerensasmall wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: on arrival the reception guy was asking questions not related to our stay coughing over us no attempt to speak English wanted to know why i was not talking in Arabic...Other reception staff were lovely very helpful.... room well if i pay for 3 people i expect 3 quilts 3 lots of towels not the girls who look after the rooms fault sorted it with reception.. all good... food ok not brilliant but ive eaten worse staff lovelyclean...animation team r brilliant except one guy...one young lady works so hard for her family but i have so much respect for these people who always smile no matter what....waiting and bar staff were very helpful... i know the Atlas group r in trouble and they now have new people to bring it back up to standard... the people i spoke to there were not happy that they could not take their kids on the flumes no u couldnt and in the hotel next door also all inclusive no not really... so would i recommend it at the moment no maybe it will change but if u like a very slow nothing much to do governed by times and not full use of the all inclusive title then go for it spend ur money and be told what u can do

Review_Date: 321bata wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Had a lovely holiday with family and entertainment guys were just too good swimming pool was very good and clean. Staff arranged activities for all different things including playing poker which was good. Food was very good and new director Frederick was brilliant

Review_Date: Bex wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Amazing holiday at this hotel. Animation team made the trip especially Soufiane ‚ù§Ô∏è Food is great the grounds of the hotel are beautiful and the weather is dreamy! Would definitely come back again ‚òÄÔ∏è‚òÄÔ∏è‚òÄÔ∏è

Review_Date: Anthony T wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Well after arriving here in morocco for the very first and can guarantee it wont be our last...the hotel was amazing staff couldnt help enough the rooms are spotless the pressure on the shower could off been a bit better but it was hot.  The food what can i say the best i have had in an all inclusive resort and ive stayed in a few talking to other people hearing what they have paid well all i can say is i got bargain the whole holiday for 2 adults was ¬£400 thats hotel flights carpark and transfers we will be back club dar atlas and thank you for am amazing week keep up the good work
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lisa D wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Firstly the good points the food is excellent the entertainment staff work very hard. The hotel is very clean and the grounds are lovely. A few downsides not enough to spoil the holiday but I think people should know. All inclusive is just wine and beer all sprits and cocktails you have to pay for. The fitness centre you also have to pay for. We arrived at 2230. No food available which I guess is fair enough so went to the bar which is a bit like a working mans club and got a drink after 11pm you have to pay for all drinks even hot chocolate from a machine. I‚Äôm sure it said a free shuttle to the town but you have to pay not too much but still. Also you have to pay a tax when you arrive. They have a restaurant aside from the buffet but you have to pay for that! The buffet restaurant is very chaotic but the food is worth it.

Review_Date: johnbrent1 wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Just finished a week stay at club dar atlas.  Fully recommended. For the price the value is insane!  Quality of food is good and varied. Rooms are a good size with a comfortable bed and good shower.  The swimming pools were both good one heated! Located about 25 mins from Marrakech there was a shuttle for 2‚Ç¨ each way.  The main highlight of the hotel was the ENTERTAINMENT TEAM.  They work so hard none stop provided fun and laughter with a variety of activities.  Soufiane was so much fun and a super polite guy. Will definitely be coming back later this year.

Review_Date: Sade K wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: The animation team were attentive and friendly. Lots of great activities and even better food! Will definitely be coming again. Rooms were clean and someone was always on hand to help out when and if needed.

Review_Date: Gillary F wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: The animation is really fun very nice they talk to us all the time and make sure we are involved with every activity.  They have a really nice restaurant alot of diversity.  And the rooms are amazing

Review_Date: Team Kemble wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Relaxing half term break with the family
Review_Text: Peaceful accommodation set out in little riads amongst beautiful gardens with rose beds orange trees fountains palms and even a lake. The rooms were spacious and comfortable . We were particularly happy with our south facing balcony. Heated swimming pool with plenty of sun loungers and shade if needed. Music and entertainment between 10.30 - 12 and again 3.30 - 6pm. The Aqua Gym class was a particular favourite for my daughters (16 + 9) and I. The staff were incredibly helpful and spoke excellent english. Thank you Sam Rico and Abdul for your jokes card tricks and morning yoga classes on the terrace. You can get as involved as much as you like with the activities/evening entertainment or retreat to the calmer parts of the complex if you want peace and tranquility. Food was varied with plenty of hot/cold options bread wine etc. My daughter and I are veggie and were incredibly well catered for. The Moroccan pancakes went down very well both a breakfast and in the afternoon snack bar. I'd recommend the hotel to anyone wanting a restful break with children. Only info that would have been useful before is that the spa/quiet pool are adult only so you are relying on good weather as although the main pool is heated it is still quite cold! We were very lucky and had 26 dgs during our week in February but you wouldn't want to swim if the sun wasn't out or if it was windy. The rooms are a bit shabby in places (particularly bathrooms) and you don't get robes toiletries tea/coffee etc so some people might question the four star rating however that didn't bother us as the beds were clean and comfortable and we had plenty of towels. The queues for food get a busy at peak times but the staff are all working incredibly hard to provide all we could ask for in terms of drinks/snacks etc. and we had a wonderful rest together. Our girls haven't stopped talking about the pool food and fun we had. Thank you!

Review_Date: Ula K wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: I was there for one week it was amazing week very happy food was perfect and the room was very cleaning and the most think that I really love was the entertainment team they were very friendly and working hard to make us enjoying our time and we never felt boring with them they speak 3 languages very well English fresh Arabic  special thanks to Mokii with his team Soufiane hanane abdel Sam Sania mamado Sam Moni and the dj Abdel and mido  I won't forgot the bar stuff Anas and imad from snack bar and khqdija room service she was very kind to us.  I really felt myself between my family and friends.  Thank you so much.

Review_Date: Weekender70Kent wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Staying here for a week. Friendly hotel great service. We had the pleasure of being here on valentines night! Wonderful food! The entertainment team made it very special handed out roses to the ladies as we arrived. Show time was amazing the entertainment team really work hard! All day and night. Special mention to Ricco Abdul Soufiane Mamado and Hannah who made us feel very welcome
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sara Poulsen wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Very nice, fun and cozy hotel
Review_Text: The hotel has a very beautiful decor and interior! With very nice and welcoming staff who speaks many languages and are very interested in making you feel comfortabel and make sure you have a great time! There is a lot of different fun activeties arranged by the entertainment team! Consisting of Soufianhanaeprisila abdel mamado rico and sania who will make a big effort to make fun activities for you :))))

Review_Date: Romy Schipper wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: The hotel is clean. The food is different everyday and very nice. The beds are comfy and in the room it‚Äôs very quiet.  I would like to thank the entertainment team one by one for the nice company and i apperciate their effort to make everybody happy. A special thanks to Soufiane who is always friendly and we had great talks about many things.  When we had a complaint Hanane helped us very well. Thanks to her too.    The bartender at the pool is alert and serves you very good. The pool is clean and warm.  It was overall a nice stay!

Review_Date: Amanda A wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Beautiful location and food! Hosts Hanane namira priscilla Abdul were fun and accomodating! Lots of activities to do and good music. Large room and free wifi aswell as alcohol included! I really enjoyed my stay would reccomend

Review_Date: Glo wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: The hotel is beautiful plenty to do. The entertainment team is fantastic thank you to Hanane Pricilla Namira sania Abdul mamadou  mido  soufian mounir. Food is very tasty and all the staff are very friendly and the reception team they made our stay here extra special.

Review_Date: Basil A wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Excellent stay, will never forget lovely and really humble staff ,lovely place and awesome food
Review_Text: The best stay of my life .will never forget this place because of staff whenever i met any kind of staff there they always welcoming everyone with smily face and always ready to help you they always around you.  There were all awesome people but i am writing few names which i remember .. NAUFIL AHMAD  HAMZA.  If anybody goes there pls find those people specially recommended NAUFIL.  And verity of food were awesome *******  And pool was really clean and nice

Review_Date: JOHN G wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Hotel is dated but nice. Staff are very friendly & accommodating. Entertainment staff all very welcoming & happy Souifane Hannah & the rest if the team work tirelessly. Food is fine. However snacks could do with an overhaul. Poolside plastic cups likewise. Weather fantastic during the day bit chilly in the am & pm. For the price no complaints from me.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jules wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Atlas hotel was amazing had a lively weekend with my son staff were friendly and hospitable went out of their way to make you feel welcome .  A special thanks to Abdul sophie an samira sorry if spellings wrong x even staff on reception were great and very helpful.  The iron cleaners were very professional and friendly even guy booking our taxi was amazing.  Hotel was very clean will go back again thank you atlas for a perfect weekend away.

Review_Date: Getaway223021 wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Staff excellent nothing to much for them.    The entertainment team especially Abdel and jaminara were fantastic always there to talk and fantastic activities and evening shows wonderful team.    Hotel spotless and rooms spacious good shop on complex

Review_Date: BeauC wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Great hotel. Nice food and good entertainment.  Very nicely people at the animation team.  I will thank the animation team Abdel. mamadou . namira . hanan. Prisila.soufian and mido    Thank you for a lot of fun during our stay !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: janetaylor2018 wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Had a good week at this hotel clean rooms friendly staff and a great animation team. We weren't prepared for the drop in temperature of an evening but the reception sorted out a heater for our room and we bough a couple of hoodies from the souk!!  Food was ok plenty of it but lukewarm and some rather odd combinations.  Recommend taking the bus to the markets we went twice once in the day and again early evening and stayed til after sunset. Ate in the square from a stall and lived to tell the tale! Highly recommend NO52!!  All in all a nice hotel but not a destination for Winter sun.

Review_Date: Carolyn B wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: 3 English ladies looking for a restful break which is what we got. All the staff were very friendly but I have to say we were outnumbered by the number of French guests who seemed to get preferential treatment. This did not spoil our holiday however as the room was clean and cleaned every day. Unfortunately there was a problem with the heating in the rooms which was needed in the evenings but we were provided with a heater when we mentioned the lack of heating at reception. The hotel was less than a quarter capacity so meal times were a pleasant experience as the restaurant was not busy and the food was very acceptable and nicely presented. The animation team were enthusiastic and worked hard.  We probably won‚Äôt visit this hotel again but overall we enjoyed ourselves

Review_Date: Chris G wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: We and my girlfriend went for a couples retreat with no stress. Got exactly what we wanted beautiful sun staff that attend to every need we ever wanted! Everything that came with the all inclusiveness was amazing (but not the hangovers) Yes it is a French resort but EVERYONE who works there pretty much can speak English or on a basic level can understand you - room service is through and the AC is so powerful. WIFI actually works; which you need with it being outside of EU.    PLEASE WHEN TRAVELING FROM AIRPORT FREAK OUT. IT IS ROUGH ON THE WAY BUT BE PATIENT IT IS WITH IT.    Thumbs up from us üëç
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lisan H wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: I want say thank you to the all stuff in this hotel it was really good holiday with good people food was okay and the barmans are very friendly every night something different amazing show activite the whole thanks day the entertainment team are Professional simo mido hanane priscilla vitamine noufel mamadou and also one of the ride team He's name fahd the othres don 't talk to us :( no smile also sorry

Review_Date: Ingrid H wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: We had good time me and my daughter in this lovely hotel the room was clean  the barmans doing good job the stuff are very nicely  Specialy the animation team hanane sania mido mamadou vitamine simo noufel priscilla thanks guys for making our holiday good  See you next time

Review_Date: Val W wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Let's start with the positive - the site and the rooms were kept clean    The negatives - The whole place is tired and needing a good overhaul. The WIFI only works in the reception area as soon as you leave the reception you loose connection. The staff are polite but speak very little English which did cause us some problems. The entertainment was very amateurish always in French but executed with enthusiasm. We were there in January 2020 so a heated swimming pool and/or an indoor pool were essential. Sadly the heated outdoor pool was very cold and the indoor pool you have to pay to use. The food looks lovely but is served cold or luke warm we had to microwave the meals if we wanted a hot meal. Lots of the crockery is cracked and chipped. At meal times sparrows are flying around the dining room sitting on the food and pecking at it. Overall as English (denoted by the cream wristband we had to wear) we felt very out of placeisolated and not very welcome. We weren't treated in the same way the French visitors were. Thankfully we were only there for a short break but that was long enough. Our recommendation would be to steer well clear of this place.

Review_Date: John Dempsey wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Really enjoyed our stay. The staff were friendly helpful and courteous.  We had no real problem as some have described with the language. A smattering of French helped but a lot of the staff had some English and a few of them were very fluent.  We thought the food was excellent with lots of choice.  Excursions into Marrakech itself were not expensive and we enjoyed the city immensely.  We did not do any of the day trips although they seemed reasonable.  The room was comfortable and was serviced every day.  A couple of days of rain (end of November) did not spoil it and the sun shone the rest of the time without being too hot.  The extensive grounds and gardens are well kept and really pretty with lots of flowering plants and loads of roses.  I would say that two weeks was too long for us and ten days might have been a better choice.

Review_Date: BEN ARLOND wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Good holiday entertainment is amazing they try and get everyone involved its quite funny there are quite a few activities highly recommended and bar staff also thank u so much for everything and see u soon and no forget the great bar team with mr sabti‚ù§Ô∏è

Review_Date: Pietrina M wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: The entertainment team all ways put on a great show for everyone. The weather is great despite the time of year. Fantastic service all year round. The team of the bar are always prepared to help with any drink desire you want as well as food.‚ù§Ô∏è Mr sabti‚ù§Ô∏è

Review_Date: chris coulson wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days over new years and didnt want to leave it's so nice and relaxing with helpful friendly staff good food clean rooms only down side if any is that it's a bit remote but there a bus into town and back couples time a day or it's about a ¬£15 cab ride.  Deffo recommend this place 100% we will be going back to this hotel

Review_Date: Georgina wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: What a fab two weeks! Everything here is ace from the moment you walk in the reception staff are so helpful and explain everything Yasmin especially. The hotel itself is gorgeous clean and well maintained. All the staff are lovely the bar staff are amazing! The catering is gorgeous and the staff are so helpful! The animation team work so hard and are brilliant!! The performances they put on were ace and definitely worth the watch! All the animation team are happy to help and our holiday wouldn't have been the same without them!!!! We stayed over Xmas and New year and whoever planned these days deserves a medal it was amazing and has made me want to come every year over these days. A special shoutout to Naofaul and Mehdi who seemed to go the extra length in helping us! They are both hilarious and so friendly! Thank you to all the staff and club dar Atlas you are all brilliant!!

Review_Date: Jessica P wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: What a fantastic holiday!! What an amazing place to stay and how beautiful marrakech is. We stayed for 2weeks and within them days we stayed at the hotel for most of them days and down to all the entertainment staff made it fun and tried to get everyone involved in all different activities. Also all the staff are so helpful and the bar staff are amazing! A big shout out to naofaul and Mehdi who made alot of effort with us during our stay and are absolutely hilarious! Would 100% recommend fun for all the family:)

Review_Date: Becky wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Wow were do I start we came to Marrakesh on a family holidayit was me my husband my four girls (1917136). The holiday was the best we've ever had we relaxed so muchwe was there over Christmas and New year the entertainment team was absolutely amazing they went so far to make our stay so special.not only do they entertain us all day and night they are there to help with any advice.we had our evening meal with the entertainment team every evening (the food was fantastic the chefs are so talented) the entertainment team really make you feel like family.personally my favourite activity was the aqua aerobics and the darts.In my life I have never seen Santa on a camel my girls loved it so did i. new year's eve was something else it was the best party I've ever been to to celebrate the new year.happy new year to all the staff that made our holiday memories xx

Review_Date: Powner80 wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: This was our first time away at Xmas and have to say what a fantastic time we had. the amination team were brilliant for being a French speaking hotel they tried to include us in everything. the food was brilliant with plenty of choice our only let down was our house maid was poor but it didn't ruin the holiday.

Review_Date: Miles Berry wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Amazing place with some amazing people working there.  They‚Äôre always happy to help and apart from a few issues with towels at the beginning of the holiday me and my family all had a fantastic time. The theatre productions were fantastic and very well put together my favourite of the week being ‚ÄúThe songs of Michael Jackson‚Äù. The food was excellent and the animation team were brilliant leading dances and aerobics near the relaxing swimming pool all throughout the day. My favourite of the animations team was Naoufal who was absolutely hilarious!!

Review_Date: Sean Berry wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Naoufal Sabri and the team put on great shows every night. Always fun and pleasant to talk to. Very welcoming!    We stayed for New Year and they pulled out all the stops - from the food to the performances. We had an awesome holiday!

Review_Date: –ê–Ω–∞—Å—Ç–∞—Å–∏—è –ì wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: It was our fist vacation in Marrakech. My family saw a great show on New year's eve! Professional dancers won the hearts of my children!  Mouki Sania Hannan Simo Mehdi Vitamin Spider Mamadou you are superstars! Thanks a lot to the hotel for our vacation.

Review_Date: a_mw wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: It was a good hotel with good service.  I really enjoyed the fantastic christmas and new year's show. Really amazing and funny animation team good dancers. They made the vacation perfect. Thank you very much for the good times and memories.

Review_Date: Jacq cross wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I was so wary of visiting Marrakech as everyone was worrying me about dress code security etc but I didnt need to worry. From we arrived Yasmine explained everything was so friendly as where all the staff. The hotel itself is lovely decorated and kept very clean. Rooms are a basic room as in all all inclusive hotels but has a fridge. The weather was fabulous so sitting by the pool with the great entertainment staff was great and they were extraordinary. Food well it was wow best all inclusive food I've ever seen. Such a variety and so tasty. I would highly recommend this hotel and we will be going back same time next year
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rowan sabine wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I really enjoyed my holiday. The hotel is very clean and the people are so nice and friendly .. the entertainment was really good and suprising very professional and kind. especially the evening shows!! Naoufal mouki spider vitamine jiji farid hanan simo mehdi hala perscilla sania mamado. They made my holiday special. I would defintly come back. If you‚Äôre looking for a hotel in Marrakech I would recommend this one

Review_Date: Dee wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Title: Good value for money, relaxing experience
Review_Text: Grounds of the hotel were great. Pools and bars were clean and plenty of space. Heated pool was really enjoyable and lots of activities if you wished to partake.    Mainly suited for the quieter types looking for a break about 30 mins from the city. Shuttle bus available for 20MAD each way. (Watch out for taxi scams).    All of the animation team were friendly but Naoufal was brilliant. Constant smile on his face and making the effort to get to know everyone and showing new staff the ropes.    Wide variety of tasty food for all meals.    Room was ok similar to 3 star in Europe.    Overall lovely and relaxing few days in the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: nitrammcc wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Title: Nice Hotel for a short break
Review_Text: Spent 5 nights at Dar Atlas  it‚Äôs a good quality hotel about 25 mins from the M√©dina in Marrakesh food is reasonably good plenty of choices for breakfast lunch Dinner plenty of outside space with 3 pools and a indoor pool at the spabeer and wine were good but the spirits seemed a bit weak we were off season so it was not very busy music in the main bar at night and the staff have a variety of things going on during the day it‚Äôs mostly French speaking guests but the staff have a good grasp of English there is a shuttle bus into town every day for 10dirhams each way (80p ).  Quad bikes buggies and Camels to rent just a short walk from the hotel and plenty of trips can be booked at hotel rooms are very clean and spacious and cleaned every day.  This was an EasyJet holiday we booked last minute and it was well worth it
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: PL54 wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: OK I had read many of the reviews in advance of our recent trip - here are my observations following our family of 5's recent 3 night stay:    The food was good and plentiful and if my fussy 8 year old ate well then it must have been fine.    The primary language is French - which is not surprising as it is a primary language in Morocco. If you want an English speaking resort I suggest you go to Blackpool    Staff were generally good and keen to help - however anyone working in the bar beyond the age of 25 tries very hard to be as grumpy as possible.    The ATM wasn't working but the one in the neighbouring hotel was.    The Cashier / Bureau de Change had no change.    Rooms were clean and comfortable but probably not renovated since they were built so a little shabby. Shower cubicle especially needed a good overhaul.    Evening entertainment was fun but very amateur (and in French of course (see above)).    Grounds and pool area etc were pleasant and well maintained.    All inclusive drinks were fine - wine service in the (buffet) restaurant quite slow but we worked out how to serve ourselves :-)    Yasmine very helpful as highlighted everywhere else.    In overview - it is fine but not high end...we paid about ¬£35 per person per night for an all inclusive hotel so no complaints.

Review_Date: Elaine wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Plus points: Animation team Noufal Gigi Mouki Sania Fanied and Hela great fun thank you... Yasmine guest relations ALWAYS BRILLIANT...go to her if you need anything!! . Bar team and cafe bar team. Restaurant team were very helpful when you were nice back!!  2 beautiful outdoor pools 1 quiet and 1 with some music and activities. Heated pool in spa.  Some reception team fab some rude and dismissive. Don't give information freely unless you ask for something.  Great housekeeping department: old towels but clean every day. NO KETTLE IN ROOM.  SPA: fabulous...ask for a package deal Hamman and Massage...  Yes there are different coloured wrist bands green=French orange=English red=no idea maybe VIP?? Didn't make much difference to our service.  All inc: Whisky gin vodka red white or rose house wine and draught lager cocktails with previous ingredients...nothing else unless you want to pay.  Food good for everyone but mass produced and different theme every night...do not expect a la carte !!! All spoke French...but ask for anything and they will try and get it for you. Ran out of food and drinks sometimes. Food available all day.  Minus points: tired and dated...but you don't go to Marrakesh for neat pointing on tiles in your hotel!!!  The hotel needs a shake up!!!!... entertainment was laboured and not alot of enthusiasm from current animation teamunless you like ping pong!! but the new team will definitely bring fun and enjoyment to the resort. No information anywhere to tell you what's going on during the day for adults or children.

Review_Date: Dave H wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: Great family holiday thank you all
Review_Text: Myself wife 18 year old daughter and 10 year old son. The hotel is excellent rooms cleaned daily facilities brilliant. Many French visitors as mentioned on other reviews but we had no issues and must say they made every effort to be polite and courteous. Had no problems at bars or restaurants and got service has quick as the next man no matter what nationality they were. Night entertainment mostly French but we just laughed along and danced to everything. Fahd sang buble songs very well in English well done Fahd. Excellent entertainment team who encouraged everyone to join in during day and night. Most spoke excellent English. Najib at the pool bar was top man. Very pleasant and always at your service he's a credit to the hotel. Meals were very good with loads of choice for everyone and always well cooked. All in all a very enjoyable family holiday and I would say don't let poorer reviews put you off trying this excellent hotel

Review_Date: Janp wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: If you are considering hiring a car - DON‚ÄôT! We planned the route from airport to hotel & printed out a colour map... upon leaving the airport we realised there are no road numbers whatsoever! What road signs there are are mostly in Arabic & no road names are shown either. Suffice to say that it took 4 hours of nightmare driving conditions and 112 kilometres (over 70 miles) to actually find the hotel. The way the people drive here defy description & I cannot understand why there are no dead bodies littering the road - but they seem to manage getting from A to B in 1 piece...    As mentioned by others the hotel is off the beaten track per se but the staff are welcoming & try to accommodate your wishes (especially if you send them an email the week before - we requested first floor with afternoon sun on the balcony) & that‚Äôs what we got - grand! The food was plentiful & tasty & omelettes are good for breakfast but no sausages or beans... the rest of breakfast is a diabetic‚Äôs nightmare! Moroccan doughnuts pancakes honey & stuff like crunchy peanut butter - absolutely delicious! We were all inclusive so nothing else to pay unless you wanted branded spirits (the local gin etc. is 30% ABV) - the wine is local but very quaffable. Staff understand English so no language problems & its a refreshing change not to hear (sometimes) loud ‚ÄòBrits abroad‚Äô all around you - the French are much more quietly spoken.    We have had a great stay book and enjoy!

Review_Date: Alpay H wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Well after a rocky start with transfer s arived here a club dar atlas was met with a warm welcome we had to pay for a tax at reception along with safe payments only to find it not working hadt to ask 4 time to start our holiday had lunch which was good for buffet style the food was good drinks were ok at least it weret fake stuff local was ok however if you like branded drinks be prepared to pay the rooms are comphy enough clean at the most there is not much to do as your far away to the centre but they run shuttle service through out the day at a cost the bar staff and restaurant staff all are friendly a language can be a problem as they speak French not good at English ok for a short stay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: makhan83 wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: Not 4 star and don‚Äôt book all inclusive
Review_Text: Good points:  Some Staff is good and try to give best.  My mrs lost her hand beg and found in reception - a staff handed.  Good gardens view good shuttle bus to city.    Bad points:  This hotel is for french people - everyone speaks french and you need TO find person who knows English. All entertainment in french.  Not any good options in restaurant - restaurant staff eat food from the serving tray knowing that customers are watching.  Our whole family had diarrhoea.  Nothing around the hotel as it‚Äôs far from the city centre.  Don‚Äôt book all inclusive as when you out you have better eating options in the town.

Review_Date: gabe186470 wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: We came over the Halloween week for a four day stay noting this all-inclusive hotel had four stars.  The rooms here were basic no frills simple decor and clean and fresh with a small terrace through the patio door.  The bar and restaurant facilities were of a decent standard copious amounts of med-high quality food fresh hot and varied. Beef lamb and chicken were plentiful with rices pasta salads and breads.  Breakfast too was adequate with Moroccan pancakes and various omelettes being particularly tasty.  The beer wine and soft drinks were of a lower quality but an endless supply. The restaurant staff were so friendly often seating and bringing drinks to guests even though it was buffet service.  Entertainment was poor with little for adults with the hotel set almost in the wilderness it was a case of making do.  A band or a tribute act would have been welcome!  The worst aspect of the hotel was a busy reception desk with long queues. Nobody was available to advise or reserve excursions throughout our stay. No recommendations leaflets brochures nothing.  One member of staff who excelled was a ‚Äúsecurity guard‚Äù at the front door who went above and beyond his duties by organising taxis and even a camel ride!  We thank him for his friendliness and dedication.  The break was good value a reasonable hotel in a remote setting as for the surrounding areas it seemed like a war-torn region desolate and barren.  Think carefully before taking a trip into Marrakesh the town appeared to be full of chancers out to capitalise on the vulnerability of tourists.  I won‚Äôt return to Morocco it‚Äôs not developed enough but hey you decide!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gill wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Me and my 2 teenage children had a lovely few days here and will definitely return. The room was clean and comfortablethe pools were cold but ok once you were in. The food was excellent with plenty of choice. The staff were all friendly but Najib who worked at the pool bar was such a lovely man I will miss our chats! The slides are not at this hotel but the one next door and there is a charge to use them this was not clear when we booked. We went once and had a fun afternoon. The entertainment is purely in French but we we≈ïe prepared for this from reading the reviews and the animation team still tried to involve everyone but they weren't too in your face which was nice.

Review_Date: PBalix wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: We arrived late in the evening no food available and no drinks/coffee only if you pay for it! Our room was booked for 3 adult people. There was no pillow & towels for my special needs son we asked twice at the desk that evening they arrived midday the day after! I had to ask to use the safe in the room and have it opened nor were told there was a cost. However on checking out we were asked to pay for use of the safe this was a guy who had perfect linguistic skills at arrival in the evening and played dumb when charging us! This is billed as an all inclusive hotel - really! The allergen advice required you first to know what dish you were about to consume it was all in French and in very small writing high up on the wall impossible to read! Food was therefore somewhat restricted even upon asking what was it called we merely was given a shrug of the shoulder. Drinks and instant coffee in the bar only free until 23:00 hrs and then only served in very small glasses necessitating several trips to the bar for even an equivalent pint of beer. The glasses were merely rinsed in running water then reused no regard for hygiene at all. The pool towels were stained. There was a nice looking restaurant towards the far side of the complex with a nice quiet pool however drinks and food had to be purchased at ALL times!! The grounds were nice and reasonably well kept but we left our 6 night holiday having experienced our worst ever all inclusive stay in a hotel anywhere in the world!

Review_Date: Antony N R wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Lovely hotel and very relaxing. Staff are very friendly and approachable. Food is not to bad breakfast and lunch are the the best. Would recommend if you just want to relax as it's a 30 min taxi journey to the shops

Review_Date: bigfaz wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: A Great Place to Stay & doughnuts for brekkie
Review_Text: Ok so the negatives first of which there are very few. This is more a European 3 star property to be honest. The room.s Re a little bit tired. However they are cleaned every day and the showers are amazing proper power showers. The Air con works fine and for the footy fans you will get premier league games on a sunday afternoon in your room. Yes the clientele are mainly French and contrary to what I read in other reviews they are not given any preferential treatment at all. The food is great and there is something for everyone breakfast is of the continental type but you can get fresh omelettesfried & boiled eggs. Try the beigneuts (doughnuts) yes doughnuts for breakfast AMAZING!!!! Loved my holiday here even brushed up on my schoolboy French. Give it a go you wont be disappointed
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Saltwater106 wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Cannot fault this hotel stunning location food good variety and excellent standard drinks and snack bar great friendly staff yes it is French mostly but Morocco is a French speaking country so you just get ion with it and try and interact with other cultures and languages but already planning to return next year
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Infa5 wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: We visited this hotel in April and I must say it was such a lovely peaceful atmosphere with beautiful roses and oranges trees! The hospitality was great as well! Esp at the reception always there to receive you a smile! Special thanks to Jasmine! She was so kind!! Loved the food buffet had theme everyday so we got to taste the variety of food! Rooms were very clean and tidy with daily cleaning on time! Entertainment was nice with pool side always buzzing with music and Zumba!! They had great sports activities for the kids poolside table tennis a tennis and badminton court! Great stay and would easily recommend this hotel to my friends!!

Review_Date: elaineo2 wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: We arrived 14/10/19 and checked in and was told the room would be ready at 1pm all well and good it was 11.45am We went to the bar for a drink and went back at 1.20pm to reception and got our key. Went to the room and it wasn't ready! Hadn't been cleaned etc so i rang the reception and was told to go eat and it will be sorted which in all fairness it was a few hours later. This is a French themed hotel if you ain't french you ain't there! And the rows between staff in front of guests were unreal! You don't need speak French to understand what F off means! Total disregard for others and for their staff. I will never go there again it has good points but the bad points outweigh! as for the food?? bring your own i say!

Review_Date: alison k wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: We got back this morning at 1am. What a great hoilday we had. The hotel was amazing the room was good spacious and cleaned everyday thank you. The hotel was beautiful clean and had a feeling being spacious never over busy. Okay as previous reviews state it can be french orientated. However overall I didn't like it was all about the french. We met some lovely french visitors and yes the karaoke was mainly in french but it didnt spoilt it. The animation team (the guys) where great. The animations girls not so friendly and would only include the french and speak in french. Yasmin is a little star should a sweet soul and no one had a bad word to say about her. She helpful but professional. My partner's favourite was the swimming pool area bartender Najib he had a chat with him each day. We went in trips every other day and loved the country the people and hotel. Thank you for a great hoilday
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Simon C wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Two English couples on a 5 day break.  Don‚Äôt listen to all the bad reviews. Yes it‚Äôs a little tired in places and the music by the main pool is at times very loud however the food was great staff friendly and helpful and the location is ideal at just 20 mins from the centre.  They speak mainly French but hey your on holiday in a French speaking country not Margate!  There is a quiet pool ideal if you want to soak up the sun with plenty of sun beds.  Drinks are the norm for an all inclusive but again don‚Äôt expected gold plated when not paying for it.  Rooms were clean with good air con. Room safe was a Euro a day which doesn‚Äôt break the bank.... or safe!  Overall a great hotel for the price.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Pel1n wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Had some little worries after reading some reviews about this place however I needn‚Äôt have worried at all!    Firstly transfer from Menara airport is about 30 mins or so so not bad.  We arrived at the hotel around 1130 am and check in is not until 2pm but this was not a problem. We were offered somewhere to leave our cases and told our room would be ready in half and hour which is was!    Rooms are clean and well kept. We were on ground floor in a standard double and had our own little terrace. Our room did not have a kettle iron ironing board or hair dryer. Not sure if the upgraded room options do or not.    The food in this hotel is buffet/ carvery style and is amazing! Everything is being cooked fresh at each sitting right infront of you. Breakfast is pastries fruit eggs and omelette station. Lunch and dinner have a huge variety of meat and veggie options large salad bar and dessert station.    Hotel has 3 pools- a big one where all the entertainment takes place. A baby pool and an adult only pool which is really really quiet!    Had a massage in the spa which was really good. Paid about 460dirham for an hour.    The hotel has a couple of little gift shops connected to it BUT from what we could see there was no where to buy snacks etc if you like to have that type of thing in your room. So if you do I would advise to take them with you. We did and we‚Äôre glad we did!    We took the shuttle to the Souks which was 20dirham each way. However we got a taxi back which we paid about 100 dirham for. Souks were just what we expected lots of gifts souvenirs Argan oil etc. There are restaurants and cafes around too.    The animation team work alllll day long to keep guests happy and entertained. It‚Äôs true that they mostly speak French but they made an effort to include the English guest and explain what was going on. Their evening Caberet shows are easy to follow and fun.    Would defo recommend this place! Can‚Äôt wait to go back again.

Review_Date: Philip D wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: A quick dash to Morocco with friends
Review_Text: We arrived very late to find the waiting car and sped of into the night. A desert trip that took longer than expected as the driver realised he didn't know to which hotel he should take us.  In the early hours he deposited us at the hotel and left.  We then discovered that were at the wrong hotel.A golf buggy was called up and we eventually arrived at Dar Atlas.    Lets start with the plus side. The grounds and walkways are enchanting.The food is varied and suits many tastes but is mass catering in a large dinning hall. Best to sit outside.  Although all-in the bar regularly has no beer or bottled beers available and the wine is either redwhite or rose.  The hotel is popular with our gallic friends so brush up on your french.  Sometimes the hotel staff are very helpfull and at other times not.  The bedrooms are basic and you have to pay for the safe. The mini bar is not stocked.  Taxis to the airport and the city vary between 2/300 dhams but will take ¬£$ and euros

Review_Date: Adrian B wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: A terrific place - one we couldn't recommend more highly!
Review_Text: We returned last week from a 4-night honeymoon stay at the Club Dar Atlas just outside Marrakech. It was certainly an eventful trip! We arrived after a 2000 mile journey to discover that our booking had been cancelled a week earlier without our knowledge. It turned out that our holiday company had been a wholly owned subsidiary of Thomas Cook and had consequently ceased trading at the same time as the main company. The holiday company that had taken on Cook's obligations hadn't got round to telling us about the cancellation. Nevertheless the hotel itself proved to be exceptionally sympathetic and understanding. - particularly their Guest Services Manager Yasmine. I had to pay again to secure some rooms but we were given upgraded accommodation in the Tizi N Tichka villa block which was really a quadruple apartment with two balconies. The hotel grounds were extensive and extremely pretty. There were two outdoor pools poolside bars and a spa. In addition there were many acres of well kept grounds with a large pond wildlife palm trees and vast amounts of blooming hibiscus flowers of all colours along the estate perimeters. We stayed on an all-inclusive basis and breakfasts lunches and dinners were all uniformly excellent. Food was served on a self-service carvery basis in a large sunlit hall.
