There was plenty of choice on all occasions and menus offered reflected a wide range of different tastes. - Not the place if you wanted frequent burger and chips but just the ticket if you enjoyed experimenting with well cooked tagines fresh salads fish and chicken etc. The clientele were predominantly French with a smattering of Dutch German British and other nationalities present. A few of the staff were reasonably fluent in English but French was the main language of communication. We got by without any problems using our basic school standard French supplemented with the odd learned word of Arabic (which caused some amusement). The entertainment provided outdoors in the evening was varied of a good standard and also delivered in French. Given the fact that Morocco was part of the French African empire until the 1950's it's not surprising that French is such a dominant language in the country. Without exception all the staff whether entertainers working for 'Club Lookea' bar staff caterers management receptionists or domestics were courteous and eager to help. In short the hotel is a terrific place - one we couldn't recommend more highly.

Review_Date: Sgt2007 wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Stayed here for 4 nights the pool area is the only part of the hotel that‚Äôs ok!  ‚ñ™Ô∏èThe rooms are in very poor condition we had to use towels to stop the water from the shower area or the bathroom would be flooding when taking a shower  ‚ñ™Ô∏èeven though we were a room with 3 beds we only got 2 sets of towels I asked for a third set 3 times but didn‚Äôt get any I had to use my pool towel instead!  ‚ñ™Ô∏èour door and door frame to our room fell out of the wall ( not great for security!) we finally got someone to look at it at midnight but it still wasn‚Äôt secure!  ‚ñ™Ô∏èthe general cleanliness of the room wasn‚Äôt great I don‚Äôt even think the balcony was cleaned at all  ‚ñ™Ô∏èdoor to the balcony didn‚Äôt lock  ‚ñ™Ô∏èthe safe was loose too could easily of been taken away    ‚ñ™Ô∏èoverall I‚Äôd say this hotel isn‚Äôt a 4 star but maybe just about a 3 star

Review_Date: needabreak wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Firstly yes it's mainly french so if you have a problem with them stay away  Secondly please ignore the bad reviews god knows what some people expect.  The hotel is set in lovely grounds and pool is a great size with ample sunbeds and never a problem getting one.  The food was lovely and catered for all tastes unless you like to live on a McDonald's diet. Food is available from 7.30am till 10pm so you wont go hungry.  As said before on here Yasmine in the reception area is a great help ( only needed her once ) to call our transfer to airport home and Najib in the pool bar is a credit to the hotel.  The bar staff in the Atlas bar arnt the most expressive when it comes to smiles and politeness but that's just a small niggle.  All in all a fantastic weeks holiday in unbelievable weather ( they had a heatwave ) temp got up to 44¬∞ and I wouldn't hesitate to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Poppy P wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: fantastic place  had a few hiccups checking in but not hotels fault  rooms lovely and clean maids were fantastic came and sprayed room with mosquito repellent ( that's my only issue I got bitten to hell) food was fantastic lots of variety and very well presented and staff lovely too pool was great comfy sunbeds that where widely available plus towels if needed as for pool bar fantastic big shout out to our lovely friend Najib what a fella he looked after us all week  all in all the people we met on this fantastic holiday where absolutely amazing apart from Siad in the main bar watch out for him he is not the the nicest person and was noted by several other people apparently he favoured the Frenchwhich yes its mainly dominated by French but hey ho it didn't bother us and we got by with the language barrier  anyone reading this just book its fantastic and booking again ourselves

Review_Date: LMS wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: Average hotel - very french and cleaners steal from your room....
Review_Text: On our first day we went down to request for the safe in our room and go down for breakfast. We were out of our room for a maximum for around 25 minutes and returned to find some money had been taken from the room. We went and reported this to Yasmin as she is only one in the hotel that speaks really good English. Their processes around this are particularly strange including having 4 security staff search the room asked to identify who took the money (despite not knowing) and requesting we go with them whilst they search the cleaners and their lockers which we refused as it seemed particularly invasive. This was never resolved and the staff made no mention of this again.  Although Yasmin told us they had never had issues with theft before whilst walking around we heard her tell a further 3 people that this had never happened before  The entertainment every day around the pool and in the evening at the bar areawas all in French and we couldn‚Äôt understand any of it. There were 2 female entertainers who would point blank refuse to speak to anybody that was English there.  Every night we were there the beer ran out at the bar at 9:30pm - Which is quite annoying when all you drink is beer and not spirits.  The swimming pool was fine and we always managed to get a sunbed at any time that we went down there.  Overall we wont be returning for the main reasons of it being a very French hotel we had money stolen from us on our first day and the beer ran out every single night

Review_Date: Mark B wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: Categorising guests and treating them differently - its 2019??
Review_Text: In general this was a nice holiday amazing weather and a nicely laid out resort with a huge swimming pool.    What really put us off apart from the bland and tasteless food was the bizarre and unnecessary wristband system:    French guests: Green  English guests: Beige  All other countries: Red    This seems ludicrous to us as why would any holiday resort make such a clear and blatant separation of their guests.    Well the answer to this became more clear as the holiday went on when extremely rude and sometimes aggressive bar staff ignored those without green wristbands . Additionally a guest without a green wristband is allowed to leave the restaurant with the remainder of their 1/2 bottle of wine but if anyone else does it you have two staff members almost rugby tackle you to the ground!    This review is in no way directed at the other guests - purely the staffs treatment of guests being completely inconsistent and inequitable. Just because it is a French speaking country there is no call to be rude or dismissive of guests from other countries.    Also just to add if you are going for a week or two prepare to go hungry for most of your holiday as the all inclusive food just becomes more and more inedible as the days go on. Even when trying to book the restaurant where you pay for better food the response was 'sorry its fully booked for important French guests'. Charming - are we not all important guests!?    We would return to Marrakesh but certainly not to this resort.

Review_Date: Ola wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: I honestly don't think a resort could be much better than this one! We have received a warm welcome from the team and wonderful Yasmin who explained everything to us in fluent English and we have been taken to our spacious bright and air-conditioned room with balcony and stunning tropical view.    Room was very well maintained by amazing houskeeping team throughout the 7 night stay. On the occasion they run out of towels in the morning they didn't forget about the replacement later on. Very discreet quick and thorough.    We were located quite far away from the main lobby but it turned out to be a brilliant location. Only a few steps away from adult only pool and restaurant with another great team.    Biggest praise goes to the main bar crew. What those guys are doing is absolutely amazing. The volume of customers (not always polite) they have to serve during peak times is unbelievable but they carry on with smiles on their faces. Mohamed who I think is the bar manager made our stay an absolute delight. Everyone there spoke at least communicative English and we haven't for a second felt like we're a second class guests. I think the key here is to treat the staff kindly and they will give it back 200% - no matter what language you speak.    Same with entertainment - as soon as they've realised we don't speak French they were translating everything into English for us. My favourite part was an Arabic lesson with Karim who was juggling those 3 languages like a pro! I wonder how many languages all the complainers can speak?    The only tiny downside is reception who seem to be understaffed at most times but they are doing a wonderful job under a lot of pressure. Just take into account that you might have to queue for a few minutes (sometimes a few more as some of the guest don't understand a concept of a queue and just walk straight to the desk but whose fault is that?)    Overall I would recommend this place to everyone who want to relax and have a good time on their holiday. Staff will go above and beyond to make it happen. We will definitely be back for the unique vibe people and the best weather!

Review_Date: LeviaBuncle wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Visiting this hotel with three other friends there is a lot to like. For those who like to weigh up their options I will do a PROS and CONS of this hotel as there are both:    PROS:    - The hotel is beautiful and very well maintained. The reception looks like something from a palace the pool area is immaculate and the gardens and scenery around the riad style rooms are pretty and tended to often.  - The bar staff on the whole are very friendly. Special mention to Najib on the pool bar. He made a special effort to welcome us on our first day and continued to remember us and our orders for the nine days we were there. There was a young glass collector also whose name was particularly difficult to remember who was also very friendly (he usually wears a white shirt and smart pants)  - The male entertainment staff were all very inclusive of guests. (Special mention to Fahd) They would go above and beyond to speak to guests. They would even occasionally join them for dinner and make them feel welcome.  - The food is above average to excellent at all times. There is always a nice range of options and even if something wasn‚Äôt to taste it was never due to poor quality but more just personal taste. They have different themes through the week ranging from Mexican to Moroccan to World Buffet.  - The rooms are basic but comfortable. Nothing out of this world but they are clean and you will feel cosy whilst there.  - The Quad biking offered by the hotel was incredible and a must do! We opted for the hour long session but we got more than our money‚Äôs with being brought along desert roads and out into the dunes to see Moroccan nature at its finest!  - Both Pools were spacious and fun! The larger pool occasionally features games such as water polo and there always feels like there is enough space for everybody.  - there is always food available even between lunch and dinner service in the main canteen due to the snack bar.  - There is a small pool full of cute terrapins just outside the hotel where we were allowed to bring small pieces of food to feed them.  - journey to the centre markets is a simple 25 minute journey and easily arranged at the reception.  - Henna is much cheaper at the small stall in the hotel than at the markets. It is a small table near the pool bar easily missed but it is there.  - don‚Äôt forget to tip the staff they really do look after you.    CONS    - We had an awful time when dealing with some reception staff. We were slapped with a tourist tax that we had not been informed of beforehand and the two members of staff that dealt with us Soufiane and Hanan were not helpful in the slightest. Soufiane did not even tell us the most basic of information at check in such as times for dinner and was more concerned with dealing with his colleagues issues than checking us in and Hanan stood there with nothing but a blank expression and a pen in her hand ignoring us. The rest of the reception staff were great but our multiple negative experiences with these two tarnished the credibility of that team.  - You should come to the pool early if you want a sun lounger as there is not an over abundance of themespecially if you are In a group.  - There are a large amount wasps near the bushes/bar at the pools. Obviously that‚Äôs beyond the hotels control but just heads up.  - All entertainment is completely in French there was not a single event hosted in the slightest of English. Whilst that is fine for some people and not always a problem for everyone it may be something to bear in mind if entertainment in English is important to you.  - It became a running joke between several guests seperate to us that you would only receive quick treatment from certain members of the night bar if you were wearing a red wrist band that signifies your nationality. Might not be true but it‚Äôs hard to ignore with what we witnessed.  - Some of the entertainment team namely the women were not the most welcoming unless you spoke French. Again not an issue if they cannot speak english but they could and would ignore us the moment we said we didn‚Äôt speak French. Made us feel a little uncomfortable.  - The hotel next door is connected to this one somehow and contains a small water park which is fun. However don‚Äôt expect the reception staff to give you directions on where to go. They seemed just as confused as y and what should have taken us 5 minutes to walk took us about 30 due to misdirections from staff.  - music at poolside would be fine but they turn it off after half a song and then don‚Äôt play it again for 30 minutes and then rinse and repeat. Just leave the off or on one or the other.    We enjoyed the stay overall and it was worth the price we paid. Not major complaints but more just things to be aware of.    Club Dar Atlas is worth a visit.

Review_Date: Climber526360 wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: The place is lovely grounds are well kept the rooms are basic but clean (no cupboards for clothes )small wardrobe and 2 shelves the down side of this hotel was ONE person spoke English and if she was not there we had trouble getting anyone to understand us all information is in French all the entertainment is in French the welcome meeting is in French everything is geared for the French speaking guest we arrived at 10.30 at night and they was not expecting us we paid the tax and was told they had no change to give us we was give a room key and was told to go through a door we could not find out room and it was a security guard who help us  The cleaning staff came into the room at 9.30 am to change towels even if you asked them not too very annoying the food was excellent something for everyone. Shuttle bus to Marrakech was roughly ¬£4 return each

Review_Date: Cha wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: So my sister and I arrived on a Thursday and was given our room keys they explained that our room wasn‚Äôt ready but we could go in and change into our swimwear which we did and it didn‚Äôt really bother us the room wasn‚Äôt made cause by the time we came back it was it was also cleaned everyday  The grounds is beautiful gardeners keeping it prestine and the cleaners are constantly working  The reception staff were very friendly and would go out their way to help especially Yasmine who went out her way to make sure me and my sisters were safe when we went out in evening from strange men posing as working for the hotel and gave us advice.  The only fault I had with the staff was the bar man in the evening called siad which I thought was rude when I asked if I could have a tray he‚Äôd just slam drinks down and was more enthusiastic about serving the French..but the pool bar staff were fantastic and very friendly and helped me learn Arabic.  The couple of things which I did have with the hotel was    1)the entertainment it was MAINLY catered for the French so didn‚Äôt really know what was going on...so they should have had someone explaining in French then repeating in English however the animation Fahd and I cant remember the other one name with longish hair really tried to bring you in to and explain in English and brought you in on games and the aqua but it was like a guessing game what they saying if they didn‚Äôt say..    2). that you couldn‚Äôt book excursions with hotel if you wasn‚Äôt French..    however we booked with via tour so if you stay there I would recommend the Atlas Mountains and quad biking they pick you and drop you back    So Feed back I‚Äôd give is more English translation in the entertainment and animation so we know what‚Äôs going on aswell  Cause I would love to go back with my children so they could join and understand    But had the best 4 days xx

Review_Date: DIANE L PAMMENT wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: myself and cousin stayed here for 10 days in september 2019 we didn`t arrive till early hours of morning but reception was very good they booked us in quickly gave us water and a drink and showed us to our room rooms was spacious and very clean and the air conditioning was great there is a very special lady and asset to the hotel Yasmin she speaks English and makes you feel so welcome and any problems she gets sorted straight away .our out side light was not working when we arrived spoke to yasmin in the morning by nightime there was light there is also fountains in the courtyard where the rooms are we asked why they were not working again went to pool when came back to room fountain working so cannot fault the facilities at all the food was good and every day was something different andplenty of choice for everyone only fault is the FRENCH THEY ARE RUDE FROM THE CHILDREN TO THE OLDER ADULTS THEY STILL THINK THEY OWN MARRAKESH they expect the STAFF TO CATER TO THEM FIIRST ABOVE ALL OTHER NATIONALITIESBUT THE STAFF LOVE THE BRITISH and we found even they DISLIKE THE FRENCH but have to be friendly but THEY ARE TRYING TO MAKE THE PART OF HOTEL WE STAYED IN BRITISH ONLY as there is 3 other complexes in the grounds  THE GROUNDS ARE LOVELY AND THEY HAVE GARDENERS WORKING EVERY DAY KEEPING THE LOVELY FLOWERS AND GREENERY IN GOOD CONDITION COULD NOT FAULT THE STAFF OR HOTEL WOULD GO AGAIN JUST TO SEE YASMIN AND NIJAM THE POOL BARMAN HE WAS SO FRIENDLY AND WILLING TO PLEASE AND TRIED TO REMEMBER EVERYONES NAME BLESS HIM TOTALLY HAD A FAB HOLIDAY DESPITE THE FRENCH (THEY WERE RUDE TO US NOT US TO THEM ) AND WOULD GO BACK TOMORROW IF COULD X

Review_Date: eardley_towers wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: On arrival we were greeted by Yasmin who spoke good English and was really helpful. The rooms were clean and towels changed every day. There was a lot of choice of food each day and was clearly labelled. The grounds were clean and well maintained. The only down side is that it is predominantly French and the entertainment was also all in French.

Review_Date: Kathryn W wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Not what we booked! But nice enough
Review_Text: A mums holiday for me and my friend.  Last minute get away no kids or husbands.  Excited to stay in the hotel in pictures.  Arrive at the Club Marmari Medina (the hotel we booked) and was told that we are the other ‚Äúonsite‚Äù hotel Das Atlas. No pictures on the booking site of this hotel. All we can say is that it obviously the poor relation. Not the 4*+ that week booked. Rooms very dated air con doesn‚Äôt work and the door to the ‚Äúpatio‚Äù which is more of a walk way is only kept locked by a hook and eye type latch.  Pool is absolutely freezing even though it‚Äôs 35deg heat.    Everything and I mean EVERYTHING is in French whilst the staff do try accommodate you but only when they realise that you are English.    We were told we can use both hotels as part of the all inclusive so on our second day have come over to take at look at where we booked to stay. It is by far better than Das Atlas. Disappointed that we aren‚Äôt in this hotel. Still everything is in French.    BEWARE WHEN BOOKING FOR CLUB MEDINA AS YOU WILL MORE THAN LIKELY GET DAS ATLAS INSTEAD

Review_Date: Historyhunter wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Really can't work out how anyone could leave a lousy review of this hotel.  The staff are amazing the grounds are beautiful and facilities excellent.  Yes it is very geared up for the french so you may have to dust off your O levels to communicate fully but even better learn a few Arabic phrases before you go. A simple 'Thank you' in the native tongue is really appreciated we found.  We had a couple of problems while we were there. A leaking air con and a dodgy door lock so we reported it at reception and the guy had fixed them before we made it back to the room! You can't ask for more that that surely?  Food was very tasty and quite varied. Certainly plentiful and the wifi signal was excellent in most parts of the hotel.  Security was incredible. The only thing that irked was the reception was always busy and you may have to queue. Maybe an extra person on there would hurry things along but you are on holiday. Who really cares?  Entertainment was possibly the best I've ever seen at a hotel. We had fun trying to understand the french but congratulating ourselves when we did. It was laugh.  Many thanks for an excellent stay on our first time in Morocco. Would certainly recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Review_Date: Colin H wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Would never stay at the Dar Atlas again nothing was in English gave me the wrong envelope at reception bed linen wasn't changed in the 14 nights we were there the evening entertainment EVERY night Kiddie's Disco ( all in French) whilst the staff on an evening went round the tables never came to ours! (Cos we weren't French) food was mediocre chipped cups plates and bowls sent out being a chef I know what I'm talking about lunch & dinner was chaotic they should have two sittings instead of every one piling in at once! Excursion notices and all information even the fire escape routes all in French!! And it certainly wasn't ALL inclusive some of the drinks had to be paid for have stayed in Turkey all inclusive absolutely brilliant Never go there again!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sabella84 wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: great hotel nice staff. security was at its best. the only negative is that 90% of guests spoke French and the same also with the staff so it is not easy to communicate and make friends when you cannot speak French. I got in touch with zackaria at the front desk from the first night we arrived. and until we left home. he was very good at english and very helpful with everything i was wondering. he made my holiday so enjoyable and understanding. had he not been it would have been difficult to communicate. Jasmine was very nice when I was wondering something. but had little contact with her. the food was very good and so much to choose from. thank you very much for a nice holiday

Review_Date: Tarantella wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: Dar Atlas is not as good as it is promoted to be
Review_Text: I visited Dar Atlas club this August (2019). Before visiting I read a mixture of reviews about the venue. Most were positive. Having spent time there below are my observations.    Staff ‚Äì Very friendly especially Yazmin in Guest relations Zakaria in Entertainment and Jamal in the restaurant.    Facilities ‚Äì Outdated deco. No wash basins in toilets. Rather casual and open grit in terms of wall tile to wall. Also Very old linen in rooms. For shower gel and shampoo you are provided a wall squeeze detergent which is the same as washing your dirty hands.    Facilities management ‚Äì Arrived to dirty linen in the room from bed sheets to shower matt. (Bed sheets had brown stains) Plus it takes a whole day to turn around a clean room!    All Inclusive - does not mean what it says on the tin. You pay a premium for it however it is certainly NOT all inclusive and Club Atlas does not let potential guests know about the hidden charges!    That‚Äôs my honest feedback.

Review_Date: Sara wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: Amazing family holiday, everything you need.
Review_Text: My two children and I just got back from The Dar Atlas hotel Marrakech for a 7 night stay. The hotel was amazing. On arrival we were made to feel very welcome by friendly staff and were provided welcome drinks and taken to our rooms.    We met Yassmine the guest relations manager on the second day and‚Ä¶ Honestly? She is an absolute hidden gem a true asset to the hotel. Yassmine was great always on hand to help and ensured everything was comfortable for our stay both of my children still talk about how lovely and kind Yassmine was (and is) and how she treated everyone with a warm smile and an open hand to help with anything we needed. Yassmine did this not only with us but with every guest she came into contact with (and she showed a genuine great interest into helping everyone).    All the staff are trained to a very high standard delivery exceptional customer service that includes from the catering staff the maids (Mariam in particular) the photographer (Osman I hope I spelt it correctly) security and not forgetting the gardeners for giving such beautiful views of the complex and make us feel the absolute pleasure to be surrounded nature.    The meals were absolutely fantastic with an array of choices. A special thank you to Zakariya and Zouhair and all the restaurant (catering staff) to the spa staff (Jamila and Amal) for always smiling and delivering exceptional customer service throughout our trip (my children and I are truly missing the meals).  Overall Yasmine was faultless what a gem she is and without a doubt she‚Äôs an absolute credit to the hotel. I have gained a new friend captured many lovely memories and had an amazing experience through this stay. A big thank you to all at Dar Atlas we will certainly be coming back for more. See you all again in the near future.

Review_Date: Zoe Green wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: I just got back from Morocco and stayed in Club Dar Atlas and I must say that it is such a beautiful place to stay it is comfortable The staff are wonderful especially Yasmin and zakari we had a few problems with our son and they helped massively the nurse was amazing... all the staff was great they had amazing entertainment and the lookie was great with kids the pools are great and you can get a shuttle into town for a few dirham.. it‚Äôs a beautiful set up with lovely flowers and scenery. All staff made you feel welcome and the bars are wonderful. Would recommended this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in Marrakech!! Thank you To everyone there...

Review_Date: Ghulam zahra wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Me and my husband stayed at club dar for 5 nights  loved the hotel and the people there soo much especially yasmin at front desk she was super helpful in every way possible. Entertainment every night  perfect for kids  families and couples. Food was good  they had alot of options to choose from. A little far from city but perfect if you want a quite relaxing holiday. They have shuttle bus available for ¬£2 each way which is super cheap. Will definitely visit again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mahelau92 wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: Has everything you need, just a few niggles
Review_Text: I can honestly say that this was a lovely hotel. The only thing is that if you don't speak french it is quite difficult as 90% of guests are french most of the tours are run in french and the entertainment is all in french.  The food was themed and reasonably varied. There were better days than others but there was always the western staples (pizza and chips!)  For the majority the staff were amazing and very welcoming they tried to talk to us as much as possible bearing in mind that my mum doesn't speak french. The entertainment crew were lively and upbeat the catering staff were always lovely and polite and of course Yasmine who was faultless! The only staff that let them down were the cleaners who didn't actually clean our room any day we were there they just put the top sheet back over without straightening anything; there was also the receptionist on our last day. He was very late and we waited 15 minutes for him to arrive so we could check out not even a sorry from him. There was also 2 barmen which ruined it a little bit with their attitudes but they can be overlooked.  You are also 10km from the city and souks so there is nowhere to go outside of the hotel which can be a bit isolating but means that it is a bit quieter

Review_Date: Tillee91 wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: On arrival to the hotel we was welcomed to super friendly staff provided us with lovely welcome drinks had to wait about 30 mins for our room to be ready which wasn‚Äôt a problem as we just got changed in the toilets and sat down and took in the beautiful surroundings of the hotel. Yasmine was the first member of staff we spoke to properly she greeted us and gave us all the info we needed and then showed us to our room. The rooms are modern and very very clean great shower too. There is a safe which costs 70 dirham for the week which is approx ¬£7. The weather was absolutely beautiful all week. Pool is massive and there are plenty of sun beds. There‚Äôs music on all day at the main pool or you can walk down to the quiet pool if you want some peace and quiet. The food was outstanding! Every single day there was plenty of food options with beautiful meats such as lamb beef chicken and turkey. All cooked to perfection. Plenty of selection on other foods too so there‚Äôs always something for everyone! Different theme every night also. All inclusive drinks are good they aren‚Äôt small measures either! The only lager they have is Flag speciale which is alright. Most of the staff are french but they do try their very best to speak English etc... and do try to make you feel involved in the activities and entertainment. Yasmine and Zakaria are an absolute asset to the hotel! They go above and beyond to help you and make you feel comfortable. All problems are solved quickly.  There is a shuttle bus often every day to get to the souks and the medina which is about ¬£2 each way and it takes about 30 mins to get there.  We also had a full body massage at the spa during our stay which was lovely felt so refreshed and relaxed after it so that‚Äôs well worth a go!  Overall we were super happy with our holiday here at Club Dar Atlas the hotel is BEAUTIFUL the staff are AMAZING! Food is beautiful just everything about the hotel is perfect!  Thank you to all the staff at club dar Atlas for an amazing holiday!

Review_Date: Paradise479731 wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Well we're do I startthis hotel and staff are amazingme and my son John stayed here for 10 nightswe were meet by Yasminethis lady is the bestwas so kindhelp us with everything we neededthe room was very clean and stunningthe cleaning ladies do a great jobthe bar staff was greatwe were never ignored like some English have saidthe entertainment guys are greatvery funny and made our stay very welcomethe food was amazingthe guard on front of hotel help us with travel in to cityzac and the team we miss you so muchwe meet so English people out therehad a great time with thema and jyou know who you arejust want the English to go here as truly amazing place and stafflove and miss you so muchDonna and Johnxxx we are coming backsee you all soon xxxxxx

Review_Date: John Hyde wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: After booking this hotel we got a great deal for ¬£1000 for 2 people for 10 nights when arriving at the hotel 90% of other guest's were French me and my partner thought we would never meet any other people this was far from the case yes there must of only been about 7 or 8 other English couples or groups in our stay but we all got talking and had a great laugh. This hotel is super clean with nice food I'm vegan and had plenty of choice with many veg based dishes most desserts were out of bounds for me but my partner said they were to die for. The staff are super friendly we were met by Yassmin on are arrival who looked after us through out are stay nothing was to much trouble from sorting extra coat hangers to excursions Abbelilah on our evening meals really attended to all our needs he was super friendly and made us laugh. We owe a big thank you to Zakaria who brought all the English people together also was super friendly and would put him self out to help any one if it wasn't for Zakaria I don't think our holiday wouldn't of been such a laugh would I stay here again definitely at the price we paid loved the holiday the hotel the staff and met some really nice people also check out the Zen restaurant in the other hotel lovely food for a change from the all inclusive food
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Magdanm wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Yasmine Markaoui (the guest service staff) was lovely and made our stay fantastic! Thank you!  The hotel was nice & clean staff friendly and food really good.  Entertainment nice.  Could recommend the hotel for families.

Review_Date: Alex C wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: Don't be put off by poo reviews from English People. THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!
Review_Text: So like anyone we read reviews of hotels before going for them - I lost count of how many we read but we found Club Dar Atlas had a lot of good reviews but also some poor ones with poor experiences.    I am pleased to say that you need to ignore all of the poor reviews the people who talk about the fact "no on speaks English" and the ones who moan about the restaurant. They're all wrong!(in my opinion)    When we arrived we were greeted by Yasmine who was very welcoming spoke great English and was just in general a pleasure to deal with this continued throughout the week - we always knew that Yasmine would be happy to help if we had anything we needed! Yasmine is part of the guest relation team.    The brings me nicely onto Zakaria from Guest Relations - WHAT A GUY this man is a legend in the game and is a must meet if you go to Marrakesh. SO SO welcoming to us all and I saw him more as a friend as opposed to a member of staff even half way through the holiday!(Although he always handled himself professionally) He wanted to make us feel welcome and he really did I look forward to continuing talking with him and seeing him next time I am in Morocco!    The entertainment team are fantastic so much enthusiasm from all of them at ANY point of the day or night! The majority of the team could speak English and those that did not or didn't speak much wanted to learn which we found so nice - we were more than happy to help them learn!    Big shout out to Zak Karim Fahd Leila & Cloe from the entertainment team - these guys as I've just mentioned are awesome people always up for a laugh and a joke and just friendly people in general.    The main man has to be Abdel from the entertainment team we met him on the first day of the holiday and never looked back from there Abdel has an amazing way of engaging people and is definitely one to keep hold of! We cannot wait to come back next year and see the whole of the entertainment team again they really did make the holiday!    We will all look to keep in contact with them all on social media's because as I have mentioned we did not see them as "the entertainment team" they were more than that.    So if you want a lovely quiet hotel for your stay with great food plenty of drinks(shout out all the bar staff) a good pool and plenty of stuff going on then Club Dar Atlas is the one for you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chelsie White wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: DO NOT BE DISHEARTENED BY THE NEGATIVE ENGLISH REVIEWS.    I have just returned from a 9 night stay at the Club Dar Atlas with my partner and another couple. We had a truly amazing experience in this hotel and everyone deserves to hear this!    On arrival we were greeted by Yasmine who explained how the meals worked at the hotel took us to our rooms and helped us sort out a safe and unlock the door dividing our two rooms. The rooms are dated yes but they are kept clean daily by the maids and we had our bedsheets changed regularly. The maids would also change our towels everyday for us. People will always find something to moan about but the rooms were clean and the balcony was lovely too as we were on the top floor so we really had no complaints! The bathroom is separate to the toilet but it isn‚Äôt an issue if anything it‚Äôs more useful. The rooms are dimly lit but in a place like Marrakech you don‚Äôt want to be in the rooms all the time! The TV worked fine however there is limited English channels if you are wanting to watch Television in the evenings or at night etc. Overall the rooms were everything we needed.    When we were at dinner / down by the poolside we were greeted by Abdel. He is one of the animation team who is so lovely and went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. Everyday he would come and speak to us testing out his English as well as helping us with some of the French signs etc. He would always come over and give us a high five or a handshake and ask how we were and so on which really made us feel welcome. The hotel is predominantly French but many of the staff will go out of their way to try and have a conversation with you and make you feel included in the holiday atmosphere.    We then met Zakaria from guest relations he is also superb. He would sit with us most nights and get involved in our conversations we were able to learn some Arabic from him as well as get some guidance for going to the Market and going out on the Quads and Buggies in the desert! (Two phenomenal experiences that I would recommend). He was incredibly welcoming and really made our stay amazing and we cannot thank him enough for his continuous work in making us all happy.    We also had many conversations with other members of the animation team: Zakaria E Fahd Leila and Marine. Zak and Fahd were lovely welcoming and would come and join us for conversation and chilling by the poolside as well as at the bar in the evenings which made us feel so welcome and involved. A lot of the time they would get us up dancing with them and also go to the on site nightclub with us! They made it known there was always something to do with the animation team and entertainment.    The entertainment in the evenings was always enjoyable despite being in French it was easy to understand what was happening. When we were unsure we would ask either Zakaria A or Abdel and they were happy to explain to us what was happening in the evenings.    The food was impeccable. There was always something to pick and a wide variety of vegetarian option as well as meat based options! The food on Moroccan night was so inspiring to the point we decided to make our own version of the couscous offered that night! The drinks were as an all inclusive is being local spirits and from 10am -11pm. People in these reviews tend to expect much more than what they are paying for. The bar staff are fast with their service and we soon learnt with giving them respect and not being rude like others were at the hotel they would pay the same respect back and enjoy getting our drinks/ having conversations.    The team are keen to make your stay as incredible as it can be; with various activities throughout the day as well as in the evenings. They were very included in our daily activities as well as in the evenings. Abdel Zak A and E Fahd and Yasmine were always attentive to our needs and were beyond welcoming and made us really feel like we could go back again.    Getting sun-beds in the morning was easy and we had no issues finding any or umbrellas for when the heat was becoming more unbearable. There was no fight for any apparatus and the lifeguards would come and help you find any items you might need when there. We used inflatables in the pool which made our time a bit more fun.    The WiFi is surprisingly good for the hotel being out the way of the city and it being free but at 100DH a taxi to the market we didn‚Äôt see this as a problem. We also paid for a safe in the room that worked every day perfectly.    The only downside I have about the hotel is one day we misplaced my bracelet and it never returned in the room. We spoke to the reception and they did what they could to find it but to no effect. It was a shame as this was a very sentimental piece of jewellery for me. Whether the maids had consciously or unconsciously taken it I am in no way blaming them as we don‚Äôt know what happened either.    I would really like to say thank you to Zak A Abdel Zak E Fahd and Yasmine for their continued interest in our stay and the welcome they gave us! This is definitely a place we would return to (especially to see Abdel and the team).    Overall a really great and enjoyable stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: pegahdogaheh wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: I just want to firstly say that the staff were incredible especially Yasmine Yassine and the security guards. They were very helpful and made sure we felt welcomed and above all safe. I have no issues whatsoever with the staff.    My issue is with the actual hotel and the way it was run.  - Firstly it is not a hotel; its a riad. Meaning the rooms are much more older the toilet and showers were separate with no windows or air vents. There was ONE light in the entire room so you can imagine how dim it was and it was generally just quite old.  - Although the room was cleaned every day we noticed the bedsheets weren't changed daily. I had been sick and they didn't change the sheets until I had asked. When I did ask on the third time they sent someone up. They didn't have spare sheets so they took the entire duvet and instead gave us an old blanket. They didn't come to change or replace this and give back a proper duvet.  - We had paid for a safe to be used during our stay and again no one had come up to fix this.  - The entire entertainment was in French. Nothing was done in English or Arabic but only in French. Their excursions are also with French guides. It became very annoying as we couldn't get involved in the shows or entertainment. Don't expect anything to be done in English.  - We paid for all inclusive however there are a lot of hidden costs. You have to pay for the shuttle bus after 11pm you have to pay for everything there's probably only a handful of free alcoholic drinks to use the safe there's a charge.  - The alcohol is very cheap after 2 glasses of wine I was absolutely destroyed and experienced an awful time.  - Poor Wifi  - The food was quite poor and sometimes undercooked. They did have a large bottle of still water on each table which was good. You also had to pay for the A la Carte restaurant (‚Ç¨25 per person) which looked awful anyway.    I had stayed at Iberostar just down the road from Dar Atlas last year and although a little more expensive it makes up for all of the above. The entertainment was by far better more things to do (darts trapezing games dancing shows) and there was a free shuttle bus to the city centre! It just felt cleaner and more warm. It truly felt like all inclusive and a genuine hotel.    Hope this helps anyone looking to book because if I had known all of this I most probably wouldn't have gone here.

Review_Date: HelenJ007 wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Booked last minute. Bit stressful as holiday company had not paid the hotel but sorted it out the next day. Then time to relax. Don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt speak French. Staff are so kind and look after the guests. Noisy pool and quiet pool so something for everyone. Food lovely. We just wanted a quick blast of sunshine and relaxation so this was ideal. Marrakesh def worth a few hours out of the hotel. One of those hotels you don‚Äôt have to think about anything - everything is easy and you can just enjoy yourself. I think you have to pay for baileys and drinks like that and all inclusive stops at 11pm. Pool towels included and worth getting a safe in your room. We changed English money into dirhams at the hotel which was fine or you can just use Euro‚Äôs. Enjoy. Lots of activities.Spotlessly clean. Great staff. Didn‚Äôt put the tv on but don‚Äôt think they have English channels which is perfect to have a proper break from home. Mozzie repellant a good idea. I forgot ours.

Review_Date: Luke P wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Title: Awesome Hotel. Food could be better!
Review_Text: We stayed here for a week 15th-22nd and the hotel is lovely. The pools are good size and plenty of sun beds. The entertainment is good but all in French (we are British). The nightclub was good and the all inclusive drinks options are good. The only issue was food was too salty and no really tasteful. Apart from pizzas at the snack bar!    We met Zakaria who was Guest Relations for the English speakers and our holiday was made 10 times better by Zakaria. He helped us around the hotel told us the good things to do in Marrakech and also warned us what to avoid. He couldn‚Äôt have been more helpful we feel like he became part of our group while away! Thanks Zakaria üëç
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: S G wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: My husband and I spent 7 days at the hotel. Staff was really helpful and friendly especially Yasmin who delivered above and beyond. The food was good there was always lots to eat. The only let down was on the alcohol all inclusive was only on local brands which was not good and after 9/10pm you had to pay for everything. The hotel is very clean and has good facilities. As a couple it would have been better to have a double bed instead of 2 singles. There was no iron which was annoying. Overall we had a good time and I would recommend this as a place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Carol11287 wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Stayed here for a week and had a lovely holiday with my parents. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful loads of amazing flowers to look at with wildlife walking around including Guinea Fowl ducks a hereon and a tortoise (a duck even took to swimming in the pool). The whole of the grounds were covered in orange trees.    The rooms were a very good size lovely walk in shower room plenty of space.    I am wheat intolerant and was worried about the food but in the restaurant as you walk in is an allergens board displaying the contents of the meals (which meant no puddings for me as they were all cake and biscuit based :( but plenty of fresh fruit). The meals were well cooked but cold at times. Each night was a different theme - which also meant different entertainment each night.    The bar was nice and cooling with plenty of space however the all inclusive was confusing to start with as nothing was explained. But there are certain drinks that you had to pay for and everyone had to pay for all drinks between 11 and midnight. The only problem with the bar is the barmen favoured the French who would get served first regardless of if you were their first. But one complaint to the correct person and all was sorted.    The right people to talk to are Zac and Yassmine. Their English was good and they were very helpful and friendly. Zac spent most evening talking to me and my parents he had some drinks with us and played games with us too. He displayed a very great interest in learning all he could.    We found a treasure just outside the hotel. Turn left and walk around 20 meters and there is a small pond. In which lived dozens of terrapins. Who we feed each morning - hand fed - with fruit from breakfast. We also took the time to remove all the rubbish from the pond.

Review_Date: Traveling family wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Together with my family we stayed there for 3 nights last week. The club is nice and we can't really complain about anything in particular the food is good and varied every day the rooms are tidy the pool is always clean and most of all we all agreed that the club's powerful asset is certainly its staff the reception teamthe restaurant'sthe pool's the room service's and the animation team : they were all very friendly and welcoming always smiling and ready to help whenever needed. We thank them all very much for making our stay very comfortable.  C/C: we will definitely go back there again üòÅ

Review_Date: Asia wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: We stayed there for 4 nights and loved this hotel. One of the workers named Zakaria greeted us soon as we walked in with a huge smile and good bants. As someone said the hotel caters to mostly French people but Zakaria (one of the few english speaking staff) really made us feel at home and made our whole experience there that much more memorable. It's a pretty hotel rooms are decent service is great food could be better (catered more to western pallets) and Wifi gets slow at times. Good access to city and excursions but you may be able to find cheaper packages looking yourself as we did with quad biking. Overall I can say we definitely want to visit again üëçüèæ

Review_Date: panjae wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: This hotel seems to cater for French speaking people ONLY.... the hotel is 10years old but its tired looking with many cracks in the walls so in need of TLC.... I would grade it as 2* not 4*-- All announcement's / notices are all in French ...(normally you get several other languages translated)...and very few staff speak English. (found only Yazmin Zak and Adam.) We booked all inclusive and told only Gin Vodka and Whiskey all other spirits and some soft drinks you had to pay for 60 Dur's each..... the food was soso ..birds flying into the dining room sitting on the bread and pastries pecking at the crumbs...... on several occasions we had no plates cups etc and difficulty getting seats. due to the volume of people 600+ Thursday onward .... they were like scavenger's piling food on plates as though there was no tomorrow.....That was not Club Dar Atlas fault but it would have made much more sense by them if there had been 2 sittings at meal times for that amount of people.... the restaurant staff tried to keep on top of the melee.

Review_Date: Danielle K wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: The hotel was clean and well looked after however the waiting and bar staff were so miserable and unfriendly it felt like asking for a drink for the group of 7 travelling was far too much and then to top it all off we each had money stolen from our rooms not a huge amount individually but enough to make us feel on edge and violated. The security and reception staff didn't seem to be bothered when we reported we had money stolen and didn't take us seriously until we threatened to involve the police. Yasmin and zachariah were very helpful and the only English speaking staff there to my knowledge and Salah behind the bar was the only member of staff to have a smile and excellent service throughout our stay. I've been to Morocco a few times and this was the worst experience I've had there I will not be returning to this hotel.

Review_Date: Dev77 wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: This is my 3rd time in Marrakech this was a girls holiday and there was 7 of us. The hotel is clean and tidy. The food has a good selection and always something to eat. We found Yasmin and Zackariya had a very good understanding of English and could speak English very good.This helped as we found not many other people could and also the hotel was mainly French people on their holidays here. This didn‚Äôt really matter as we learnt to communicate and if we really couldn‚Äôt we found someone who could. The bar staff seemed grumpy and everything seemed too much trouble for them at times!. We found Salah was the only one who smiled all day and was happy to help at all times and he made sure we had what we needed. On our second day in the evening we all discovered we had had money stolen from us all and when we confronted the hotel reception about this matter we were dealt with in the most disgusting manner. We were fobbed off to come back in the morning by the security man who told us they would look at the cctv. There was no apology that this had happened in this hotel. When we came back to reception again in the morning to be told they haven‚Äôt looked at it yet and the security man will find us by 12pm. He came and found us to tell us the cctv only showed us going to our room and the cleaner ! We were then told if we wanted to inform the police it would be days before they would investigate and we were flying home the next morning. When asked what would happen to the cleaner he told us she will be sacked. The hotels manager never came and speak to us and no money compensated. The next morning when we were checking out the cleaner was still working at the hotel as she walked passed us and we were all shocked as she had taken our money and nothing had happened! So be aware carry your cash with you at all times.  On a positive note the pool is lovely and clean.  I would not go back to this hotel again as this has put me off but would come back to Marrakesh.

Review_Date: 175Bromley wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: First time in Moroccoand to this hotel an amazing place so calm and relaxed set in beautiful grounds  Zacharia[Guest services]really made our holidaywe had a small problem at the bar getting served as they seemed to favor the Frenchalthough they all speak good Englishwe mentioned it to him and it was all resolved.  Take a short walk out of the hotel and turn left and you will find a small pond full of terrapinsthey love to eat small pieces of apple from your fingers.Food is plentiful with lots of choice there is even an allergies board in the restaurant that is updated for every meal. plenty of sunbeds but umbrellas could be an issue in the height of the season.we would highly recommend this hotel good for families and coupleslots of walking and a little hilly in places so would not recommend if you have any mobility issues

Review_Date: Rifhat T wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: it's a lovely place but unfortunately only two main English speaking staff- zakaria and yasmine who where great. also lovely service from girls at spa especially ayman and laila. not really a hotel for English speaking guest mainly French. enterainment was all in French. but staff are friendly and do try. the room was great and food was lovely. great to relax as very peaceful and birds song all day.

Review_Date: MSS wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: If you are not French, not for you
Review_Text: We stayed here for three nights short break.  Everything here is in French all signs entertainment and staff mostly speak French. When one of the girls came to us and started to speak French i just said we don‚Äôt speak that language and she walked away. So I think this shows already a lot.  Food could be better not so much choice and most of the time it was cold.  However they do have nice swimming pool and everywhere in the hotel is clean.  In the morning when we needed to check out staff was sitting on sofa and watching videos even not bothered you are waiting there on the reception desk.  I won‚Äôt be coming back.

Review_Date: Dale A wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: A fantastic and friendly hotel. We had a lovely time here very quiet and relaxing. The staff are brilliant Yasmin is extremely helpful and an asset to the hotel. Adam in reception is also a very welcoming member of staff as is Abdullah in the restaurant. Very warm and friendly I will definitely be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hazel C wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: No complaints at all. I think we may have been the only 4 English people in the hotel but this is certainly not a problem. We were made very welcome. All the staff speak English despite what you may read in other reviews. The entertainment is in French obviously as they have to cater to the majority. Food very good grounds and pool lovely. Rooms spacious and clean. Used the shuttle bus into Marrakesh without a problem. The medina and soukes where good fun wilts far less hassle than expected. Overall a lovely short break with no problems at all. Thanks to Yasmin and all the staff for making it a lovely holiday

Review_Date: Joana wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: This hotel is so nice and perfect. In first day when we came to the hotel we was so tired and so hungry because the trip and people was so kind with us the girl that work in the desk Yasmine she just cared about we eat and be nice and next that we do the chek in. We stay one week and the space is so big so clean they have so many pools oh and they have beautiful roses in all hotel. The conditions are so perfect the room is very clean and perfect. I just don't liked the internet the sinal was so bad but they say in that country the sinal are all the same. The people are amazing and so kind and care with us mainly the people that worked more with us in the reception Yasmine and Hayat and in the animation equipe Ahmed. They have so many animation for the kids and for everyone mainly dance and animation equipe was perfect and a excelent equipe. I love that hotel and if i can i will go came back there.

Review_Date: Patr√≠cia D wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: The hotel is very good is big haver ever thing de need. The food is good the peoples working in hotel is very nice e smile ever timeüòÅ. The piscine is clean. üòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÅüòÑI liked every thing I don't have nothing bad to stay about the hotel.

Review_Date: Murray wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: My wife and I recently stayed at Club Dar Atlas and was nicely surprised how lovely the hotel was and great value. The staff were friendly and welcoming and great service. There are several pools and a pool bar which served a good selection of drinks for all inclusive. As for the food breakfast was ok but lunch and dinners were perfect; a really nice selection for all.    Also the spa treatments were good albeit closer to UK prices but worth it.    Finally the hotel offers an hourly shuttle bus to the Medina for those game. Be prepared for a lot of aggressive sales and definitely steer clear of the snake charmers as they will want 20 Euros for them to put a snake around your neck they dont ask they just do it. That said if your game its pretty cool.    All in all I would come back to the same hotel for some April sunshine and great hotel.    Cheers
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jan Viggo Hilsted wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: A very good an quiet hotel despite its seize (320 double rooms in 20, two stories blocks)
Review_Text: A very good serviceminded hotel in splendid and safe surroundings inside its premises. With a very good a la carte restaurant and adult pool far from the reception main pool and restaurant. With good sports facilities (tennis with coach yoga etc. aprox. 1 km. jogging/service lane boul court table tennis badminton & volley ball court) which only need some better management in order to get the best out of it for both the guest and the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Forall786 wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: WiFi nearly had connection - gym non existent - indoor pool was cold.
Review_Text: WiFi nearly had connection - gym non existent - indoor pool was cold. Hotel floods every time there is slight rain. Water drainage needs to be created as non existent. Everywhere in hotel is catered around french and nothing for the English. The french guests aren‚Äôt friendly towards anyone and the way to get rid of french from reception area is to ask for money from them.

Review_Date: Suzy W wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Lovely Hotel set in Beautiful Grounds
Review_Text: Spent a week here in mid March the Hotel was better than we expected for the price we paid for a spring break. Lovely large room nice Hotel the grounds are really lovely. Staff on the whole are very friendly the grounds Hotel and Rooms are kept very clean and well looked after. Fabulous weather around 30 degrees each day. We loved the quiet pool which was very clean not a leaf in sight. Food was very varied and good something for everyone you would have to be very fussy not to enjoy the restaurant. The all inclusive drinks were a bit restricted which is not something we have experienced before. The rose wine was like nail polish remover I think they should change it I switched to red which was ok. On the whole a great holiday and I would recommend this Hotel to anyone looking for a break in springtime as the weather is fabulous and this Hotel ticks most of my boxes.

Review_Date: ALanders1 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: We had a 4 night stay at Club Dar Atlas. Our room was lovely clean & spacious. We found the food very nice and varied. The staff were all extremely helpful and friendly especially Yasmine on the welcome desk she really went out of her way to make us feel welcome. Also our room maid (Nabile or Nabine I think) was super helpful and a lovely lady. Would definitely stay here again.

Review_Date: Aine L wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: The grounds are beautiful and the food is lovely. The staff at the front desk and in the cafe are warm and welcoming but the staff by the pool seemed annoyed when I tried to ask them a question. The rooms are clean and nice very open feeling and fresh. The cleaning ladies are lovely. Overall though a very good experience and I highly recommend.

Review_Date: Jesper C wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Beautiful grounds, pools, ok rooms, nice a la carte restaurant, bad wifi, no fitness room
Review_Text: Beautiful and well-maintained grounds and pool-areas ok rooms very good breakfast buffet but odd that you have to pay extra for good orange juice (in the country with the best oranges in the world).  Administration of the shuttle-bus to Marrakesh was stiff and inflexible (booking receipt and payment).  The WiFi was bad which is not ok at a four star hotel.  The "fitness-room" was close to none having only one bike and nothing else!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Blokefromthebn17 wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Nice hotel where we had a raid for the duration of our stay.    Clean and basic with a warm shower and two single beds TV and fridge.    The hotel is very pleasant with a nice pool fantastic staff and decent food.    Each evening they put on a different menu (Spanish Italian etc) and whilst there is always the "stock" offerings these changes made the food feel different each evening .    The animation is decent although I should stress this is a predominantly french hotel. Most of the staff speak a decent level of English but the games and entertainment is in French. Worth considering if you plan on taking young kids and expect them to be entertained all day.    There is the odd bird in the dining hall small sparrow types who fly in via the open window this happens because the big doors are wide open during meal times.    There is very poor WiFi  outside of the main reception area it is limited however some might see this as a bonus if they want to disconnect from the world for a few days.    The hotel puts on a shuttle bus to the madina however these fill quickly. It's worth noting the hotel is about 20/25 min drive from the city.    All in all a great place to stay as long as the points made above are not essential.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: SalemBajram wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Food really good staff friendly and help-full especially girl at reception Yasmine. She is so nice friendly and helpful and also speaks english - she is head above others in any way.  Restaurant is full of birds and breakfast bowels needs to be replaced  Place is good room was clean but empty fridge not even water in the fridge.  Poor WIFI connection  Pools are clean and inside pool was warm enough  Spa and massage average  All around good place to visit
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michelle Biggins wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Great Place to stay and enjoy
Review_Text: The Hotel is so clean. The food is excellent with a great range to pick from every day.Stunning grounds and spacious rooms. Everyone was so friendly with a special mention to Yasmine who is very professional in her roleshe is a people‚Äôs person and always goes that extra mile.Entertainment team were good and the drinks were flowing nicely. Could not felt this place at all. Well done and THANKYOU to everyone at Dar Atlas for a great holiday.

Review_Date: dr_sadik wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: I went to a holiday with my family to the hotel it was very amazing from the room to the staff  Especially the guest services yasmine who was with us from the start of our stay there helping us in everything from translating to what we will expect in city.  Definitely will comeback

Review_Date: tracybabe wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: I visited for a few days at the end of February and my time at this hotel was beyond my expectations. The staff were extremely accommodating and friendly. They took their time to make sure we were okay and even one staff member came into the city with us to show us around on his day off. I would go back to this hotel in a heart beat

Review_Date: MPWinSend wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Lovey hotel wonderful grounds that are very well maintained food was great with lots and lots of variety but we cant thank the staff enough they certainty would always go the extra mile special thanks go to Jasmine and Hyat

Review_Date: Kristine Jensen wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: The hotel is very beautiful and the staff is WONDERFUL especially the receptionist Yassmine Markaoui (There‚Äôs also a very nice boy named Miggie working in the kid club who deserves a raise) so it‚Äôs a shame that there‚Äôs a few but pretty important issues with the place. Number one is the WIFI which was extremely slow during our stay and nonexistent in the rooms... and practically anywhere but the lobby and the cafe by the adult pool. The second issue was the location as it is more than a little work to grab a few things from a grocery store because the hotel is so far away from the city. Other than that the hotel is very pleasant.

Review_Date: Gibonigel wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: We stayed at Dar Atlas late January and found it excellent.6 of us went having 3 rooms which were very comfortable opening out into orange trees and olive as well.Although situated app 30mins outside off Marrakech there is a regular shuttle bus.The food was excellentcatering for many nationalities and different every day.Theres plenty of entertainment throughout the day and well into the early hoursbut the noise does not affect the rooms.Not many of the staff speak good English but try their best and were always pleasantpolite and helpful.Our stay was enhanced by Yasmine Markaoul who speaks very good EnglishYasmine was always on hand to help us and advise us should we need helpYasmine ended up being a good friend.We would recommend staying at this hotel and will be going back there.

Review_Date: kabir a wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Brilliant experience of Club Dar Atlas
Review_Text: My family and I stayed at Club Dar Atlas for a week from 12.2.19- 19.2.19 February 2019 it was by far one of the best experiences we have had the staff were all incredible they were always friendly kind and very hospitable. this includes the cleaning ladies the gardeners the restaurant reception and security staff.  We would like to thank all the staff for making our stay at the hotel so enjoyable.    My wife and I would like to especially thank Yasmine  who was exceptional she told us what to expect when we went out in to the town showed us around the hotel and its facilities and was always willing to offer support and guidance. She is a credit to your Hotel we will be recommending Club Dar Atlas to our family and friends.    Once again Yasmine and colleagues a Big Thank You from Mohammed Ali and Family  As Arnold says "we will be back"

Review_Date: Touijer M wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: We visited the club for a hole week and it was an awesome experience. We had a lot of fun over there and the staff was very nice and kind. The service also was excellent. The experience was very good and can‚Äôt wait to come back again.

Review_Date: Azizur Rahman wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: We stayed in the Club Dar Atlas Hotel for 5 nights. The hotel has friendly staff who are always willing to help. The guest advisor Yasmine was especially helpful and made our stay there a delight. She was always cheerful and would put the guests at the hotel before anything else. Also the hotel has a wide range of food and the room are very nice and clean. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone that are visiting Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Noura F wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: The best experience we had  I¬¥ve went to a short holiday with my friends I can't describe to you enough how amazing the hotel was. Especially yassmine the guest services who was extremely friendly and up to help at any moment.  Definitely will comeback.

Review_Date: Lyn Vanstone wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: We arrived at our hotel and were delighted. Our room was clean and plenty of space  Easy access to the main area. The food was really good and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. Yasmine was delightful happy helpful and always lots of information. Our stay was really enjoyable we will certainly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John S wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: The Dar Atlas Hotel Marrakech Morocco was brilliant we could not believe our eyes when we reached the hotel.(attached photographs) The hotel was fantastic the staff were brilliant especially Yasmin from guest relations at the reception. She was great she made contact several time a day to make sure all was fine and to check if she could help us in any way. Yasmin was like that with all guests she came in contact with and she is an absolute asset to the hotel. All the staff are trained to a very high standard especially the maid service and nothing was too much for them. The complex and garden‚Äôs were beautiful it even had an oasis style lake in grounds. The meals were excellent and you had so many different choices. (Vegan friendly) We will definitely will be returning to this fantastic hotel.

Review_Date: champkis wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Stayed here for 6 nights at New year's and it was a fantastic base for seeing Marrakesh as well as having a bit of comfort/ relaxing place to stay. We debated whether to stay in a Riad in the city but were so happy with our choice to stay here. It was great value for money and the hotel is perfectly connected to the old town area with a shuttle or easy by taxi either for when you want to see the city. The hotel grounds are beautiful.    The staff were AMAZING! I can't praise them enough... The entertainment crew were brilliant especially 'Miggy'. Yassmin the customer service rep was absolutely lovely and so friendly too. Our room was perfect- a good size very clean and comfortable. The food wasn't gourmet fancy or anything but it was decent especially the new years buffet which exceeded our expectations. The variety with the food is somewhat limited but there was always something whether it was chicken fish pasta pizza etc.    We used this taxi driver for some tours. He was very honest and really nice his name was 'Boudali' and his number is 00212 (0) 668359384. He does tours for cheaper than the hotel ones or if even you just wanted him for an airport taxi he was lovely.    Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel... We liked the location the all inclusive was handy nice rooms lovely staff and great value.

Review_Date: tahirhshah wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: A short break in Marrakech, Morocco
Review_Text: We stayed in Club Dar Atlas Hotel for three nights. This hotel is excellent value for money and we had a very enjoyable stay there. Rooms are clean and bright and the food is of good quality and variety. Dar Atlas is a secure place and set in very peaceful surroundings. Most of all the staff is very helpful and courteous. The hotel has dedicated English speaking staff (Yasmine) who took personal interest to make sure that our stay was comfortable and trouble free. We are happy to recommend this hotel to anyone who want to visit Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: James S wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Went to this hotel with 2 of my friends for a short and relaxing holiday.  When we arrived we were put in a very small room which was nowhere near big enough for 3 adults. They changed us to a much better room which was very nice.  The hotel and it's grounds are very nicely looked after and well maintained and the gardens are lovely.  Not so lovely was the food which was a mixed bag to say the least! The staff in the restaurant were generally very good and attentive but the food was normally only luke warm even as soon as they put it out. Worst bit about the restaurant was the large amount of small birds flying up to the food areas and eating it!  The staff were also a mixed bag there was a language barrier as the hotel seems geared towards French guests and some of the staff were lovely like in the restaurant bars and one very friendly lady in reception. The rest of the reception staff were not so friendly and helpful. We had a couple of issues that did not get dealt with very well.  I think with a few improvements this would be a very nice place to stay.

Review_Date: Toni A wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: When me and my 2 friends arrived they gave us a room that was not what we booked so we had to complain to get the room that we paid for. The second room was nice but only had 2 outlets to use to charge phones ECT.    One thing that we noticed about staff was that if you didn't speak French or Arabic then your out of luck as 85% of the staff do not speak English so they wouldn't even speak to you.    The hotel was nice but didn't really have anything to do there unless you pay for a shuttle or taxi to go to the city. All of the safety information is written in French aswel as all the information in the hotel so again unless you can read it you will have no luck to know what to do or where to go.    The food was a bad point on the trip if you like your food then I wouldn't recommend eating here as there was not a lot of choose even for all inclusive and some drinks you even have to pay for for example Orange juice. The food was never hot but Luke warm so by the time you reached your table it was cold. All pastrys where dry and hard. But to make matters worse there are birds in the dining/buffet room that like to help them selves from the buffet so you would be lucky not to get something with beak holes.    So all in all we would not recommended staying here unless all your going to do is sleep and/or you speak french.

Review_Date: Connector317580 wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: It was my first Christmas away from home and I was not disappointed. All the staff I spoke to spoke a good amount of English and they were so friendly and helpful. From the Nativity to Santa riding up on a camel it was magical for the children there. In particular Yasmine in Customer Services was always there whether for a quick chat or advising on where to go. Can't wait to go back.

Review_Date: emma k wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: I can not recommend this hotel enough! The staff were absolutely amazing and made our holiday. The reception manager on arrival couldn‚Äôt be more helpful. The restaurant manager made us so welcome was so friendly. Although the people that shone for us were Adam on reception great guy! And Yasmine in guest services fantastic girl very very helpful. Someone I will never forget!!!!    The food was great New Year‚Äôs Eve was spectacular!! Entertainment great! Generally brilliant? Like I say I cannot recommend this hotel enough!

Review_Date: carasavatovich wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Spent a week here over New year i had the most amazing time the hotel was perfect the rooms were cleaned everyday the grounds were absolutely amazing with orange trees all around... the staff could Not do enough for you.. the bar and restaurant staff always had a smile for you and the reception staff were brilliant and always went the extra mile for us... would like to give a special shout out to Yasmine she was helpful and lovely and spoke amazing English and was always there for any tips  Or questions can not wait to go back  Next New year

Review_Date: Sara light wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Booked a 3 night stay as we wanted to experience Marrakech on a short break before deciding if we wanted a longer holiday there the hotel itself was more than we expected very reasonably priced and we felt welcomed the minute we arrived especially by the lovely yassmine at reception who really went out of her way to make sure we had the best short stay experience we could have the rooms were lovely and trips out from the hotel were very organised food was amazing and plentiful one thing that really stood out was the cleanliness and attention to detailcan't wait to go back now for a longer stay see you in the new year yassmine üòò    Sara and Martin
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Deryck W wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: We stayed at the Club Dar Atlas for a short 3 night break in November via a Special Offer deal. First impressions were that the hotel was somewhat isolated but once inside we were very pleasantly pleased with the hotel and especially the stunning gardens - full of olive trees a massive lake with two fountains three swimming pools and thousands of white roses. We were on All inclusive and again were impressed with the range of food available at meal times. The downside for some might be the 20 minute or so trip into Marrakesh but a shuttle bus is available but as we found out this does need to be booked well in advance. Would we come to this hotel again? the answer is a resounding yes!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: LixLondon wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: I went to this hotel last week with 14 friends and family for my 50th Birthday. The hotel was quite quiet and the main clientel were French...... but the staff spoke good English mainly. The hotel was lovely the rooms clean and comfortable and very spacious. The staff amazing especially the Reception sorry i didn't have the name of the young lady but she was absolutely amazing.
