They also arranged a lovely cake on my birthday which was so kind. The enterntainment was good and the guys overseeing the entertainment were brilliant such good fun. The food was good and there was a lot of choice. The one criticism is that the birds flew in occasionally to the restaurant which wasn't good but this was only a small point as everything else was lovely. The pool was cold but to be expected this time of year but the weather was amazing so we were very lucky.    I would highly recommend this hotel if you need a mini break or if you need to recharge your batteries as it's very peaceful if that's what you want. It wasn't quiet when we were though ;-)

Review_Date: Caterina D wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Nice hotel few miles outside Marrakesh's city centre but connected every hour with a private hotel navette cheap and convenient. The hotel gardens are amazing rooms spacious and very clean. Food was good and the theme changed every night. We enjoyed the entertainment however please note this is a French hotel and not many people speaks english. Overall we had a great time took part in some of their activities and spent plenty of time discovering the city and Morocco in general.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ian_Stowe wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: Good for younger families in warm weather. Too far from town. Inefficient reception staff.
Review_Text: Stayed here as part of a two week tour of Morocco. It would be a good location for younger families in warmer weather. The place is well laid out with riad style buildings of two floors very nice gardens fairly spacious rooms two pools bar 3 restaurants tennis boules etc. We did not take the full board option as we wanted to visit the city frequently but we did eat in the buffet twice and the Ourika restaurant where we took the special sea food menu. The buffet had a large selection and different themes each night. However aside from local cuisine the food whilst reasonably good it bore little resemblance to the theme chosen on occasion - e.g. ‚ÄúMexican‚Äù looked and tasted like Moroccan. The Ourika meal was outstanding and both the waiter and chef efficient and courteous. These were the only two in the resort who really displayed professionalism: the front desk staff in particular were mostly young and very inefficient taking an age to do simple tasks. and making mistakes. We were also informed after the meal by the chef in the Ourika restaurant that the 25 euros we paid for our meal that included grilled prawns lobster and excellent desert was in fact just a supplement price for those on full board but there was NO option to order and pay for those not on full board. Hence our planned return for the deluxe meat menu was refused. When we arrived our room had clearly been used by a heavy smoker who refused to acknowledge the non-smoking rule and reeked of cigarettes. Having changed rooms twice we were happy - until the chill set in the next day and we found the A/C-heater did not work. It took five complaints over three days for something to happen and get heat.    Our tour was too rushed in the first week and we did not need 8 days in this place. With an age group in excess of an average of 60 in November with mixed weather and a location 15+ kms from the city it not the place to stay and would not be for a younger crowd without good and warmish weather.

Review_Date: Ryan schoppler wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: The hotel itself was very nice to look at very pretty.  Shuttle to Marrakech was handy (40 dh pp each way)  Food was pretty poor standard mainly French food like pastry etc for breakfast. Lunches were the best with Moroccan food but dinner time with the nightly themes were overall poor and We love our food... best night was Moroccan night on a Wednesday that‚Äôs the best night of the week for us with food and entertainment etc.  French staff aka reps one rep in particular was extremely rude to us on our first day. The other reps were nice enough but never came and said hello to myself and my partner all favoured French speakers. Spoke to two three other English people in the hotel who was staying and we all said we felt very isolated and felt not part of the ‚Äúfun‚Äù whilst on our holiday.    My partner and I decided to stay for a night in Marrakech at Riad Omar and that was MUCH MUCH better/friendly/full Moroccan experience and helpful with advice around Marrakesh etc felt like we was just dumped at our hotel so will book that Riad if ever came back.    Overall I did enjoy my holiday and Moroccan experience but did the hotel let it down (the French attitudes to us and staff) yes-! We said we wouldn‚Äôt be back to this hotel again but took it as a learning experience and the hotel itself was beautiful but felt it just wasn‚Äôt nice and friendly to stay. Sorry.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: lainey2809 wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Returned from a week at club dar atlas with the hubby .....where to start.....the room was cleaned every day and towels replaced daily no water in the fridge at all during our weeks stay although it wasn't a major problem. Food was good a vast variety and something different every night....the bar wasn't all that the beer was served in small glasses so had to get 2 at a time and you only get 3/4 of a glass. Before booking we weren't aware that it was a French speaking hotel with very little English used thus was fine for me as I can get by with basic French but my husband can't speak or understand any so would of maybe chose a different hotel. The animation team work hard and never stop..they speak little English but not much but still try to have a conversation with you. Had a lovely week away but won't be returning in the future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sl8rate wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Apart from confusion over the name (in some brochures it's Club Madina) The Dar Atlas turned out to be a very nice place to stay especially if you speak French. We just about managed to make ourselves understood with the aid of Google Translate.  Of course the rooms needed updating however ours was clean and comfortable and everything worked. We thought the food was very good and the extra bonus of freshly made crepes and beignets in the afternoon by the pool bar was an unexpected treat.  We enjoyed the pool area and the extensive grounds. The staff tried to be helpful despite language difficulties and the Animation Crew were enthusiastic and hard working.  With only a 3 hour flight from London and great weather all in all we enjoyed our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karen K wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Just returned from a week's holiday. Stayed in a standard room which was clean and comfortable however the bathroom could do with some updating. The public areas and gardens are very well maintained.  I looked for a hotel that specifically had a indoor pool if the weather was bad so was very disappointed that this was not included in the all inclusive package. The cost was higher than my local pool. There is plenty of food choices in the restaurant but it is very unorganised missing crockery utensils and cues.. Most of the the staff were very friendly and helpful however there was one bar person who was very rude and arrogant. He was of the view that it was his bar so unless you spoke in French you wouldn't get served.I could name him but I think the management know who he is. The entertainment staff tried their best but it is mainly done in French.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: KA10709 wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Just back from fantastic week at Club Dar Atlas in Marrakech. Thoroughly recommend this resort and hotel - beautiful gardens in hotel never seen so many types and colours of roses - the sight and scents will linger in memory forever. Great food and spoiled for variety of choices. Lovely dry heat with no humidity or mosquitos. Great facilities and entertainment. If time brush up on French before you go as not a lot of English spoken but enough to get by. Treat yourself to fab hassle free holiday and book now üòé
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: mohamedlebbar1 wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: A big thank you to all staff at Club Dar Atlas for a fantastic holiday we have been to many holidays over the years and none of them measure up to your outstanding hotel starting from the welcome received from the reception (Mr AdamMr Boubker) and rest of the team and especially the entertainment crew who made our stay even more enjoyable and a big thank you to the Moroccan gentleman Mr Mohamid who was part of the entertainment crew. the show also performed by the crew was spectacular.  We will definetely be returning    Mohamed Lebbar

Review_Date: Bhagvati wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Title:
Relaxed holiday Morocco Marakesh
30 July to 9th August 2018
Review_Text: üëå wonderful time at the Club Dar Atlas Marrakech hotel very welcoming people at hotel and always helpful and very caring all staffs the hotel is very clean everyday house keeping all rooms spotless roomsat the restaurant Amazing morroken food as we vegetarians we enjoyed all variety of food and morroken sweets and fresh fruits I really enjoyed morroken pan cakes very helpful staffs and the manager in restaurant is very caring well organised restaurant very hard working and keeps the restaurant up to date very clean with variety of foods hassania been very helpful for the information madina market and Adam at reception been very helpful outstanding entertainment every night with variety of performances and excellent quality team work all day time table activities for young children with entertainment team and activities for adult children children and I am really thankful to musa Ravi really enjoyed water polo with you and enjoyed darts and wollyball activities with you and other members entertainment team also thanks for the the outstanding entertainment at night with morroken music dance. I loved it all the entertainment at night again thanks for the entertaining to all entertainment team. My special thanks to mamaid(mohammed)Shahrukh Khan) that we call him thanks for singing hindi songs hit film of Shahrukh khan and making each movement so specialvery heart touching person and I never forget this special movements of Sharukh khan with you excellent feeling very happy thanks for all very very special holiday at club da atlas very thankful to all I have to say that all Marakesh fan of Sharukhkhan very lovely people of marekesh thank you for all your love and care. I have to say choose this hotel and have outstanding fun enjoy your holiday it is very very nice hotel with plenty of luxury entertainment spa swimming pool with activities shuttle buses to madina market very clean hotel and a rooms restaurant bar this was my very special holiday

Review_Date: Natalie W wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Two English girls in French hotel
Review_Text: Stayed here with a friend for a relaxing week in the sun we can‚Äôt fault it. It didn‚Äôt matter that we were two English girls staying in a mainly French speaking hotel all the team from reception and to the entertainment team ensured that we were well looked after and included in activities and night time entertainment. If any thing I think they were pleased to be able to practice their English.    The rooms were bright and airy and very clean.  Food was good and a large verity if your not a fussy eater.    We have stayed in and English speaking hotel in Marrakech before and we would choose this one over that if we were to return j

Review_Date: hann123 wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Relaxing short break with a friend
Review_Text: I stayed here with my friend last month for a short break and relaxation for a few nights. we spent most of the time at the adult pool which was very peaceful the hotel is surrounded by the most beautiful of gardens. I took advantage of the hotels spa Hamman i came out feeling rejuvenated.    The hotel offered a complimentary shuttle service to Marrakech which was really easy to get on and off from the main town the souks are just beautiful.    I found that the hotel staff were mainly French speaking but you do find this all over Morocco- however this did not spoil my holidays in fact i felt it refreshing and authentic. The rooms were clean and we found lots to eat at the restaurants and my friend is very fussy .    overall i had a very enjoyable few days in the sunshine!

Review_Date: S K wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Great break lovely staff and clean
Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights in May my husband and I wanted a break not to far away with great weather it was relaxing and the food was OK lots of deserts staff are really nice and the room was modern and clean spoke to hotel manager the hotel had new management and so many improvements have been made this year So i would recommend this hotel anyone wanted a break
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: spyder_steve wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Firstly Morocco is 75% speaking French it‚Äôs one of those things!    Recommendations  - Get a taxi thru your operator for return trip to the airport; the huge queues thru customs is a joke. (Approx 2 hours). Taxi is direct from airport to hotel and takes approx 20mins.  - taking a couple of pens to fill out entry forms when landed recommend filling forms out before landing or you‚Äôll regret queuing at the airport customs!  - have printed documents ready as hotel and security (at the hotel barrier) will struggle to find your booking (don‚Äôt rely on holiday apps)  - If you‚Äôve booked excursions thats not linked to the hotel or complex then you‚Äôll need to wait outside of the barrier it‚Äôs approx 2 mins walk and is perfectly safe let security know at the barrier.  - Pillows are small ask for a top up  - Entertainment is in French but to be fair it‚Äôs easy to understand what‚Äôs going on just chill and enjoy or dive into restaurant at 7:30pm while the French are being entertained!!  - Plugs are type F (Get type E&F plugs and you‚Äôll be fine)  - WiFi is available but only in restaurant and swimming pool area.  - There‚Äôs another pool thats peaceful but it‚Äôs away from all the activities. A la cart√© has to be booked in advance at the restaurant itself (other side of hotel) but the menus are confusing as it lists things you may need to pay for - confusing!  - Has a relaxing Sisha bar (traditional Arabic hooka) that is completely free to use.  - We had trouble getting into room with keycard solution: put it in and out very quickly and the door unlocks.    Negatives  - The shower room floor is slightly HIGHER than main bathroom so prepare for plenty of floods from the shower! That goes into main room; Solution: put a towel near the step of shower and it soaks most of it up.. god knows why there isn‚Äôt a shower curtain!  - Huge confusion what they charge extra for at the bars freshly squeezed orange juice and ‚Äònamed‚Äô alcohol is chargeable look at the menus and it‚Äôs really easy to get confused what is inclusive and what isn‚Äôt don‚Äôt pay for any additions if your all-inclusive! Drinks Menu are in French (easy to work out what they are) they will try and sell you drinks that are chargeable.  - drinking Cups are small so expect to run back and forth quite a bit to the bar.  - This IS IMPORTANT: pre-paid MasterCard‚Äôs do NOT work at the at hotel‚Äôs cash machine this can cause problems as there is NO where else to take cash out Debit cards work fine.  - tui reps don‚Äôt have credit/debit card machines so excursions are very difficult to book unless you do it online (very expensive though.)  - TUI Rep‚Äôs are a waste of time she left us in real trouble coming back as we didn‚Äôt know what time we were being picked up she ignore calls and messages and didn‚Äôt put notices up regarding collection from hotel when we finally left she still hadn‚Äôt put notices up; TUI emergency helpline also declined to help. Pick up times are 3 hours before flying.  - Hotel does not keep reps numbers: this is a sad thing if you get into trouble or need help.    Positives  - Water and fruit is in your room ready upon arrival.  - hand/shower gel is in the bathroom and shower (same make as they use in premiere inn‚Äôs (aloe Vera)  - Hairdryer is included in bathroom  - English is limited but staff and entertainers do their very best to help the English; speak slowly and keep it simple and they will understand you.  - The meals are of a very very high standard - expect the continental sausages which look and taste like plastic! Not keen on the Spanish menu - chopped turkey with bones in fish lasagna mushed oliver inside rolls of bread...really?!  - Drinking Water comes in 1.5L bottles and is completely free.  - Resort is clean hygiene is fantastic. Meals are well above outstanding staff are brilliant pools are crystal clear but be warned: swimming pool water is cold!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: berikaSweden wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: We came to this hotel full of expectations But unluckly they where not fulfiled  Was promised beautiful rooms got small dark no chair to sit only 3 beds thats all. Bathroom no towelhanger no washingline no shampoconditioner bodylotion This suposed to be a All Inclusive hotel Shower did not work very well. A hotelphone but nowhere how it worked. Nothing telling you about the aria and surrounding and the hotel as you can find in any hotel with class 4 ****  Was also promised a big gym fully equiped ..... 1bycycle 1rowmachine as not worked  Also the cakebuffe for the coffetime as promised and we got a beautiful photo of we never got to see or taste    The poolaria was very nice and clean and the girl HAYAT at the reception tried to do her very best for all of us  I am sorry to say but this was not the DREAMHOTEL as we expected.

Review_Date: Lisajo1 wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: The hotel was beautiful and super clean the staff were friendly and couldn't do enough for us and the food was awesome! For the first time ever I can honestly say I enjoyed all the food from an all inclusive hotel My husband is super fussy and usually only eats pasta from an all inclusive this time was different and he enjoyed every single meal he had the food was cooked fresh in front of you and it was a different theme every night. Moroccan night was my favourite! The wine was lovely again something I don't usually drink at an all inclusive hotel (we put this down to the hotel being predominantly French) Bonus!!  We didn't arrive until later so the fresh fruit and water in our room on arrival was a welcome site - the oranges are awesome :)  We spent most of the time at the adult pool This was lovely the pool was clean and the walk albeit long was through the most beautiful of gardens. Only non alcoholic drinks are included at the adult pool (this did us a favour actually) We used the hotel bus to go into Marrakech had no problems There isn't much in English and my husband and I speak very limited French it would have been nice for some of the menus and information to be translated but we did not find this a problem we just had to use our common sense for most things and as we both have quite chatty jobs we thoroughly enjoyed the peace and quiet. We both had the hammam massage too from the hotel spa - highly recommended. The entertainment looked great and the animation team put a lot of effort in. We didn't understand much of what was going on but the French seemed to be having a great time to be fair we did do our research first and knew that all entertainment would be in French. A big thank you to all the staff at the Hotel for making us feel so welcome - We would certainly come back to this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Amy wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: Hotel is fine food is great (in a typical Spanish style all inclusive cattle market kind of way) hotel clean enough staff working very hard and pool area nice but very busy and not enough umbrellas.  Although I would hate to be surrounded by vulgar "brits abroad" types it would be helpful if some of the signage and menus had an English translation rather than only French. All the staff and other guests spoke only French animation team did not speak to us after discovering we were English we could not take part in any form of entertainment as it was in only French. We made an effort to speak as much as we could though our French is limited so did not get much past the "how are you's".    The hotel was advertised as "FREE WIFI" though this only applied to the reception area and even then it was slow and patchy.    We did not use the shuttle bus spa or a la carte restaurant as we were not explained how to book only given a printed sheet allas all in French! We tried to ask a few things at reception but communication was extremely difficult. We spent over half the week out on tours using expensive taxis or pre-booked trips... the hotel being quite far from Marrakech so not exactly walking distance!    I would not stay here again and would advise any British travellers to stay closer to the Medina!

Review_Date: Sheils48 wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: The grounds of this hotel were beautiful with an avenue of rose bushes as you walked to your room. They were all immaculately maintained by the garden staff. The quiet pool was more to our liking and any children were quickly sent packing if they decided to use it!!!!! The rooms were plenty big enough with a shower / wash area and a separate toilet.. The restaurant was quite large and this made it a bit noisey at the busiest times. There was plenty of variety of food and it was always very well displayed but it wasn't always hot enough for our liking. There was usually a chef cooking fresh fish meat or burgers and at breakfast they cooked omelettes or fried eggs.

Review_Date: Billmarge wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: I stayed a week as part of the tour I took with RSD Travel. The weeks stay was supposedly the 'free week in Marrakesh' which followed the weeks tour. This did not prove to be free neither was it in Marrakesh but 15 kilometres away.  It was not a hotel I would ever have chosen. The majority of guests were French families who did appear to be enjoying themselves but it was not for me. All animation was in French. Although the buffet food was acceptable and nicely presented we dined in what was a canteen. Unless you arrived early you did not have the paper place mat knife and fork and glass and had to go in search.  As a positive the gardens are magnificent. We arrived when all the roses were in perfect condition and the pathways were enchanting. The hotel is organised in riad formation I was in a ground floor room which was basic but neat tidy and kept clean but it was 320 paces away from reception bar and dining room and was a bit too far is you had left your book!  There is a shuttle bus which runs regularly into Marrakesh this has to be pre-booked in advance both ways and cost 20 dirham each way. Two pools are inviting although one is a family pool the other is for adults only.

Review_Date: Brian99993 wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: The hotel is used by a number of mass tourist operators with the result that the guests have different views on what is good. We came across a number of people who had to move to another room because of a number of issues with the air conditioning hygiene or faulty doors. We almost moved because the air conditioning stopped working with a block of ice missing my wife by a whisker. We were offered a new room but when we went to look at it the key did not work. It was so late at night that we decided to stay put and the next day the air con was fixed. The food seemed OK at the beginning of our week there but then got worse. There is an ice cream station but not all the time. The food is varied and the staff are friendly and try their best. The trouble is that the maintenance at the rest of the hotel is not up to standard. The rooms are comfortable with good television reception (including CNN). There is only washing gel and shampoo that is dispenses from a machine both at the wash basin and in the shower. The toilet is separate from the bathroom which is a useful feature. There are three pools one is an inside pool of around 12.5 metres.  The staff try their best at entertaining the guests and frankly at the price it is not too bad There is a shuttle bus service to Marrakech and a number of outside activities such as spending a night at the Berber camp in the Sahara. The all inclusive is slightly bizarre as it does include espresso coffee or fresh squeezed oranges. The oranges in Morocco are absolutely deliciously so peel them and continue savouring a wonderful fruit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: johnwhiteBournemouth wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Hotel is VERY tired needs updating URGENTLY. Gardens fantastic Ducks  pea hens wonderful Get your towels on the beds early or forget it !!! Lunch is certainly worth missing Dinner is a better choice All inclusive is a bit of a joke extra for Orange juice coffee and the Hamman WHY ?? Drink as much as you can to blot out the bad experiences and you will survive.

Review_Date: Ali0404 wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: Visited in November 2016 with two sisters.  Room was ok a bit tired. Ground floor with a terrace overlooking pool bar/cafe.  Check in was a little difficult due to translation but hey being English we could try harder to learn some phrases...so I'll take responsibility for that!  Hotel mainly caters to the French (from France!) That comment was not a criticism)  Food was ok plenty of it but everything seemed to be lukewarm. We could not figure out how the service worked in the restaurant/buffet...we were told we couldn't have water then we could we never got any alcohol with our meal despite asking! It was very bizarre!  There didn't seem to be any consideration by other guests for queuing...(sorry not sorry I'm British we queue!!)  Couldn't get coffee after certain times which seemed a little odd to me!  Entertainment team were very friendly and always said hello and some even remembered we weren't French which I found quite nice...attention to detail.  There were some members of staff who went out of their way to help...some didn't!  We generally felt a little ostracised but that could be due to language barriers...see above comment!  Shuttle bus available for 20 dirhams (each way) you have to pre book both legs of the journey but it does make visiting Marrakesh a little easier.  Absolutely loved the madness of Marrakesh crossing a road is an achievement and we laughed so much (possibly in disbelief and relief at having made it).  Would recommend Marrakesh and the Moroccan's in general are charming but the hotel was a mixed bag some good some bad. So I'd probably opt to stay elsewhere when I return (because I do hope I will!)

Review_Date: pgtips26 wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: We stayed here for 10 days in November.It wasn't our first choice but our original hotel closed for refurbishment. We booked All Inclusive but the truth is a lot of things aren't included so it should actually be called Part Inclusive!  The rooms are quite basic. The maid was friendly and worked hard.  The food generally was average with a few nice dishes on occasion. The waiters were friendly especially Abdellah who was excellent.  The weather was good so we spent most days at the quiet pool which was really nice. Just a shame the bar there is only Part Inclusive.  The bus into the city was efficient.  We had a nice stay but we won't be going back to this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Arhouni A wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: The room is average  the buffet is average too maybe below the average! They need to look after the quality of there product But the garden is wonderful ! It hase a great external area ! The the animation team is top!

Review_Date: Kerry-87-db wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: After reading some reviews was a little dubiaous about going. Once we arrived we was taken to our room which was spacious. The morning came and we was greeted by one of the animation team touteef (apologises for spelling) and what a warm welcome he said not many English stayed at this hotel. Later in afternoon we was greeted by Assan of the animation team who English was outstanding and got the word around that we was English ( by now we understood there were not many of us). Fatimia another member of animation team came to say hello and asked if she could practice her English. In addition the animation team are all amazing and have their specialists no one need to feel isolated within the walls of the hotel. With games and workshops in the day to shows at night which are all professionally delivered. We once had dinner with the director who spoke about the hotel and morroco with such love and passion it was endearing. Our rep was amazing also only a phone call away if needed. The rooms clean and the food is amazing if you can't find something you like you are either very picky or enjoy to complain.  There is also a club in the hotel which wasn't very busy but went there a few times with French friends i had made. All in all after visiting many places in north Africa i can say Morocco as a country is need of a visit and although hotel seems to be im middle of nowhere it is a must. I have already booked to come back multiple times. Both on my own and with family again. This hotel is the french Thompson version so there will be majority French. Just let staff know you are English and you will be included.  Your holiday is what you make it.  Much love xxxx

Review_Date: Rajia B wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: The hotel was nice and clean all the time. Shame about the bedroom it was not clean and had ants all on floor and few on bed. The shower was not the hot and tiles were horrible like it's not been cleaned. The staff were wonderful shame about the bedroom. I didn't like the food at all but my partner did. It's a place for the French because the hotel was full of French people and only 4 English couple Over all it's been nice but hard with the language barrier
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: arquk wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: Ignorant manager non existent customer service poor room maintenance. I booked the holiday to celebrate my daughter's and my birthday and informed staff on arrival and on the day the dinner venue I booked at the hotel was cancelled on arrival in the evening without notice leading to embarrassment for me and reduced my daughter to tears. I made an appointment with the manager personally but on the day he was "busy".  I hope the owners of the hotel take note.

Review_Date: cheryl e wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: Just got back from this hotel. At first a little bit concerned as it is well out of the city and nowhere within walking distance. Needn't had worried excellent shuttle bus to city centre.  Had read mixed reviews on here about the food. All I can say is if you can't find something you like then you must be a really picky eater.  When we arrived we soon found that we were 3 of the only 5 British in the hotel all the other guests were French. No problem the brilliant animation team soon made us feel welcome and special thanks to assan who translated the demonstrations for us. The entertainment was none stop and of a very high standard. The hotel director Sabir also went out of his way to ensure all staff practice their English.  There where more coming in as we left.  Will definitely return. The accommodation was clean spacious and well decorated.

Review_Date: Ellie-Mae S wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: After visiting this resort for a total of 5 nights we can honestly say this resort couldn't have been any better...  When we first arrived we was greeted by the manager of the resort and was told our bags would be delivered up to our room when it was ready (we arrived before the check-in time we was given however the room was ready within a speedy time of an hour). In the meantime we took advantage of the bar that was very close to reception and enjoyed the beverages whilst sat in the sun! We was then greeted by one of the animation team Hassan who impressed us with his English language skills! He in particular and the rest of the animation team made us feel very welcome and at home since we were one of the very few English families staying at the resort!  The food was honestly to die for! Each day the kitchen staff worked extremely hard to deliver a variety of dishes suitable for different palettes. There was a Buffet for breakfast lunch and dinner and on a nighttime the food sometimes had a theme linked to the entertainment (e.g. Morrocan Fiesta etc.)  As I have previously mentioned the animation team were outstanding not only on the evening but during the day too! They worked hard to encourage guests to take part in the daily tournaments including: volleyball tennis football and boules. The disco on an evening was wonderful with a mix of different music types some English and some French. The animation team also worked hard with the children of all ages having a mini-club and a teen club which kept everyone entertained!  Our room was very spacious and came with a balcony to look out on the wonderful view that surrounded us. The beds were comfortable and was decorated in traditional Morrocan throws and cushions. In addition to this it was only a short walk to the family pool and quiet pool and therefore could get to the sunbeds quicker!  Overall this resort made our trip to Marrakesh so enjoyable and I would recommend this resort to any family wanting to stay at an all-inclusive and have an amazing time. The only thing I do regret is not saying goodbye to Hassan and the animation team however hopefully we shall see them again on our next trip!  Hopefully you have found this useful Thankyou for reading!

Review_Date: alndi wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: Arrived at the Hotel after a good flight and transfer. Eight people in our party but check in was very lengthy as the guy could not speak English. Porter took us to our rooms through lovely grounds. Lights were not working on the stairs to our block and the Porter just shook his head. The rooms were spacious with lovely white bedding and fluffy towels. However we had a ant infestation in our room so did my sister in law. Rang customer liaison but they put the phone down on us several times due to the language barrier!    The next morning we went to reception and they couldn't speak English. The bar staff and entertainment staff only spoke French and favoured the French guests like serving them first. We did complain but to no avail. The Manager promised that things would change but they didn't. No Thomson notice board so no idea about return pick ups. All signs in case of fire in French.    Food was ok but needed to be hotter. Gin vodka and wine was awful and no Martini on the all inclusive package. Drinks and food at the quiet bar also not covered on the all Inclusive but not mentioned on Thomson website.    Grounds and setting beautiful just a shame that Thomson Holidays don't care about there paying customers. Did write to them but there reply did not answer my question so I replied and there second reply was even worse! Still waiting for a sensible response from them.    Would definitely not recommend this Hotel or Thomsons in the future to anyone.    We were a party of eight but I would imagine a couple travelling g also e would feel very vulnerable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: 71Paola2012 wrote a review May 2016
Review_Title: Rooms outdated, poor cleaning service...but polite and afable customer service
Review_Text: We stayed three nights over here after a tedious welcoming in Casablanca airport and a long drive from there. We arrived pretty late (11pm) and our room was waiting for us (#915) We are a family of three and we had to let them know we needed one extra bed. Already there was a sofa bed. They came in around 10 min. always with a friendly approach. After leaving our luggage we went to the restaurant but unfortunately it had already closed at 22:30 (evening buffet) however they offered us to have a sandwich and fruit. Once again in the room we wanted to have a shower and I realised of the horrible mildew stains on the shower ceiling and in between the tiles... Once again I went to the reception to complain about this. I wanted to get another room or get it cleaned! Obviously it was abit late to get changed but sent immediately someone to cleaned thoroughly the ceiling and tiles. Next day I asked again to have it all cleaned and could smell the bleach everywhere.  In summary on photos looks very impressive but bear in mind that things do not work at a high level. Amazing staff but obviously they do what they can and you see clearly there is no investment on revamping the premises.

Review_Date: Karim B wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: Good hotel for a small budget
Review_Text: Good hotel for a small budget. First marmara club experience unfortunately not convinced by the concept in comparison to Pullman / Meridien / Sofitel. Nevertheless good value for small budget. In Marrakech it seems possible to find better hotel especially on the buffet (little variety of food).  +++the place  --- the buffet entertainment bathroom bedding and no fridge

Review_Date: Kathi H wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: This Marmara resort needs updating. The staff is friendly. The property is expansive with a lot of potential. the pools are inviting. The tennis courts look fine. There are activities for kids. The food selection is very varied and plentiful. The rooms need updating. The bathrooms are not well kept although they are clean. We had a flood in the room because of a missing panel in the shower which allowed the water to flow under the "wall" into the room. The tiles on the walls are slapped on with inconsistent grout. Rooms can be noisy since walls are thin. Many lights were out in the corridors making it difficult to see after dark. Too far from the center of Marrakech.

Review_Date: Eleanorann O wrote a review May 2014
Review_Title: Away from the noise and bustle of Marrakech
Review_Text: Clean attractive hotel with beautiful grounds about 15 kilometres from the centre of Marrakech. This might make it less than desirable for those who want to be constantly in the thick of things but we found it made a nice change returning to the hotel each evening. There is a navette which runs regularly between the hotel and the centre for 2‚Ç¨ each way the downside being that the last navette runs from the centre at 2015 which makes it a bit early if you want to savour the sights and sounds of Jemaa El Fna by night and you definitely should experience it by night.  The hotel has two pools the main one gets really noisy but there is a smaller and quieter one beside the spa area but you have to get there early to stake out a place.  The hotel caters almost exclusively to a French clientele and in the school holidays I can imagine it would be hell on earth for those who relish a quiet environment. When we went there it was fine and honestly the price in relation to quality makes it excellent value for money.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Olivier L wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: Went last week to Dar Atlas hotel  through Marmara and had a very good time there. The rooms are very good swimming pool and entertainment first class! Just one thing could be improve is the restaurant; not it's bad but there is definitely some room for improvement considering how good the rest is. Will definitely come back if pass by Marrakesh again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ian Millar wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Text: price vs quality you cannot complain. pick up from the airport was good. arrived late evening and they kept the restaurant open for us.  rooms: VERY clean our housekeeper was very nice. there is free wifi which works but bandwidth is very low. air conditioning was very good and the bathroom clean.    Restaurant and bar: overall good bit hit and miss on the quality but cannot complain. was never really overcrowded. only complaint was that the drinks were never really cold. you can go the bar and get bottles of water as you want. the beer is ok as well as the rose. lots of soft drinks for the kids.    the pool is large and was very nice. you need to get to the pool quite early to get a sun lounger. people leave their towels on them to reserve. reception open 24 hours.    excursions are organised. we did camel ride and moto cross. not too expensive but really hot.    overall a great week this is not 5* but you get what you pay for. no major complaints
